did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, New York, to the MARQUIS DE LAFAYETTE.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, New York, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Richmond].

scopecontent.p: Plan for regular family correspondence. Messages from Mrs. Waters (née Rittenhouse) and Mrs. Trist. Arrival of furniture from Paris. France is emitting great sums of paper money. Possibility of war. Price of wheat. Mentions Maria Jefferson and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [219]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: Boyd XVIII, 141-42.

scopecontent.p: Col. Bell at Charlottesville will forward reply. Letters to Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Martha, and Maria. Letter from Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. at Richmond. House in Philadelphia. [2460]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Francis E. Shine. #3509.

scopecontent.p: Recipient's copy of item [2460]. [2461]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES BROWN.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Furniture to be forwarded from Norfolk to Monticello. [220]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Mazzei authorizes sale of Colle. Possibilities of purchasing [Edward] Carter's land adjoining. Instructions for planting sugar maple and paccan (pecan) nut trees. Official account of the western expedition. Wheat prices. Mentions [Nicholas] Lewis. [221]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON Philadelphia, to THOMAS McKEAN.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Opinion of the Attorney General on Philip Wilson's application. [222]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: Randall II 15 (extract); SNR 191-192.

scopecontent.p: A scolding letter requesting that she write. Furniture delayed. Mentions Maria Jefferson and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [223]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [?].
did.physdesc: AL. Fragment. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. Intermediate page only; beginning and end missing. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Payments to Kippen, Richard Randolph, Capt. William Meriwether, and Mr. Walker. Mr. Harvie and Mr. McCaul paid by Thomas Walker. Mentions Presque Isle. [2462]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON NOTES ON CLIMATES OF PHILADELPHIA AND MONTICELLO.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. McGregor Library, #3620.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON NOTES ON EXPENSES.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. Fragment. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Prices in Philadelphia. Note on verso mentions expenses of personnel in the Foreign Affairs and War and Marine offices. [2464]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON DESIGN WITH SKETCH FOR DESK.
THOMAS JEFFERSON LIST OF LAND HOLDINGS.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp.; silked. #2260.

scopecontent.p: Lists more than 5000 acres in Monticello, Shadwell, and his other tracts in Albemarle County, plus 474 acres deeded to Philip Mazzei et al. for the purpose of maturing wine. Also listed are 157 acres including Natural Bridge in Rockbridge County, and a lot in Richmond. Details all patents and conveyances from the original patent until the land was deeded to Peter or Thomas Jefferson. Portions of his lands had passed through the following hands: Nelson Anderson, William Byrd, Edward Carter, John Carter, Jonathan Clarke, ----Crawford, Thomas Garth, Thomas Graves, John Harvie, Edwin Hickman, James Hickman, Thomas Hickman, William Hickman, James Marks, Walter Monsley, William Randolph, Robert Sharpe, John Smith, Joseph Smith, Philip Smith, and Thomas Smith. Mentions Lord Dunmore. [225]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON TABLE OF MILEAGES, GEORGETOWN TO MONTICELLO.
did.physdesc: AD. 4 pp.; Barrow. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5118.

scopecontent.p: Lists Bentivoglio, Gordon's, Orange Court House, Downey's Ford, Stevensburg, Norman's Ford, Elk run Church, Slate run Church, Gaines's, Bullrun, Songster's, Fairfax Court House, Falls Church, Rapidan, Robinson, Culpeper Court House, Hedeman, Jefferson, Fauquier Court House, Lacy's Leesburg, Knowland's Cross Roads, Frederick, Md., German's Gap, Kennerly's, Narrow Passage, Woodstock, Stover's, Zane's, Winchester, Threetons, McCormack's, Harper's Ferry, Strode's, Somerville's mill, Wren's, Ravensworth, Richard Fitzhugh, Greenwich, Madison's Cave, Gilbert's, Colchester, Dumfries, Thomas's, Jones's, Thomson's, Newgate, Georgetown ferry, and Alexandria. [2467]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. McGregor Library, #1223. Printed: Randall II 15; SNR 192.

scopecontent.p: Angry that she has not written. Mentions Charlottesville. Incorrectly dated 1790. [228]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: SNR, 158.

scopecontent.p: Angry that she has not written. Mentions Charlottesville. Incorrect date of 1790 corrected by T. J. [2468]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Angry that she has not written. Mentions Charlottesville. Duplicates items [228] and [2468]. [2469]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [FRANCIS] EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Had hoped to see John Wayles Eppes, but house not done. Peace between Great Britain and Spain has affected American produce unfavorably. Mentions John Hanson, crops, Elizabeth Wayles Eppes. Increasing demand for wheat in France. [2470]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [FRANCES] EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Duplicates item 2470. [2471]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Two 19th century copies, one by Cornelia Jefferson Randolph. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: News from William Short in France: sale of church lands, riot in Paris which destroyed M. de Castrie's furniture. Copy of the Encyclopédie and of Buffon's works for Mr. Randolph. Needs warm stockings. Letter for a neighbor from Paris. Mentions Maria Jefferson. [229]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to DAVID STUART.
did.physdesc: LS. 1 pp.; backed with white paper. #8122. Printed: B of R VI 444 (MS. in DLC) .

scopecontent.p: Mr. Carrol[l] will not act as one of the commissioners for the federal seat. President thinks Major L'Enfant qualified to make a survey of the ground. [230]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to GEORGE MASON.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Copied for N. P. Trist ca. 1830. #38-414-a. Printed: L & B VIII 123-125; Ford V 274-276; B of R VI 316 (letterpress copy in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Importance of the French Revolution in preventing our falling back to the halfway house, the English Constitution. Fears effect of fiscal arrangements by our government. Need to augment numbers in the House of Representatives to give more representation to farmers. Madison's esteem for Mason. Is endeavoring to get distinction for the French, our useful customers. Send copy of a report. [231]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES BROWN.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson asks Brown to forward a commission about a tobacco sale to D. Hytton, or in Hytton's absence to execute it himself. A letter for a Captain Colley is also mentioned.

did.unittitle: MARIA JEFFERSON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: SNR 193-194.

scopecontent.p: News of Martha Jefferson Randolph and her daughter, Anne Cary Randolph. [232]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.#5533. Printed: SNR, 159.

scopecontent.p: Martha's baby, Anne Cary Randolph. Sends John Gregory's Comparative view of the state and faculties of man with those of the animal world for Martha. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. and Jennie. Spanish and harpsichord lessons. [2472]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; silked. #38-576. Another MS. in MHi. Printed: SNR 193; Randall II 16.

scopecontent.p: Recipient's copy. Martha's baby, Anne Cary Randolph. Sends John Gregory's Comparative view of the state and faculties of man with those of the animal world for Martha. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. and Jennie. Spanish and harpsichord lessons. [233]

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp.; Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Progress in his reading. Birth of Anne Cary Randolph. Rage of the people of Albemarle against him (Garland) has abated. Sam Carr's contract with John Carr for Mrs. Reddick's dower. Peter Carr at Monticello. Request for a watch. [234]

did.unittitle: MARIA JEFFERSON, Varina, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: 19th century copy of extract. 1 pp. Owned by the Misses Margaret and Olivia Taylor. #8937.

scopecontent.p: Compliments Martha Jefferson Randolph. Mentions Sallie Cropper. Incorrectly dated 1796. [2472-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON CUSTOMS DECLARATION.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5385-ac.

scopecontent.p: Acknowledges account for samples of wine of Portugal imported from Lisbon on the ship Phoebe Williams. Duties owed to Collector, District of Pennsylvania. [2472-b]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to DANIEL S. HYLTON.
did.physdesc: L .1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests information on shipment of the vis-a-vis. Possibility of marketing tobacco in Philadelphia. [235]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Mrs. Trist and Mrs. Waters have inquired for Martha. Hopes she and baby are well. Mentions Maria and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. Letter for Justin P. P. Derieux. [236]

did.unittitle: MARIA JEFFERSON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Philadelphia].
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: SNR 195-196.

scopecontent.p: Furniture has arrived. Naming of the Thomas M. Randolphs' daughter. Mentions Jenny and Mrs. Fleming. [237]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests that she list appearance of everything animal and vegetable so as to compare climates of Monticello and Philadelphia. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Miss Jenny [Randolph?], Martha Randolph, and Anne Randolph. [238]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Francis E. Shine. #3509. Printed: SNR, 159-60; Betts, Garden Book, 160-61, extract.

scopecontent.p: Requests that she list appearance of everything animal and vegetable so as to compare climates of Monticello and Philadelphia. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Miss Jenny [Randolph?], Martha Randolph, and Anne Randolph. [2473]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to ANDREW DONALD.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Concerning his portion of the debts of estate of John Wayles, his father-in-law. Refers Donald to Francis Eppes as executor. [239]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Charlottesville-Richmond mail service. Randolph's researches into the opossum. Crossing a dog and a wolf. His diary. Wants to read Buffon's Histoire Naturelle and the Encyclopédie. Health of Maria, Martha, and Anne Cary Randolph. Martha, Dr. John Gregory, and Mrs. Fleming disagree on baby food. Mentions Georgetown. [2474]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to WILLIAM BROWN.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN LAMB, New York.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: To the Collector for the Port of New York concerning dutiable articles, including newspapers and pamphlets. Mentions Captain Bayley. [241]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to ADAM LINDSAY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for forwarding books for public use from W. Nelson. Order for moulded myrtle wax candles. [242]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Suggests name of Anne for his granddaughter. Plans to sell his tobacco in Philadelphia. President's trip to Richmond, Va., Charleston, S. C., Savannah and Augusta, Ga. Mentions Martha Randolph. [243]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [WILLIAM BROWN?].
did.physdesc: ALS. Fragment. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Last page only. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Originally calendared as [1794].

scopecontent.p: Tobacco sold to Messrs. Adams, Perkins, Buchannan, and Brown. Richmond merchant has books. [2538]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [JAMES] MAXWELL.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Order for Hughes [Hewes] crab cider. Furniture forwarded to James Brown at Richmond. [245]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [JAMES CURRIE].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Fragment. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Reason for Mr. Potter's inability to pay two notes. [246]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [JOSEPH] FENWICK, [Bordeaux].
did.physdesc: L. 3 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requesting Fenwick's aid in presenting the case of Justin P. P. de Rieux, to de Rieux's uncle, M. Le Roy of Bordeaux. Despite de Rieux's worth and hard work, he is in straitened circumstances and needs help. [247]

did.unittitle: MARY [i.e., MARIA] JEFFERSON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: All await his naming of the grandchild. Gift of a habit from Mrs. Lewis. [244],[248]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to CHARLES CARROLL.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Settlement of balance with Mr. Brown. Duty must be laid on grain exported in British bottoms to equalize chances of our vessels. [249]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [NICHOLAS] LEWIS.
did.physdesc: L. 3 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Has sold Albemarle and Bedford tobacco in Philadelphia. Sale of the fired tobacco in Richmond by Daniel Hylton. Payment to Lyle and Hanson. Payments due from Wilson. Debts of the John Wayles estate to Dr. Currie and Dobson. Francis Eppes, executor. White clover is the best improver of lands. [250]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN HANSON.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payments to Hanson and to Kippen & Co. will he met from sale of tobacco. Asks that he accept as payment of debt Mr. Ronald's mortgage bonds on Cumberland lands sold to Ronald by T. J. [251]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to DANIEL L. HYLTON, Richmond.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Bill of lading for the vis-a-vis (carriage). T. J. has sold his tobacco crop in Philadelphia; asks that Hylton forward it and charge expenses to him. [252]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS EPPES to THOMAS JEFFERSON.

scopecontent.p: Eppes writes about the education of his son, John Wayles Eppes, Monticello slave "Martin" and the sale of some property of Jefferson's.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to WAREHOUSE INSPECTORS, Richmond.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Order to deliver his tobacco to Daniel Hylton, excepting that which was fired and that belonging to Nicholas Lewis and B [owling] Clarke for overseers' shares. [253]

did.unittitle: MARY [JEFFERSON] BOLLING to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Moyer-Jefferson Papers, #9828..

did.unittitle: ELIZABETH EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Congratulations on his granddaughter. Will be glad to have Polly stay with her. Is delighted with his plans for John Wayles Eppes. [254]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [JOHN HARVIE?].

scopecontent.p: Surveying matters involving Anderson Bryan, Col. Randolph, and Staples. Claims on Col. Randolph and James Marks. Mentions Williamsburg and Albemarle County. [2356]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to BENJAMIN FRANKLIN BACHE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Typescript. Original owned by Franklin Bache. #38-743.

scopecontent.p: Desires Bache to make his paper (the General Advertiser), a purely Republican vehicle of news with general distribution. [255]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: SNR, 163; Betts, Garden Book, 162, extract.

scopecontent.p: Climates and ladies' veils. John Wayles Eppes with T. J. Botanical data. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Martha, and Anne Cary Randolph. [2476]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Harold W. Wilson. #5385-v.

scopecontent.p: Duplicates item 2476. [2477]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to TOBIAS LEAR.

scopecontent.p: Mail for George Washington to Camden, Taylor's Ferry, and Mount Vernon. [2475]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS EPPES, Bermuda Hundred, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: The John Wayles estate will he responsible for the Prince of "Wayles" cargo. Choice of profession for John Wayles Eppes. [256]

did.unittitle: PETER CARR, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Course of reading. Asks advice on practical side of law. Debts in Williamsburg unpaid. Draft on Nicholas Lewis. Garland Jefferson a "close student". References to Dabney Carr, [Matthew] Maury, and James Monroe. [257]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES McCLURG.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: B of R VI 284 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. Cassinove, of the banking firm of Van Staphorst in Amsterdam, who is visiting Norfolk and Richmond. [258]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES MAURY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another text in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Introducing Tench Coxe, Assistant Secretary of the Treasury, who has interested himself in Mr. Parkinson. [259]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to BEVERLEY RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: B of R VI 380 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. Cassinove of Amsterdam. Asks that he show Tuckahoe to him. [260]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MR. FULWAR SKIPWITH.
did.physdesc: L. 5 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: John Wayles' responsibility in case of Guineaman. Effect of death of Col. Randolph. Obligation of Farrell and Jones in slave trade with Africa. Cites Freeman 344, Tutthill vs. Roberts. Mentions Mrs. Skipwith's trip to Sweet Springs. [2478]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [HENRY REMSON].
did.physdesc: ALS. Letterpress copy. Fragment. 1 pp.; Barrow. Last page only. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Wythe too dear a friend to be impartial judge in a matter involving T. J. Returns to Virginia in fall. [3126]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to PETER CARR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Advice on reading and practice of law. Dabney Carr's progress. Delay in payment of Carr's debts at Williamsburg. Payment of Mr. Wayles' debts has crippled his funds. References to Nicholas Lewis and Dr. Thomas Walker. [261]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: SNR, 164-65.

scopecontent.p: Sends nankeen care of Mr. Brown, Richmond. Will answer Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr.'s letters to Monticello before joining James Madison in New York. Travel route: New York to Albany and Lake George, to Bennington, through Vermont to Connecticut River, thence to Hartford and New Haven and to New York and Philadelphia. Maria's riding lessons. Mentions Anne Cary Randolph. [2479]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in MHi. Printed: Randall II 9 (extract); SNR 199 (extract).

scopecontent.p: Importance of good relations with her neighbors. Loss of his vis-a-vis (carriage) in shipment; possible loss of tobacco and John Eppes' books and baggage on Captain Stratton's ship. List of books and furniture to be sent to Monticello. Petit has agreed to come from France as T. J.'s housekeeper. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph. [262]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to GEORGE WASHINGTON.
did.physdesc: L. 5 pp. #38-414-a. Copied for N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford V 328-330; L & B VIII 192-195. THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to BENJAMIN VAUGHAN. 1791 MAY 11. L. on pp. 3-5. #38-414-a. Copied for N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Letterpress copy in DLC. Printed: Ford V 332-334.

scopecontent.p: Washington letter: Indiscretion of J. B. Smith's brother in printing T. J.'s note in approbation of Tom Paine's Rights of Man has caused a split with John Adams. Accounts in Fenno's papers. Discourse on Davila. Plan to replace public records of Virginia burned by the British. Asks permission to copy his letters to Washington written while governor of Virginia. [263]

Vaughan letter: Experiments with mountain rice from Africa and Timor. Thanks for Sacontalá and for Smeaton's book. Astonishment at Burke's Reflections on the French Revolution. Paine's answer. Satisfaction with the new Constitution. Greetings to Lord Wycombe and Dr. Price. Mentions Dr. Priestley.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS LIEPER.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests payment for Bedford tobacco arrived on Captain Stratton's ship. Painters should start work Monday. [264]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES LYLE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Offers bonds backed by mortgages on land sold to Mr. Ronald in payment for his debts to Lyle, to Kippen & Co. and to Farrell & Jones. Mentions [Alexander] McCaul.[265]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to BENJAMIN VAUGHAN.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Letterpress copy in DLC. Printed: Ford V 332-334.

scopecontent.p: Experiments with mountain rice from Africa and Timor. Thanks for Sacontalá and for Smeaton's book. Astonishment at Burke's Reflections on the French Revolution. Paine's answer. Satisfaction with the new Constitution. Greetings to Lord Wycombe and Dr. Price. Mentions Dr. Priestley. [266]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES MAURY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: B of R VI 318 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Prosperity of the Union. [267]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to FRANCIS EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: SNR, 165-66.

scopecontent.p: John Wayles Eppes and Capt. Stratton arrived. Letter to Mr. Fulwar Skipwith concerning Guineaman. Coming to Virginia, perhaps not Richmond. John Wayles Eppes's studies. Trip to Lake George, Lake Champlain. [2480]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to ELIZABETH WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed SNR, 166.

scopecontent.p: Favor from John Wayles Eppes. Letter, this date, to Francis Eppes. Mentions Anne Cary Randolph. Would have left Maria with Mrs. Eppes, but Martha needed her at Monticello. [2481]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Farming notes from Monticello: strawberries, cherries, beans, inoculation of trees by Anthony. Irregularity of the postal service. [268]

did.unittitle: MARIA JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: AL. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for a veil he sent. Study of botany and arithmetic. Her mare is pretty. Abundance of fruit. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and Anne Randolph. [269]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Lake Champlain, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: Ford V 337-338; SNR 201-202.

scopecontent.p: Beauty of Lake George; Lake Champlain less attractive. Trip through New England and New York to Philadelphia. Superior climate of Virginia. Good wishes to Anne. [270]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: Randall II 21-22; SNR 203-204.

scopecontent.p: Headaches gone. Uncertain when he will return to Monticello. Duke of Dorset's daughter complains that Martha has not written. Mentions Fulwar Skipwith, Mrs. Trist, and Mrs. Waters. Asks that tobacco be sent so that he may make payment to John Hanson. Mirabeau and Duke de Richelieu are dead and Duke de Fronsac is head of the family. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Maria Jefferson, and Anne Randolph. [271]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. #501. Draft in MHi. Printed: Randall II 22; SNR 204.

scopecontent.p: Geography of Lake George area. Received tobacco reports from Mr. Nicholas Lewis and Mr. Daniel Hylton. Mentions Martha, Anne Cary Randolph, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [272]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: SNR, 169.

scopecontent.p: Geography of Lake George area. Received tobacco reports from Mr. Lewis and Mr. Hylton. Mentions Martha, Anne Cary Randolph, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [2482]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN DOBSON.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s tobacco will not produce the expected payment on bonds assigned to Dobson by John Hanson, T. J.'s portion of the John Wayles estate debt to Farrell & Jones. [273]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Postal route from Richmond to Staunton via Tuckahoe, Goochland Courthouse, Columbia, and Charlottesville. Stores for Monticello sent by Captain Stratton. Messages for Maria Jefferson, Anne Randolph, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [274]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [NATHANIEL] CHIPMAN.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Victor B. Levit. #8265-b.

scopecontent.p: Commission as judge of District of Vermont sent at same time as those for attorney and marshal. Encloses a new commission signed by Washington. [2482-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Fragment. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sugar maple trees from Prince on Long Island. Conversion from tobacco to wheat. Sale of tobacco crop. Stores for Monticello sent by Captain Stratton. Delay in return to Monticello. [275]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN DOBSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Deficiency in payment of his debts from proceeds of his tobacco crop will be made up by the wheat crop. [276]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Arrival of Petit from France. News of the Convent of Panthemont which Martha attended. Stores for Monticello sent by Captain Stratton. President is ill. News of Mme. de Taubenheim, Botitorer, and William Short. [277]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Proposes to build and rent a mill to Mr. Divers and others. Letters for P. Marks and [Justin P. P.] de Rieux. Mentions Mr. Henderson. [278]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to NATHANIEL COLLEY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of tables. [279]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #1223. Printed: Randall II 22; SNR 204-205.

scopecontent.p: Wants stores sent to Mr. Brown, Richmond, moved to Monticello. Sent commodes and chessmen. Petit says chessmen were sent. Asks about Maria's and Martha's music. [280]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: SNR, 169-70.

scopecontent.p: Wants stores sent to Mr. Brown, Richmond, moved to Monticello. Sent commodes and chessmen. Petit says chessmen were sent. Asks about Maria's and Martha's music. [2483]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to NATHANIEL BURWELL.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests information on the public certificates owned by {John?] Paradise which can be used to pay off his debts. [281]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [PHILIP MAZZEI].
did.physdesc: L. 3 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Dohrman's, Blair's, Bowdoin's, and George Nicholas, debts to Mazzei. Encloses copies of papers given to T. J. when he departed to Paris. Advises that he turn Virginia certificates into U. S. paper, and consult Edmund Randolph about it. Disapproves of the assumption of state paper at discount. Sale of Colle. Value of Mazzei's land in Richmond. Will take books in payment of Barrois, debt. Glad Mazzei is under the wings of the Diet and King. Distaste for his office. News of Maria Jefferson and Martha Randolph. Greetings to Duchess of Danville and Duke and Duchess de la Rochefoucault. Mentions Foster Debbs and Mr. Garth. [282]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to FRANCIS EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Fragment. Letterpress copy. 1st page only: 2nd page missing. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to FRANCIS EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Asks about Capt. Hylton's debts to Mazzei. John Wayles Eppes's law studies. Unsettled time of George Washington's trip to Virginia makes T. J.'s trip uncertain. Hopes to see Mr. and Mrs. Eppes at Monticello because cannot get to Eppington. Tobacco unprofitable. Will sell property to settle debt to John Hanson. Mentions friends at Hors-du-monde. [2485]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., [Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat, #2873. Original owned by Harold Jefferson Coolidge.

scopecontent.p: August Davies, proposed postal route from Richmond through Columbia and Charlottesville to Staunton Washington's illness. Need for replacing a carriage horse. England's preparation for war. Revolution in Santo Domingo. Estimates census will total 3,800,000 inhabitants. [283]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to CHRISTIAN BAEHR.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Order for coat and breeches. [284]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to COLONEL FORREST, [Georgetown].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Introducing Tench Coxe. [285]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Return to Monticello in September. Stores sent by Captain Stratton. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Maria Jefferson, and Anne Randolph. [286]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [BENJAMIN] STODDERT.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Introducing Tench Coxe. [287]

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Report on law reading. Requests permission to return to Albemarle where he can get books more easily and counteract bad opinion of him there. Reference to his uncle John Garland. [595]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; Barrow. #501. Printed: Randall II 23; SNR 205-206.

scopecontent.p: Date for return to Monticello. Purchase of horse for T. J. by Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. Reference to James Madison. [288]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: SNR, 170.

scopecontent.p: Coming to Monticello. Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. will get him a new horse. James Madison lends horse for trip to Virginia. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Martha, and Anne Cary Randolph. [2486]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: copy. Duplicates item 2486. [2487]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Tuckahoe, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Visit to Tuckahoe to vote for his father for a seat in the Virginia Senate. Purchase of Edgehill. Papers relating to the legacy left to M. de Rieux. Stoves at Mr. Brown's. T. J.'s return to Monticello. Mentions Martha Randolph. [289]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM TATHAM to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 10 pp.; Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. #9511-c. Printed: Ford-Bixby 49-56.

scopecontent.p: Tatham writes concerning maps, histories, and guidebooks of Virginia and the South which he has proposed writing and for which he is currently compiling material.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: [Justin P. P.] de Rieux's letters and power-of-attorney. Will meet Commissioners of Public Buildings in Georgetown; then to Orange with James Madison. Requests two wagon horses to meet him. King of France attempts to escape. [290]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON Philadelphia, to CHRISTIAN BAEHR.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Order for gilet and breeches. [291]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES BROWN, Richmond.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Shipment of putty for Monticello by the Sloop Polly. [292]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [JAMES] CURRIE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Morris' bonds are to serve as security for his debt to Dr. Currie after Dr. Griffin has been satisfied. [293]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES MAURY, Liverpool, England.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat, #931. Endorsed by T. J. Deposited by Mrs. Anne F. Maury. Printed: B of R VI 318 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of copy of the Corn Law. Refusal of ship masters to render accounts. Crop of wheat is fine, but corn and tobacco have been hurt by a drought. [294]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS LIEPER.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests note for fifty or one hundred dollars. Shipment of tobacco expected on Captain Stratton's ship. [295]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS LIEPER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Money for trip. Shipment of tobacco expected on Capt. Stratton's ship. [2488]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS EPPES, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Mazzei's claims against Captain Hylton's estate will be referred to Ralph Hylton. Betsy [Elizabeth Eppes?] has another girl. Invitation to T. J., the Randolphs, and Maria Jefferson to come to Eppington. Education of John Wayles Eppes. [296]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ANDREW ELLICOT.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Offer to hire Mr. Shuter's houseboy, Billy. [297]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ADAM LINDSAY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Order for myrtle wax candles and Hughes [Hewes] crab cider. [298]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES LYLE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Requests account of Peter Jefferson's estate, necessary for settlement of Dr. Walker's account. Will make payment upon the sale of his tobacco. Mentions John Nicholas. [299]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES WILSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requesting that he come to Monticello to make a settlement with T. J. Mentions Nicholas Lewis. [300]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES BROWN, Richmond.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests list of tobacco sold to Mr. Donald. Order for muslin, dimity, and shoes for Maria Jefferson, and cash for his return to Philadelphia. Discusses various methods of payment. [301]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to FRANCIS EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: To Philadelphia with Maria. To Virginia in Spring to settle with John Hanson. Cannot find Mazzei's account against Hylton. Perhaps with Blair. Samuel Woodson and Robert Lewis defaulted on bond; have not paid Eppes money spent on Maria. To pay John Wayles Eppes. Books from Europe for John Wayles Eppes. Mr. Skipwith says Wigan, Bevin's administrator, sues T. J. and Eppes. Health of Mrs. Eppes. [2489]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HENRY SKIPWITH.
did.physdesc: L. 9 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Hopes for an accommodation in the action by Bevins' executor against them. T. J.'s opinion of the paper signed by Skipwith and John Hanson (concerning the Wayles estate). Will not assume responsibility if John Wayles was security for a debt of Benjamin Harrison to Coles. Mentions Eppington, Hors du Monde, Mrs. Skipwith, and Mr. and Mrs. Francis Eppes. [302]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. Fragment. 1st page only. Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Lyle to supply copy of Kippen and Company account with estate of Peter Jefferson prior to first accounts with Mr. Nicholas. Letter from Lyle, Manchester, calls for delay until T. J. returns from Philadelphia. Accounts with Mr. Harvie and Dr. Walker. [2490]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES WILSON.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Wilson's account with T. J., covering the bonds of Richardson & Scruggs, Austin, James, Carter, and Randolph. Will send an order on Wilson to [John] Dobson for the balance due. Wilson will handle other bonds in the future for T. J. [303]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Monticello], to NATHANIEL POPE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Order on Pope in favor of Andrew Donald for William and James Donald & Co. to be paid from money collected from Robert Lewis and Samuel Woodson. [304]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Monticello], to NATHANIEL POPE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Order on Pope in favor of James Strange for Donald Scott & Co., to be paid from collections from Robert Lewis and Samuel Woodson. [305]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES STRANGE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Fragment. Letterpress copy. With ANS, Letterpress copy, 1791 October 7, T. J. to N. POPE. Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Pope to pay note from proceeds of suits in Henrico District Court against Robert Lewis and Samuel Woodson of Goochland. Returns to Philadelphia. Pope to pay Strange or Donald Scott. [2491]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to NATHANIEL POPE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Nicholas Lewis has given up the management of T. J.'s affairs. Directions for collection and payment of his debts. Money due from Robert Lewis and Samuel Woodson. Payment due James Strange of Richmond for Donald Scott & Co., to Andrew Donald for William and James Donald & Co., and to [John] Dobson. Stop the suit against Lewis and Ware. [306]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to NICHOLAS LEWIS.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payments to [James] Currie, John Dobson, and John Hanson. Loss of tobacco shipped for Tom Cobbs to Mr. Ballow by T. J.'s slave, Phill. [307]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to MARIA JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; insect damage in lower right. McGregor Library, #1223.

scopecontent.p: Instructions regarding her trip to Baltimore and Philadelphia. Mentions Mr. Giles. [308]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Elizabeth Eppes' illness. Purchase of donkey from Mrs. Bolling. John Wayles Eppes' expenses. [Henry?] Skipwith's sale [of tobacco?] a good one. Fall in tobacco price. Mentions Nicholas Lewis. [309]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to the REV. MATTHEW MAURY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payment to Maury through his brother at Fredericksburg. [310]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MATTHEW MAURY.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. Endorsed by T. J. Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Encloses payment promised in letter from Monticello, in care of Maury's brother, Fredericksburg. Redeemable in U.S. Collector's Office. [2492]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: SNR 207.

scopecontent.p: Difficult trip to Philadelphia. Mrs. Washington's kindness to Maria. Maria's education at Mrs. Pine's. Washington's speech on land law, militia law, post office, weights and measures, navigation, and commerce. Arrival of Mr. Hammond, British Minister. New legislature now sitting in France. Peace throughout Europe. Mentions Nelly Custis, Martha Randolph, and Anne Randolph. [311]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS EPPES, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Philadelphia].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Betsy in better health. Mentions John Wayles Eppes and Maria Jefferson. [312]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to FRANCIS EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mail difficulties. Bevin's suit. John Wayles Eppes well, reading Coke on Littleton. George Washington's speech indicates Congress' work load. Mentions Maria, Mrs. Eppes. [2493]

did.unittitle: GEORGE WASHINGTON COMMISSION TO THOMAS JOHNSON OF MARYLAND AS ASSOCIATE JUSTICE OF U.S. SUPREME COURT.
did.physdesc: DS. Signed by T. J. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Bradley T. Johnson. #5594-a.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to FRANCIS EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Fragment. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Will pay John Wayles Eppes for horse gotten by Francis Eppes. To breed a Jack with Mazzei's Jenny. [Break in text.] Will pay his British debts; objects to paying those of others. Irregularity in Bevin suit may release T. J. and Francis Eppes. Maria well, writes to Elizabeth Wayles Eppes. John Wayles Eppes's studies. [2495]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. Barrow. #2143.

scopecontent.p: Comparison of the newspapers of Freneau and Bache. Desperate state of the French West Indies. Shipment of clothing for house slaves by Captain Stratton. Maria, at Mrs. Pine's has received calls from Mesdames Adams, Randolph, Rittenhouse, Sarjeant, Waters, and Davies. Greetings to Thomas M. and Anne Randolph. [313]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Comparison of the newspapers of Freneau and Bache. Desperate state of the French West Indies. Shipment of clothing for house slaves by Captain Stratton. Maria, at Mrs. Pine's has received calls from Mesdames Adams, Randolph, Rittenhouse, Sarjeant, Waters, and Davies. Greetings to Thomas M. and Anne Randolph. [313A]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to A[LEXANDER]DONALD.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Fragment. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Originally calendared as [ca. 1790].

scopecontent.p: Sending of a Minister to England. [224]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to WILLIAM SHORT, Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s account with Short. Order for thirty bottles of champagne from M. DORSA for the President, using money in his, M. Grand's, or M. Van Staphorst's hands. Request for his traveling expense account to lay before Congress. Seeds and maple sugar for the Duchess of Danville. Peach grafts for the Duke de la Rochefoucault. Possibility of exporting maple sugar. Death of Mr. Edmunds, Eliza Edmunds, a son of Peyton Short, and Sally Short. Eliza and Jenny Short have gone to Kentucky. Greetings to M. and Mme. de Lafayette. [314]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Trees from Mr. Prince for Monticello sent to Mr. Brown in Richmond. Mr. Davies says post started on the 15th. Clothes for the house slaves sent by Captain Stratton. Cold weather. [David] Rittenhouse will furnish Freneau with meteorological observations. Love to Martha Randolph. [315]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN DOBSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Fragment. Barrow. Letterpress copy. Pages 1 and 2 only. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Payment of his debts to Dobson, consisting of bond to Farrell & Jones, assigned to Dobson, and a bill of exchange from Tabb. Partial payment by orders on James Wilson and Nathaniel Pope (money received in a suit against Woodson and Lewis), by money from his 1790 and 1791 tobacco crop, and by the sale of forty slaves. Mentions Nicholas Lewis. See also Item 316, below. [2496]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [JOHN DOBSON].
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Fragment. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Payment of his debts to Dobson, consisting of bond to Farrell & Jones, assigned to Dobson, and a bill of exchange from Tabb. Partial payment by orders on James Wilson and Nathaniel Pope (money received in a suit against Woodson and Lewis), by money from his 1790 and 1791 tobacco crop, and by the sale of forty slaves. Mentions Nicholas Lewis. [316]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: News of Maria Jefferson. Clothes for the housemaids. Books for Martha on cooking, and for Thomas Mann Randolph on agriculture by Ginani and Duhamel. Possible sale of wheat in Philadelphia. [317]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Captain Stratton left with slaves' clothes. Trees received by James Brown. Defeat of St. Clair in Indian battle on Wabash near Fort Wayne. Preference for militia over regulars. Affairs in France happily terminated. Greetings to Martha and Anne Randolph. [318]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 3 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Thomas Walker's account against Peter Jefferson's estate. Confusion concerning payment to Kippen & Co. for the estate, made by John Harvie to Mr. McCaul. Mentions Richard Randolph, David Randolph, Martha Jefferson Randolph. [319]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia. to ARCHIBALD STUART.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford V 408-411; L & B VIII 275-278; B of R VI 443 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Importance of strengthening state governments to prevent encroachment by the federal government. Specific means for strengthening the executive, legislative, and judicial branches of the state governments. [320]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to HENRY MULLINS.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payment Mullins failed to make to Richard Anderson was to be turned over to James Strange of Richmond for Donald Scott & Co. [321]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Illness of Mrs. Gilmer, Colonel Lewis, and Anne Randolph. Postal route through Columbia, Charlottesville, and Staunton. Greetings to Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [322]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON NOTES ON TREES, FLOWERS, AND SHRUBS OF PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTY, VA.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. on 1 l. McGregor Library, #3620.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON STUDIES FOR ROTUNDA-PLAN HOUSE (PROBABLY FOR THE PRESIDENT'S HOUSE, WASHINGTON).
did.physdesc: Sketches in pencil both sides of sheet. Paper DB. 14 3/4 x 9 in. McGregor Library, #770.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp., with attached address leaf. #3177. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. Printed: Ford V 415-417; B of R VI 384 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Postal route from Richmond through Columbia, Charlottesville, Staunton, and into Kentucky. The representation bill might have been saved by Richard H. Lee. Measures for defense of the West. Experiment with peach trees for firewood. Weariness with public office. [323]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to FRANCIS EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Expenses for education of John Wayles Eppes. Intemperate letter from John Dobson in regard to T. J.'s account. No report from Nicholas Lewis concerning the sale of slaves at Bedford. Mentions Maria Jefferson, Elizabeth Eppes, and [Daniel] Hylton. [324]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. MS at MHi.

scopecontent.p: Will not lease Edgehill (I. e. Elk Hill?) to Mr. Forster, owing to probability of its sale to pay part of John Wayles estate debt to Farrell & Jones. Anxious to receive Nicholas Lewis' account of sale of slaves at Bedford. Reference to [Daniel] Hylton. [325]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: Ford V 422-423; SNR 208.

scopecontent.p: Desire to leave public office and return to Monticello with Martha, Anne, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [326]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., [Monticello].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Rates for Freneau's newspaper on the postal route from Richmond through Columbia, Charlottesville, and Staunton, Va. Wants to hear results of his sale [of slaves]. Requests that [Bowling] Clarke or the manager send his tobacco for sale in Richmond after its inspection at Lynchburg. Terms for sale of Bedford tobacco. Clarkson is managing T. J.'s affairs in Albemarle. [327]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Bizarre, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Letters from T. J. and Maria. Information from David Randolph concerning Colonel Dicke. Return to Monticello. [328]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Recent illness. Maria Jefferson's refusal to write. Requests information on wheat, payment of debts and slaves, since Clarkson cannot write. [329]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests certified copy of a deed. Mentions Martha and Thomas Jefferson Randolph. [330]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Heavy snow and ice along James River. Hopes snow will prevent multiplication of the weevil. Mentions Mr. Clarkson and Colonel Carter. [331]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Dismal journey from Dick Randolph's. Purchase of Edgehill and its slaves completed. Wants him to return to Monticello. Mrs. Gilsner is recovered from her insanity. News of Anne Randolph. Greetings to Maria Jefferson. [332]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES CURRIE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: A judgment has been obtained for Currie against Dr. Griffin, but that against the garnishees will take time. [333]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in MHi. Printed: Randall II 76; SNR 208-209.

scopecontent.p: Homesickness for Monticello. News of Maria Jefferson, Mrs. Trist, and Mrs. Waters. Leyden Gazette says British were beaten by Tippoo Saib, and were saved by the arrival of the Mahrattas, suing for peace for Cornwallis. Mentions Mr. Randolph. [334]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to FRANCIS EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Demand on Mr. Bannister. Account of sale: slaves brought little, but, with profit from sale of Cumberland land, will cover installment to John Hanson. Sale of Elkhill and debts, including those due Jones and Hanbury. Mentions Mr. Lewis. Health of Maria and John Wayles Eppes. Mentions Elizabeth Wayles Eppes. [2499]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Glad that Randolph has obtained Edgehill. Books for Maria Jefferson sent by Captain Stratton. Greetings to Martha Randolph. [335]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: Ford V 455-456; B of R VI 384 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Severe winter. Fate of the country based on gambling scoundrels, the stock sellers. Fate of the representation bill. The emperor will not meddle in France's rearming. Postal time between Richmond and Philadelphia. Mr. Clark to ship T. J.'s tobacco to Philadelphia. [336]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Instructions for planting Acacia Farnesiana. Gooseberry, lilac, and weeping willow are leafing. Martins have appeared. References to Elizabeth Eppes, Maria Jefferson, Martha Randolph, and Anne Randolph. [337]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: B of R X 17 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Letter for Great Britain and commission to Dr. Barton taken care of for Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. Shackleford should manure the gardens at Monticello. Copies of Fenno's Gazette forwarded. [338]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to ADAM LINDSAY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payment for candles. Bill for apportioning representatives to each state vetoed by Washington. [339]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Letter for British partners. Hares damaged orchard. Gilmer ill. [2500]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to SENATORS AND REPRESENTATIVES FROM VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: AN. 1 pp. Photostat, #3159. Original owned by James Monroe Museum and Memorial Library, Fredericksburg.

scopecontent.p: Collection of British debts in Virginia courts. [2501]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Request as to Doctor Barton complied with. Requests that Mr. Lewis deliver bonds taken at his sale [of slaves?] to Mr. Eppes, who will use them to pay Mr. Hanson. Urges that Clarke hurry T. J.'s Bedford tobacco. Randolph's researches into the opossum. Colonel Monroe leaves soon. Mentions T. Shackleford. [340]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to HENRY REMSEN.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. McGregor Library, #38-742. Printed: B of R VI 388 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Receipt of pamphlet attacking him; author unmistakable (John Fenno?). Criminality of paper money system. Report of rioting around William Duer's place of confinement. [341]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sends a bill instead of damaged tobacco to repay money T. J. paid for him. Requests copy of Lavater's moral aphorisms for Patsy [Martha Randolph]. Bonds for Mr. Eppes. [342]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. Congress adjourned. James Monroe will bring watch, Paine's Rights of Man, and T. J.'s copy of Johann Caspar Lavater's Aphorisms. Mrs. Pine to England; Maria to Mrs. Brodeau. George Washington to Mount Vernon. T. J. to Monticello. Mentions Anne Cary Randolph. [2502]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to GEORGE WASHINGTON.
did.physdesc: L. 7 pp. #38-414-a. Copied by Cornelia J. Randolph for N. P. Trist, ca. 1830. Letterpress copy in DLC. Printed: Ford VI 1-6; Tucker I 427-434; L & B VIII 341-349; Penn. Mag. of Hist. and Biog. XX 342.

scopecontent.p: Cites reasons why Washington should continue as President: a public debt so large that it strains the impost; draining of specie abroad by payments on the foreign debt; large amount of paper money that encourages speculation, corrupts the legislature, and menaces the republican form of government. Only hope of safety lies in numerous representation. Possibility of a split North and South if the paper money, monarchical interest remains dominant. Negotiations with England and Spain are at a delicate point. [343]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat, #2873. Original owned by Harold Jefferson Coolidge.

scopecontent.p: To send Ferris' papers to Mr. Madison. The President's arrival. Colonel and Mrs. Monroe's visit at Monticello. Attempted murder of King of Sweden; prosperity of French affairs, and rising value of assignats. Probable defeat of John Jay in New York. Shipment of bacon and tobacco. [344]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Nicholas Lewis, Jr., returned from Williamsburg with his lady. Airs that the Lewises have taken of late. Effect of drought on sugar maples, acacias, and the crops. Illness of Joseph Monroe. [345]

did.unittitle: PETER CARR, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Hears news of him from Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and Patsy. Discusses law reading, lawyer's prospects. Encloses opinion on the law of waste. (see 22 June 1792 and 18 February 1793) . Reference to Mr. Steward (Archibald Stuart?) of Staunton. [346]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Copies of Fenno's and Freneau's newspapers. Possibility that Maria will enter Miss Brodeaux's school. Instructions to [Bowling] Clarke necessitated by miserable condition of his tobacco. [347]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to DOCTOR WITHERSPOON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Baker's explanation regarding a tutor for Mr. Robinson. [348]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Wheat and corn crop at Monticello and Shadwell. Importance of abolishing tobacco and Indian corn to protect soil; the area peculiarly favorable to wheat. [349]

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Goochland County, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Attended Charlottesville District Court. Plans for law study. [350]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [HORE] BROWSE TRIST.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Letterpress copy. Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Urges him to exercise his legal rights in property entailed to him in England, with aid from Thomas Pinckney. [351]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS PINCKNEY.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Fragment. Last 2 pages only. Photostat. Location of original not known. #3449. Printed: L and B VIII, 375-77.

scopecontent.p: Personnel for mint. Wants Drost and Boulton. Mr. Morris can hire in France. [2503]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to NATHANIEL BURWELL, the Grove, near Williamsburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf; portion of text adhered to seal and torn away; franked with "Free" stamp. #5757.

scopecontent.p: Mrs. Paradise asks inventory of estate in Virginia. Paradise trustees in England can collect proceeds from sale of public lands. [2504]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to SAMUEL MACKAY.
did.physdesc: AL. Fragment. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: B of R VI 369 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Possibility of Mackay's making a living as a French tutor in Philadelphia, Baltimore, or Richmond. [352]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to PETER CARR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Ford VI 91-92; L & B VIII 383-385; B of R VI 71 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Opinion on the law of waste. [353]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. #1331-c.

scopecontent.p: Concerning T. J.'s return to Monticello, her sister Maria, and advice on neighbors.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Other MSS. in CSmH and MHi.

scopecontent.p: Goods for Monticello sent to James Brown in Richmond via the Schooner Relief. Mentions George Washington. [354]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Stores for Monticello. Plans for return to Monticello via James Madison's home and John Jones' tavern. Mentions Mr. Claxton, Mr. Petit, Mr. Williams, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and George Washington. [355]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in NNP.

scopecontent.p: Horses for his return to Monticello. Greetings to Mr. Randolph. [356]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to PIERRE GUIDE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of raisins and wine ordered from Guide. [357]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ACCOUNT BOOK.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Partly in unidentified hand. #6004.

scopecontent.p: Farm business. Account for work done by William. [2505]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to MR. [DAVID] RITTENHOUSE.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Fragment? #6411. Originally calendared as 1793 August 12.

scopecontent.p: To see him again. Mentions Mrs. Rittenhouse. [2528]

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Goochland County, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Glad T. J. is at Monticello. Asks for horse in order to attend Court. Regards to Thomas M. and Mrs. Randolph. [358]

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Goochland County, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Illness of Martha J. Carr, Lucy Carr, and himself. Jefferson's plans to reside in Virginia. Asks instructions about returning books. Samuel Carr's education at Williamsburg. [359]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to GEORGE WASHINGTON, Mount Vernon.
did.physdesc: L. 12 pp. Copy made for N. P. Trist, ca. 1830. #38-414-a. Letterpress copy in DLC. Printed: Ford VI 101-109; L & B VIII 394-408.

scopecontent.p: Negotiations by William Short and William Carmichael with England and Spain regarding their interference with the Indians. Dissention among the executive departments. Disapproval of Hamilton: his policies, his undue influencing of the legislature, his interference in negotiations with England and France. Differences of opinion between Hamilton and T. J. regarding the Constitution and public debt. Justification of Philip Freneau. Asserts that he has never dictated Freneau's policies except to advise use of information in the Leyden Gazette. Rivalry between Freneau and Fenno. Importance of a free press. Anonymous slanders by Hamilton, which he will answer after his retirement. Mentions writings of Publicola and Discourses on Davila. [360]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DANIEL HYLTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Fragment. Letterpress copy. Barrow. Break in text between pages numbered 2 and 4. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Will sell Elkhill if Greenbrier profits not adequate. Mr. Banks can sell regardless of mortgages. For purposes of litigation, Greenbrier County might be in the East Indies. Elkhill safer with T. J. Dr. Taylor's bond. T. J. to Philadelphia. Martin may have purchaser. Mr. Banks wrote from Alexandria. [2506]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [EDMUND RANDOLPH].
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Memorandum relative to William Short's letter of 15 September 1792. [361]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS, 1 pp. Docketed. #13272.

scopecontent.p: Madison encloses letters from Edmund Randolph and Daniel Carroll [not present] which refer to Alexander Hamilton and Virginia and Maryland politics. Madison also requests a bag of coffee and comments on the serious illness of T.J.'s granddaughter, Anne Cary Randolph Bankhead, who is being attended by Dr. Gilmer.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [BOLLING CLARKE].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Fragment. Last page only. Letterpress copy. Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. First page at DLC. Originally calendared as n.d.

scopecontent.p: Hubbard (slave) better shoemaker for Bedford plantation than Peter. Tobacco to London via Richmond. Mentions Mr. Brown, Mr. Clay, cotton, clover, hemp, wheat, and slave sale. [3122]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON MEMORANDUM FOR MR. CLARKSON.
did.physdesc: AD. 3 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Household affairs involving butcher, Ben Calvard or Calvert, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., John Quarles, Robert Smith, Thomas Norris, John Henderson's executors, Thomas Massey, Nicholas Lewis, Joseph Mansfield, wheat, Sheriff of Albemarle, Peter Marks, Richmond, Va., Daniel Wood, Mr. Clarkson, fencing, hemp and cotton growing, slaves, stone cutting, limestone, tools, wheel making, wood cutting, sand moving, log houses, Mr. Henderson, Randolph family supplies, Christmas livestock lists, grain sales, and orchard grubbing. [2507]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON MEMORANDUM OF ACCOUNTS.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #38-754.

scopecontent.p: Brief memorandum of accounts with the following people: Albemarle County Sheriff, Thomas Bell, James Brown, Benjamin Calvard, Manoah Clarkson, Hierom Gaines, Henry Guy, John Henderson's executors, John Garland Jefferson, Nicholas Lewis, Joseph Mansfield, Peter Marks, Thomas Massey, Matthew Maury, John Quarles, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and David Wood. [362]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to NICHOLAS LEWIS.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #7443-e.

scopecontent.p: Receipt for books and papers relative to superintendence of T. J.'s affairs from 1783. [2507-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to HENRY REMSEN.

scopecontent.p: Official letters forwarded to William Carmichael and William Short re: their negotiations on behalf of the United States in Amsterdam and expressing fears that the letters may have been lost at sea.

did.unittitle: WILSON MILES CARY, Ceeleys, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: His son and family have scarlet fever. Concerned about education of grandsons. Solicits appointment to lighthouse at Cape Henry for Maj. George Wray. [363]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to M. DE LA MOTTE, [le Havre].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Request that M. Frouille, Libraire Quai des Augustin[s], Paris, forward the Encyclopedie. Order for macaroni. Goods to be shipped to James Brown in Richmond. Draft on Donald & Barton, London. [364]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [DE LA MOTTE].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Fragment. Last page only. Letterpress copy. Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. First page at MHi. Originally calendared as n.d.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for help on business at Le Havre and Paris. [3128]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to VAN STAPHORST & HUBBARD, Amsterdam.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Concerning a balance against T. J. in favor of Van Staphorst & Hubbard, resulting from public accounts while T. J. was minister to France. Mentions John Dobson. [365]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Orders to sell slaves in Bedford and Albemarle. Flooring for the stables Turnip crop. Maria lives with a Mrs. Fullerton. Greetings to Martha Randolph and to Miss Jane (Randolph?). Forwards Freneau's and Fenno's newspapers via Mr. Madison. Mentions slaves Dinah and Caesar. [366]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [DANIEL CARROLL].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: B of R VIII 97 (MS. in DLC). Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Poverty of Etienne Hallet, architect at Georgetown. [367]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOSIAH PARKER.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Letter for Messrs. Blow and Milhaddo. [368]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: L. 1 p. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Anne Randolph's illness. President Washington's scheme of crop rotation. [369]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, to [JAMES] MADISON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 p. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Will board with John Shelton, Goochland. Asks for money for winter clothes and for board. Course of reading. Direct letter care George Jefferson, Richmond. [370]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to COL. GAMBLE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Order from Mr. Vaughan on John Hopkins payable to Gamble for account of Mr. Derieux. [2510]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, Jr.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #4726-a.

did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: T. J. Wrote to Randolph Jefferson. James Kinsolving bought Dinah and children from Clarkson. Col. Lewis and Col. Bell set value. Bedford sale. Kinsolving joined by John Burnley. Limestone and wood cutting, orchard grubbing. Stable to be built. Martha's report of Charlottesville fire premature. Dyvers and Lindsey lost heavily. Will tell Mr. Hylton at Richmond about stalactite. Clothes for slaves at neither Monticello nor Mr. Brown's. Anne Cary Randolph ill; Gilmer treating. Martha writes to Maria. French victory. [2515]

Swaille of schooner Mary bound Norfolk to Richmond brings slaves' clothes care Mr. Brown. Note adds that model threshing machine comes by Capt. Weymouth, ship Ellice, New York to Norfolk, care Col. Gamble. Machine to be moved from Richmond. [2516]

War between France, England, and Holland. John Eppes at William and Mary College. Letter from Mr. Carr. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [431]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to ALEXANDER HAMILTON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: B of R VI 199 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Disposal of William Short's property in the public funds. Mentions James Brown. [432]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [THOMAS] BELL, [Albemarle County].
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Valuation of slave Mary [Hemings?]. Request that he supply J. Garland Jefferson with necessities. Mr. Derieux's affairs. Dearth of money in Philadelphia. Mentions Nicholas Lewis and Dr. Gilmer. [433]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [PETER CARR, Monticello].

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to PETER CARR.
