did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Account of Peter Gordon, shoemaker. Beverly Randolph at Baltimore. George Washington expected at Philadelphia. Mentions Maria, Francis, and Elizabeth Wayles Eppes. [2522]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: L & B XIX 103-105; B of R VI 239 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Courses of reading for Jefferson and Dabney Carr. Suggests he stand at the bar in the fall. Refers him to Thomas Bell in Charlottesville for funds. [435]

did.unittitle: JAMES BROWN, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: William Short's certificates. [436]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS PINCKNEY.

scopecontent.p: William Penn mail. No progress with Mr. Hammond. Wants Mr. Droz for mint. [2523]

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Goochland County, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.

scopecontent.p: Opinion on the right of the U. S. to renounce their treaties with France, citing Grotius, Puffendorf, Vattel, and Wolf as authorities. [438]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Connection of herself and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. with Bizarre scandal. Mentions Richard Randolph, Anne Cary Randolph of Bizarre, and David Randolph. Livestock; and gardening. Mentions Maria. [2525]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Goochland County.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: B of R VI 239 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Financial difficulties make it necessary that Garland get his clothes from Thomas Bell. Approves Garland's district for law practice. [440]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Bonds deposited by Bowling Clarke. Bonds taken by Mr. Hylton for Elkhill not yet arrived. Damage to grain by the weevil. Barley, wheat, rye, clover, and mocking birds at Monticello. Loan of two pamphlets, one on "popery laws" in Ireland. Mentions Martha Randolph and the children. [441]

did.unittitle: DANIEL L. HYLTON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Goochland County, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Explanation why he bought from Shelton and Harris rather than Thomas Bell. Borrowing books from Monticello. Reference to William Pope. [443]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia to ANGELICA SCHUYLER CHURCH

scopecontent.p: Mentions Monsieur de Noailles (a kinsman of Madame Lafayette). Inquires of Madame de Corny and [Maria] Cosway. Comments that he thinks America is "the only country of tranquility, and should be the asylum of all those who wish to avoid the scenes which have crushed our friends in Paris."

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN MIXON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: B of R VI 355 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Letter covering Mr. Cruger's? papers. [444]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.

scopecontent.p: George Washington at Mount Vernon. Maria has mumps. Manager from Elkton. Maryland tenants. May ask Clarkson to take east side of river. Effects in France of Dumouriez's desertion. Brittany insurrection, possible war between England and France. Threshing machine. Mentions Maria. [2526]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [JAMES MADISON].

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOSEPH FENWICK.

scopecontent.p: Introducing [Edward?] Livingston. [448]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to M. LA MOTTE.

scopecontent.p: Introducing [Edward?] Livingston. [449]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES MADISON.

scopecontent.p: Requesting Randolph to deliver confidential letter to James Madison. [2527-b]

scopecontent.p: Payment for wine. Mentions draft on Donald & Burton. [457]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to M. LA MOTTE.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to McHENRY, GILMER, & STERRETT.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES H. McHENRY.

scopecontent.p: Misfortunes of M. Lenblhon, a fugitive from Santo Domingo awaiting passage to France. [461]

scopecontent.p: Concerning two boxes of china sent by [Edward?] Dowse. [462]

scopecontent.p: Mail from Philadelphia. News of James Madison, Colonel, Mrs., and Eliza Monroe. Effect of weevil on wheat crop. Mentions Mr. Clarkson, Martha Randolph, and Maria Jefferson. [463]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to RICHARD DOBSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: B of R VI 124 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Payments on T. J.'s bond and bill of exchange. [464]

scopecontent.p: Letters for George Hammond, Mr. Van Berckel, Mr. Viar, and Mr. Jaudenes regarding passports and letters requested by the Charitable Committee of Baltimore. [468]

scopecontent.p: It is not permitted to place consuls in the British Islands (West Indies?). [472]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to DAVID MEADE RANDOLPH.

He notes that he has a dozen hands already emplyed and expects to increase thier number. He concludes with a note about the possibility of the French making peace with their continental enemies and adds a postscript about some enclosed bills of exchange [not present].

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSIAH DONATH, Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: Payment for window glass by draft on John Barnes. [587]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to EDWARD RUTLEDGE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Paul Mellon Bequest. #11620. Partially printed: L and B IX, 352-55.

scopecontent.p: T. J. asks Rutledge for 20 bushels of cowpeas, gives instructions on shipping to Charles Johnston & Co., Richmond and payment through John Barnes of Philadelphia, and discusses improvements he has made on the Lieth machine for threshing wheat in Virginia and rice in South Carolina. T. J. continues with a discussion of how much unmerited abuse and praise he has suffered in public service, his wish for retirement, the outcome of the election of 1796 which he knows Adams will win adding "I know well that no man will ever bring out of that office the reputation which carries him into it. the honeymoon would be as short in that case as in any other, & it's moment of extasy would be ransomed by years of torment & hatred." He predicts he will live in peace while Adams will be shipwrecked in the gathering storm, but nevertheless urges Rutledge to continue in national public office for "there is no bankrupt law in heaven by which you may get off with shillings in the pound, with rendering to a single state what you owed to the whole confederacy." [2545-b]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JUSTIN P. P. DERIEUX.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ELIZABETH HOUSE TRIST.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: George Jefferson to handle letter. Mr. Page and George know how to handle seed when arrived at Charlottesville or Milton. Box for Mr. Strickland. French Directory acted against Philadelphia's English merchants. [2558]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Belmont, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2143.

scopecontent.p: Purchase of horses and mules. Mr. Hore [Browse] Trist unlikely to purchase [Nicholas?] Lewis' farm, since he prefers the country near Frederick County, Va., or Berkeley County, [W.] Va. [603]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp.; Barrow. File draft. Owned by Mrs. Harold W. Wilson. #5385-v.

scopecontent.p: Would make her private secretary at Monticello. Letter from John Wayles Eppes. Richmond mail. Orders for Quarrier to deliver chariot. May visit Eppington. Work at Monticello. Congress to adjourn late. Mr. Trist rents George Nicholas' house in Charlottesville. [2559]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: AL. 2 pp.; Barrow. #501. Printed: Randall II 383-384.

scopecontent.p: Discussion of the XYZ Affair; Charles Talleyrand. [604]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Belmont, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; hand franked. Fragment, final page only. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Work done by George at Monticello. XYZ Affair. Suspects Talleyrand's honesty. Tobacco prices. References to Wilson Cary Nicholas and Thomas Walker. T. J.'s return to Monticello. [605]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Belmont, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp.; hand franked. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Shipment of trees and a harpsichord. Supply of lumber for work at Monticello. Tobacco and corn crops. Purchase of horses. Books by Lescarbot and Champlain. Accident to his horse Darlington. References to Davenport, George (slave), and to [Richard?] Richardson. [606]

did.unittitle: TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: D. Draft in T. J.'s hand. 1 pp. #9013-a. Photostat. Original owned by Muzeum Narodowe w Krakowie, Poland. #9013-a.

scopecontent.p: Power of attorney. [2559-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to James Cary. [2560]

did.unittitle: TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO, WILL.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp.; Barrow. Copy. Original in Albemarle County Will Book I 42. #10459-a.

scopecontent.p: Bequeaths property to T. J. to purchase slaves and give them liberty. See also 1819 May 12 for T. J.'s refusal to execute will. [607]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES. [Eppington].
did.physdesc: AL. 2 pp.; Barrow. #501. Another MS. in MHi. Printed: Randall II 384-385.

scopecontent.p: XYZ Affair. Possibility of war. Cannot visit Eppington. Hopes John Wayles Eppes and Maria can go to Monticello. [608]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: SNR, 210-11, extract.

scopecontent.p: Letter to Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. Maria and John Wayles Eppes should go to Richmond from Monticello. Politics. Randolph children likely to forget T. J. [2561]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Letter from Mr. Eppes. Congress to adjourn. Wants Maria and John Wayles Eppes to go to Monticello. Harpsichord at Monticello. Mentions Eppington, Eppes family. [2562]

did.unittitle: MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Proposed trip to Monticello. Trip to Petersburg and Shirley. Smallpox vaccination. Harpsichord at Monticello. Mentions Polly Archer, Mary J. Bolling, Martha J. Carr, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Bolling Walker, John Walker, and Tabby Walker. [609]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Belmont, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of various letters. Forwards book by Lescarbot. Tobacco crop at Shadwell. George's difficulties in handling the slaves. People suspicious of Federal law empowering recruitment of army. [610]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Eppington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Upper right corner torn away with loss of text. #38-576. Printed: Randall II 408.

scopecontent.p: Hopes to see Maria at Monticello. Maria's harpsichord in good condition. Reports from Charles C. Pinckney, John Marshall, and Elbridge Gerry on relations with France. Greetings to Mr. and Mrs. Francis Eppes and John Wayles Eppes. [611]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Belmont, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Detestable triumph of principles (Alien and Sedition Acts etc.) repugnant to T. J. Note for Mr. [Hore Browse?] Trist. Things are well at Belmont, Dunlora, and Carrsbrook. Medicines required. [612]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN STEELE, COMPTROLLER OF U.S.

scopecontent.p: Sum due William Short from U.S. Treasury to be paid John Barnes. Mentions Bank of U.S. [2563]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HERBERT CROFT, London.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; silked. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: L & B XVIII 361-364. #38-755.

scopecontent.p: Expresses pleasure at Croft's letter on the German and English languages. Criticism of Johnson and Skinner as etymologists. Proposals for simplifying the study of Anglo-Saxon. Approves Croft's idea of a dictionary as a general index to literature. [613]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES MADISON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford VII 288; L & B X 62-63; B of R VI 295 better press copy in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Affirmation of principles of the Kentucky Resolutions. [614]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to WILSON CARY NICHOLAS.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Copy by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford VII 312-313; B of R VI 352 (letterpress copy in DLC) .

scopecontent.p: Phraseology of a paper concurring with the Kentucky Resolutions. [615]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Eppington.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp.; Barrow. Fragment. McGregor Library, #1223. Another MS. in CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Lucy has increased her family. Plans to set out for Philadelphia. News of John Wayles Eppes, Francis Eppes, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and Ellen Randolph. [616]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON, JR. to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #2598-a. Docketed by T. J.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Illness resulting from trip to Philadelphia via Fredericksburg. Republican Party advances in the public mind. Greetings to Thomas Mann Randolph and the children. [617]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR. MEMORANDUM.
did.physdesc: AMS. On verso of lettercover in T. J.'s hand to Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. #6089-a.

scopecontent.p: English reasons for war with France. [2564]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA J. EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp., with attached address leaf; silked. #38-576. Printed: Randall II 480-481; SNR 254-255.

scopecontent.p: Recent illness. Plans for Monticello in the spring. [618]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to ALEXANDER GARRETT.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. #3695.

scopecontent.p: Assistant Postmaster General needs date of mail irregularity reported by Garrett and Mr. Watson. [2565]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to John Francis. [2566]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Belmont, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Hand franked. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Christmas festivities. All well at Monticello. Visit to George Dineer. Mentions Martha, Virginia, Nancy, and Ellen Randolph. [619]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sale of lands at Bermuda Hundred and Martin's Swamp. Receipt from Mr. Page. Maria Eppes' health improving. [620]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to Mrs. Gardner, washer woman. Receipted by Jacob Lawrence for Mrs. Gardner. [2567]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Possible renting of his land at Bermuda Hundred. Advantages of the property. Poor quality tenants in that area. References to Monticello, Mont Blanco, Maria Eppes, and the Randolphs. [621]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to HENRY REMSEN.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #3258.

scopecontent.p: Letter by British packet. Logan's trip to France. John Barnes will pay funds due. Mentions Virginia, Hamburg, Paris, newspapers. [2568]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to Stevens Thomson Mason. Receipted by Richard Williams for Stevens Thomson Mason. [2569]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to NICHOLAS LEWIS.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Copy by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Letterpress copy in DLC. Printed: L & B X 89-92.

scopecontent.p: Advising reason not rashness (regarding the Alien and Sedition laws). [622]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES MADISON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: B of R VI 296 (letterpress copy in DLC). #38-414-a.

scopecontent.p: Measures against the Alien and Sedition laws. [623]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Silked. Another MS. in MHi. #5385-o.

scopecontent.p: Sale of Eppes' lands, and hiring of his slaves by Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. Recruiting army for French war. Bill to retaliate on French citizens if French injure impressed seamen. Copy of [John?] Nicholas' pamphlet. [624]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp., with attached address leaf. Signature cut. Owned by Miss Florence P. Kennedy. #5385-o. Printed: SNR, 216-17.

scopecontent.p: Quotes Ossian. Trip to Monticello. Eppington, via Fredericksburg and Richmond, too far. T. J. thinks she is at Montblanco. Letter to John Wayles Eppes. [2570]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Duplicates item 2570. [2571]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to ARCHIBALD STUART.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford VII 350-355; L & B X 100-104; B of R VI 444 (letterpress copy in DLC). Another MS. in Vhi.

scopecontent.p: Petitions from Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and New York against standing armies and the Alien and Sedition Acts. [625]

did.unittitle: EDMUND PENDLETON, Virginia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #5775.

scopecontent.p: Too ill to go to Philadelphia. Pendleton's republican ideas to be published in Richmond. Virginia politics. [2572]

did.unittitle: [THOMAS JEFFERSON], Monticello, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Mont Blanco, Va.
did.physdesc: AL[S clipped]. 1 pp., with attached address leaf. McGregor Library, #1223. Printed: Randall II 506-507; SNR 257.

scopecontent.p: Martha Randolph has arrived from Belmont. Attempts to make Monticello habitable. Hopes for visit from Maria. Mentions John Wayles Eppes. [626]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Subscriptions to U. S. Government loan of five millions. William Short's certificates. Good for Monticello, including linseed oil, sweet oil, figs and raisins, sash doors, cloverseed, groceries, and books, shipped aboard the Sloop Little Jim. [627]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia. to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Myers' account of his travels in France not available in Philadelphia. Payment of drafts for T. J. and William Short. Scrip is down. Goods and bill of exchange sent to General Kosciuszko in care of Messrs. Nicholas and Jacob Van Staphorst and Hubbard via the ship Stadt Hamburgh, Capt. Heer Sjoerds. Planes, saws, plants, coffee, and rice ready for Sloop Sally, Capt. E. Potter. [628]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp., with attached address leaf. Hand franked. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Invoices enclosed. Plants for Monticello. Letter for [Benjamin F.] Bache. Payment to Joseph Roberts. Reference to Mr. Bartram. [629]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Goods, bills of exchange, and letters for General Kosciuszko shipped aboard the Stadt Hamburgh, to Van Staphorst & Hubbard. Mentions [William?] Adamson. [630]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, [Eppington].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with partial attached address leaf (address cut); silked. #38-576. Printed: Randall II 507.

scopecontent.p: Doubts he can visit Eppington. Work done by Page on J. W. Eppes' land. News of Peter Carr, Samuel Carr, Dr. and Mrs. [Benjamin F.] Bache, Champe Carter, Dupont de Nemours, and Ellen Randolph. [631]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Certificates for William Short. Chimney piece in charge of Mr. Dorsey. Letter enclosed from [Tench] Coxe. [632]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES MONROE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by James Monroe Museum and Memorial Library, Fredericksburg. #3159.

scopecontent.p: Grievances of people of Charlottesville and Milton to go to Mr. Divers. [2573]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Account with T. J. Payment to Joseph Roberts. Tobacco prices falling. Recommends barter of tobacco for clothes. Great risks involved in shipments to Europe. Scarcity of money. [633]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Chesterfield.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf; silked. Hand franked. #38-576.

scopecontent.p: Crop prospects poor. Has given Page corn for Eppes' slaves and horses until harvest. Urges early visit to Monticello. [634]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON LETTER COVER, Signed, to HENRY REMSEN, New York.
did.physdesc: Photostat. Original owned by Bruce E. Engstler. #7786.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to Dr. David Jackson. [2575]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Brand's patent for 1,000 acres of land. Doors made for T. J. by Mr. Trump. Nailrod from Joseph Roberts. [635]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON DEED to THOMAS AUGUSTUS TAYLOR, Chesterfield County.
did.physdesc: ADS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #1162. Photostat. Original owned by Miss Amanda Pitts.

scopecontent.p: Conveying 669 acres of land in Goochland County, including Elkhill, which T. J. had purchased from Henry and Anne Skipwith. Witnessed by David Bullock, Elisha Leak, Lilburne Lewis, Randolph Lewis, and James Martin. Recorded by W. Miller, Clerk of Goochland County. [636]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILSON CARY NICHOLAS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; silked? Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533. Printed: L and B X, 130-32.

scopecontent.p: Discussed Kentucky-Virginia resolutions with Madison. Persuaded by Madison to omit references to secession. Loss of John Nicholas and visit of John Marshall to Kentucky create problems. [2576]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Moyer-Jefferson Papers, #9828.

scopecontent.p: Order for payment to George Jefferson & Co. for $500.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON LEASE OF SHADWELL TO CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ADS. 2 pp.; Barrow. Owned by Office of Clerk of Albemarle County Court. #5145. Printed: Betts, Farm Book, 166-68.

scopecontent.p: Witnessed by James Dinsmore, Robert Bolling, and Richard Richardson. Mentions Monticello. [2577]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON LEASE OF SHADWELL to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ADS. 2 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Endorsed by T. J. #12436. Original MS. owned by C. S. Hutter, Jr.

scopecontent.p: Lease for a part of Shadwell for five years, the rent to be paid in gold or silver money. No field to be sown in corn more than one year; each field to lie fallow or be sown in peas or clover for two years. Witnessed by Robert Bolling, James Densmore, and Richard Richardson. [638]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to STEPHEN T. MASON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist, ca. 1830. Printed: Ford VII 379-399.

scopecontent.p: Congratulations on [Thomas] McKean's election [as Governor of Pennsylvania]. Republican party in Pennsylvania. Reformation of Congress at least two years away. Protagonists of England and France in Congress. [639]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CHARLES PINCKNEY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist, ca. 1830. Printed: Ford VII 379-399; B of R VI 371 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Oliver Ellsworth and James Iredell working toward a monarchy through common law doctrine. Washington's attitude. French misfortunes and British aggressions. [640]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Albemarle County, to [?].
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #4898.

scopecontent.p: John Haden to guide Chickasaw Indians to see Governor in Richmond. [2578]

did.unittitle: JOHN BRECKINRIDGE, Frankfort, Ky., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract for N. P. Trist, ca. 1830. Printed: B of R VIII 68 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Kentucky Resolutions. Popular opposition to the Alien and Sedition laws. [641]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; silked; repair and loss of text on upper right corner. #38-576.

scopecontent.p: [William] Woods defeated Peter Carr in election. [Wilson C.?] Nicholas and T. J. delayed by snow. News of Eppes' slaves. Agrees to engage Powell (as overseer?). Reference to Mr. and Mrs. Francis Eppes. [642]

did.unittitle: JAMES L. HENDERSON. DEED to TUCKER M. WOODSON.
did.physdesc: D. 4 pp.; Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. and others. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Conveying his share of Bennett Henderson's estate, excepting his interest in a mill and a lot and house in Milton. Witnessed by Marbell Camden, William Gambill, and Bennett [H.] Henderson. John Henderson's bond for James Henderson's performance of contract, 28 December 1799, witnessed by Thomas Concord and John Agg. Woodson's assignment of his title to Craven Peyton, 25 April 1801, witnessed by Samuel H. Woodson and Bred. Gaines. (See letter from Jefferson to Peyton regarding purchase of Woodson's share 15 January 1801). [643]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Extract. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: On same sheet as [2706], 1805 March 26. [2579]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN STEELE, COMPTROLLER OF THE U.S.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Frank Ix, Jr. #6820.

scopecontent.p: William Short's U.S. Treasury account payable to John Barnes. [2580]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [?].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Fragment. Last page only. Edgehill Randolph Papers. #5533.

scopecontent.p: Wheat crop. Mentions Mr. Donald and Philadelphia. [2581]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON MATHEMATICS PROBLEM.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp.; Barrow. #2789.

scopecontent.p: Solution of a geometrical problem from Jonathan Williams' Thermometrical Navigation.[644]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to Tench Coxe. Receipted by Ezekiel Foreman for Tench Coxe. [2582]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Birth of Maria's daughter. [645]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Senate Chamber, to MR. PARKER, Franklin Court.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf. #8002.

scopecontent.p: Houdon's equestrian statue of Washington in the Capitol at Richmond. Prices in Paris, Rome, and Florence. Mentions sculptor Ceracchi. [2582-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to CATHARINE CHURCH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf. Hand franked and franked with ink stamp. #11245.

scopecontent.p: Writes fond remembrances of her visits, and mentions his daughters Martha Jefferson Randolph and Mary Jefferson Eppes and that the latter has become a mother.

did.unittitle: HENRY REMSEN, New York, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Factors involved in low tobacco prices. Possibilities of peace in Europe. Subscription to newspapers and to prices current. Yellow fever epidemics. Gouverneur Morris' oration on the death of George Washington. [646]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN BRECKINRIDGE, Frankfort, Ky.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford VI 416-419; L & B X 149-150; B of R VI 47 (letterpress copy in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Kentucky Resolutions. Judiciary district for the West. Fear for republicanism in France. References to Napoleon Bonaparte and the Directory. [647]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to BISHOP JAMES MADISON.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Typescript copy. Original owned by St. George Tucker Grinnan. Printed: B of R VI 287 (MS. in DLC). #2118.

scopecontent.p: Sends book by Joseph Priestley. Discussion of Augustin Barruel's Antisocial Conspiracy. Religious and philosophical doctrines of Wishaupt, Godwin, and Morse. [648]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to [WILLIAM] BACHE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: B of R VI 20 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Importance of minority rights with majority rule. Danger of a military force. Bonaparte's overthrow of the French Constitution. [649]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.].
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. Fragment. Last page only. Photostat. Original owned by Harold Jefferson Coolidge; probably the last page of a letter in possession of MHi. #2873.

scopecontent.p: Death of his coachman, Jupiter, at Fredericksburg. Orders for bottling cider. Mentions [Richard] Richardson. [650]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Maria's illness; attended by Dr. Turpin. [651]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to Maurice Rogers. [2583]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to John Hawkins. [2584]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Eppington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp., with attached address leaf; Barrow. Hand franked. #501. Printed: Randall II 535-536; SNR 263-264.

scopecontent.p: Death of Maria's child. Failure of the mails. Plans to visit her on the way to Monticello. Inquiries about her health. References to Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and John Wayles Eppes. [652]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Maria's illness. [653]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange to T. J. [2585]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to GEORGE WYTHE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #4669 VOID. Photostat. Original owned by Henry N. Flynt. #4669.

scopecontent.p: Parliamentary irregularities of Continental Congress and U.S. House of Representatives. Senate better. Encloses text of T. J. A Manual of Parliamentary Practice for Wythe's corrections. [2586]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON A MANUAL OF PARLIAMENTARY PRACTICE.
did.physdesc: AMS. 4 pp. Draft. Fragment. Photostat. #3449-b. Original owned by Barron U. Kidd.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to HENRY REMSEN.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Letterpress copy. Owned by Mrs. Edwin Page Kirk. #5291.

scopecontent.p: Envoys at Lisbon. Sell tobacco to Mr. Lieper, not to French. Bordeaux and London prices. West Indies stock. John Barnes to pay draft. New York market. Congress to adjourn. [2587]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to GEORGE MEADE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf. #10428-d.

scopecontent.p: Explains how the proceeds from his annual tobacco crop are used to pay his supply merchant in Virginia.

did.unittitle: THOMAS CARR. RECEIPT TO THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: For nails received from [Richard] Richardson by Carr and Thomas Bell. [654]

did.unittitle: JOHN KELLY RECEIPT to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Nails and brads delivered by R. Richardson. [2588]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to JAMES MONROE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist, ca. 1830. Printed: B of R VI 332 and II 111 (letterpress copy in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Aversion to ceremony and wish to avoid newspaper publicity. Visit to Eppington. Progress of good sense and Republicanism. [655]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to RICHARD RICHARDSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #3177. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation.

scopecontent.p: Sent box of plants and plaster of Paris. Instructions for construction at Monticello. Horses to meet him at Eppington. References to Davy Bowles, Nicholas Lewis, Reuben Perry, and Mr. Short. [656]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Mont Blanco.
did.physdesc: AL[S clipped]. 1 pp., with attached address leaf; silked. Hand franked. #38-576. Printed: Randall II 536-537; SNR 264-265. Pencil note: "Signature cut by permission of Mrs. Francis Eppes. Chas. W. Ward."

scopecontent.p: Plans for trip to Monticello via Eppington or Mont Blanco. References to John Wayles Eppes, Francis Eppes, Martha Randolph, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [657]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mont Blanco, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp., with attached address leaf. Hand franked. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Maria's health restored. T. J.'s trip to Mont Blanco. Mr. Powell has agreed to go to Monticello (as overseer?). Reference to Miss Church. Death of [John?] Bolling. [658]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Suit against D. Mossis, involving James Ross, Mr. Skitt, P. Cours, and Colonel Morrir. Lilly's efficiency as overseer. Wheat crop, fruit, and sheep in good condition. [Richard] Richardson's work on T. J.'s apartment. Ursula's illness due to poisons of the "Buckingham Negro conjuror." Forwards sheeting samples. [659]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Philadelphia, to DEAR SIR.

scopecontent.p: Discusses arrangements to have horses sent from Monticello to the home of John Wayles Eppes, where he intends to rest for a few days.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON IN ACCOUNT WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accountwith John Barnes, his commission agent and financial manager. [670]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #123.

scopecontent.p: Covering an account. Packages in the hands of Mr. Sheaff. Shipment of goods including china and oil. Eight per cent stock looking up. Purchase of government stock for William Short, Tadeusz Kosciuszko, and T. J. Medicine from Dr. Jackson. References to Mr. Stewart (Gilbert Stuart?) and G. Simpson. [660]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON IN ACCOUNT WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accountwith John Barnes, his commission agent and financial manager. [670]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Eppington, to JAMES MONROE.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford VII 447-449; B of R II 111 and VI 332 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Disapproves of Union dinner. Disregard of Chase's accusations of atheism. Callender should be defended. Arrival of treaty from France. Reference to Dupont. [661]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON IN ACCOUNT WITH HENDERSON, McCAUL & CO., Manchester, England.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Company's account, signed by James Lyle, covering T. J.'s payments from 4 March 1790 to 12 November 1798 on his bond. [662]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Mont Blanco, Va.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow; free frank cut away; part of signature cut away. McGregor Library, #1223. Printed: Randall II 565; SNR 268.

scopecontent.p: Dr. and Mrs. [William] Bache, and Mrs. Monroe are in the neighborhood. The "Forte piano" has arrived. Murder of Birch [Samuel Burch] by George Carter. Heavy wheat crop. Hopes for visit from Maria and John Eppes. [663]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Bill of exchange for Van Staphorst & Hubbard. T. J.'s chairs misdirected to [James?] Brown for Col. [Samuel J.?] Cabell. References to Mrs. Ratcliffe and [J.] Letchworth. [664]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Francis Eppes' accident. Money required by Francis Eppes as security for Daniel Hylton. Maria Eppes mentioned. [665]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PHILIP NORBORNE NICHOLAS. ALS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Labeled "duplicate." #8404.

scopecontent.p: Post script dated September 17 explains that T. J. believed original document miscarried, thus he his sending a duplicate. Architectural plan for Nicholas' house. Peter Carr's plan. [2588-a]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Forwarding an account. Discounts at the Bank of Pennsylvania. Bill of exchange to Van Staphorst & Hubbard for the credit of "P. M." Has acquired new house and store. Government stock for Tadeusz Kosciuszko, William Short, and J. B. Reference to Mrs. Ratcliffe, [John] Richards, S. T. Mason. [666]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON IN ACCOUNT WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accountwith John Barnes, his commission agent and financial manager. [670]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN BEELE BOARDLY.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Owned by George Green Shackelford. #3525-d.

scopecontent.p: Mrs. Randolph, whom Boardly knew in England, holds marriage contract annuity payable by Peter Randolph, Peyton Randolph, and Philip Grymes. Peter Randolph's estate insolvent. Edmund Randolph is Peyton Randolph's heir. Suit filed against Philip Grymes, who can claim against Edmund Peyton, who cannot pay. [2589]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to SAMUEL SMITH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Deposited by Albert H. Small. #12613.

scopecontent.p: TJ has refused to accept a gift of two casks of wine from [Josef] Yznardi as he accepts no presents in office. TJ will pay for the wine and asks Smith to forward the casks to Gibson & Jefferson. TJ congratulates Smith on the "triumphs of republicanism" in Baltimore adding that the "spirit of 76 had never left the people...." He assures Smith that whether or not he wins the presidency the republicans will have a majority in the House of Representatives which "will keep the government from running wild...."

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s accommodations at Mr. Conrade's. Nautical Almanacs ordered. Pamphlet regarding C. C. P[inckney]. References to Messrs. Langdon, Baldwin, and Brown. [667]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Price of handkerchiefs. Reference to Mr. Munn. [668]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests that Samuel Woodson replace Nathaniel Perkins as postmaster at Goochland Court House. [669]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON IN ACCOUNT WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accountwith John Barnes, his commission agent and financial manager. [670]

did.unittitle: REMBRANDT PEALE to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp.; address on verso. Endorsed by T. J. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5385-k.

scopecontent.p: Wants to study in Europe as did John Trumbull. Prefers diplomatic post in France to one in Italy. [2590]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #4979.

scopecontent.p: Congress assembled. Housing costs more than at Philadelphia. Senate opposition to French treaty. Judiciary. Territorial governments. Votes of Vermont, Kentucky, Tennessee uncertain. Republican candidates have more votes than Federalists, Mr Adams and Mr. Pinckney. Mr. Powell builds nailery. Mentions Col. Burr, Maria, and Edgehill. [2591]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON IN ACCOUNT WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accountwith John Barnes, his commission agent and financial manager. [670]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON NOTES ON MILEAGES.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp.; Barrow. #6225.

scopecontent.p: Lists Monticello, Thornton Gap, Ruffner's, Cunningham's Mill, Rockfish Gap, Kennerley's, Madison's Cove, Jones's, Gilbert's, Narrow Passage, Rappidan, Robinson River, Brown's Culpeper Court House, Hedgeman River, Fauquier Court House, Germantown, [Pa.?], Widow Nevill's, West's Ordinary, Leesburg, Knowland's Ferry, Zane's, Winchester, Threetons, McCormack's, Harper's Ferry, Frederictown, [Md.?], Bentley's. Taverns listed, Leesburg: McEntire's, Indian King; Frederictown: Crush's, Sycamore Tree; Tawney Town: Mrs. Charlton's, Caleb's, Bacchus and Threetons; Petersburg: Kurtz's, The Swan; McAllister's Town: Rhenegher's; Yorktown: White's, Sign of the Lemon; Lancaster: Rickhart's, The Bear. Other towns: Alexandria, Colchester, Dumfries, Lansdowne, Elkrun Church, Piscotaway, Port Tobacco, Howe's Ferry, Port Royal, Bowling Green, Hanover Court House, Goodall's, Richmond. [2592]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON SKETCH FOR HOUSE AND DEPENDENCY.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Fragment. Addressed on verso to T. J., Albemarle. #6225. See Nichols, N-465.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON [Monticello], to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Plan for crop rotation--wheat, corn, and rye--for the years 1800-1804. [671]

did.unittitle: PLAN OF SOUTH WING OF CAPITOL.
did.physdesc: 1 p. ink and watercolor; 14 3/4" X 20 3/4" #5385-ap.

scopecontent.p: Not executed by Jefferson. [N-390]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON NOTES FOR AN UNIDENTIFIED TOWN HOUSE.
did.physdesc: Notes (2 pp.) and elevation in ink, plans of first and second floors and section in pencil. #10264.

scopecontent.p: These notes are from ca. 1800, as the remodeling of Monticello is mentioned in the notes. These drawings, however, are not for Monticello, but for a house in town, probably Philadelphia. These drawings were evidently modified and submitted to James Barbour for Barboursville in 1817 as stated by Kimball. [N-4a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON STUDY FOR ROTUNDA-PLAN HOUSE (PROBABLY FOR THE PRESIDENT'S HOUSE IN WASHINGTON).
did.physdesc: Pencil, ink notes on reverse. Wove paper, probably CL, watermarked LONDON. 9 1/2 x 8 in. McGregor Library, #770.

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. #2439. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: Family's health good. Lilly's difficulties in hiring workers. Arrival of [John] Craven, new overseer. Work done at Monticello in clearing fields and in the nailery. Problems of handling the slaves. Mentions Mr. Powell and [Richard] Richardson, overseers. [672]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Bermuda Hundred.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp., with attached address leaf; silked. #38-576. Printed: Ford VII 477-479; Randall II 594; SNR 271-272.

scopecontent.p: Visit to Mount Vernon. Enquiries about Maria from Martha Washington and Mrs. Lewis. Election of 1800. Colonel Burr's conduct honorable. Family meetings at Monticello and in Washington planned. [673]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Money for T. J. in check and cash. Reference to John Richards. [674]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Martha's illness. Lilly making up a gang. Clover, peas, turnips for the garden. Turnips required to feed sheep. Election to be decided in the House of Representatives. Reference to Cornelia Randolph. [675]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JOSEPH ANTHONY.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; mounted on card. #10428.

scopecontent.p: T. J. writes regarding the payment he made Trumbull for a double pair of prints which he paid with an order on Leroy and Bayard.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON IN ACCOUNT WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accountwith John Barnes, his commission agent and financial manager.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Remittance to Gibson & Jefferson. Credit to William Short's account. [676]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Docketed by T. J. McGregor Library. #564.

scopecontent.p: Requests Peyton to purchase shares of Henderson estate for T. J. in Peyton's name. Survey of line between T. J.'s land and the Henderson land. Equal vote for Republican candidates in the election of 1800. References to Colle, [John] Watson, and [Robert] Snelson. [677]

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Amelia, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp.; Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Apologizes for long delay in writing. Offers to purchase his land near Lynchburg. Report that T. J. cast deciding vote in nomination of bankrupt son-in law of Adams, Joshua Johnston, as postmaster. [678]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS.1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: William Short's account. [679]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sends two pairs of black silk stockings. References to Mr. Pickford and Mr. Latimore. [680]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Amelia, Va.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Docketed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Refuses to sell Poplar Forest. Justifies his vote for Joshua Johnston. References to John Adams and George Washington. [681]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Docketed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Martha's illness. Anne Randolph's disposition. Election thrown into the House of Representatives. Comments on visitors who refuse to confine themselves to visiting hours. [682]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR. to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Coming election. Dinsmore's account. Mentions Lillie [Gabriel Lilly?] and Dr. Bache. [2594]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to [THOMAS JEFFERSON].
did.physdesc: AL. 2 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Salary payments when he changes position on March 4. Urges that T. J. draw on him if necessary. Accounts with William Short and Tadeusz Kosciuszko. [683]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to MARIA JEFFERSON EPPES, Bermuda Hundred.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf. #38-576. Printed: Randall II 599-600.

scopecontent.p: Election still deadlocked. Denies personal ambition, but wishes to bring government back to republican principles. Plans for trip to Monticello. [684]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; Barrow. Letterpress copy. Docketed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Purchase of John R. Kerr's and Tucker Woodson's shares of the Bennett Henderson estate. Election concluded. [685]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; torn and stained; with partial address leaf. Owned by Miss Florence P. Kennedy. #5385-o.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Tyler took letter to Maria. Eppes family at Monticello. Bedford stock. Gibson & Jefferson to pay for horses. Horses from Dr. Walker, Mr. Bell, and Mr. Haxall. Cost of Presidency. Col. Hoomes's horses. Federalists weak. Senate may reject nominations. No European news. [2595]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to RICHARD RICHARDSON
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #11308. Photostat.

scopecontent.p: T. J. states he does not know the price of journeymen in D.C., but expects there will be more work in D.C. than Philadelphia. T. J. has engaged someone else to do his own brick or stone work, therefore, he would have no employment for Richardson.

did.unittitle: JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON, Amelia, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp.; Barrow. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Glad of his explanation of Joshua Johnston's appointment. Congratulations on his election to presidency. Asks for appointment to office. [686]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON FIRST INAUGURAL ADDRESS.
did.physdesc: AD. 4 pp. #2535. Photostat. Original owned by Herman H. Diers. Printed: Ford VIII 1-6; Tucker II 87-92.

scopecontent.p: Stressing harmony and unity, the value of Republican principles, need for wise and frugal, but not too powerful, government. Outlines the essential principles of our government. [687]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to SAMUEL SMITH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf; Barrow. #2686. Printed: B of R VI 435 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Measures relative to the Navy. Postpones answer to Smith's letter regarding a consulship for William Buchanan. References to James Madison, Albert Gallatin. [688]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #9013. Photostat. Original owned by Muzeum Narodowe w Krakowie, Poland. #9013.

scopecontent.p: John Barnes wrote about Kosciuszko's financial affairs. Bank stock converted to U.S. government loan. Republican majority. Land for Kosciuszko near Monticello. Mentions Mr. Dawson and Mr. Pichon. [2595-a]

did.unittitle: ISHAM HENDERSON. DEED to JAMES L. HENDERSON, Albemarle County.
did.physdesc: DS. 5 pp. on 3 l. attached with sealing wax. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Conveying Isham Henderson's share of Bennett Henderson's estate to James L. Henderson, and from him to Craven Peyton. Witnesses: Dan Richarson, Abraham Grove, John McLean, and William Clark. Confirmation of deed by Isham upon his coming of age, 6 June 1804. Certification by Matthew Flournoy and Thomas Given, Justices of the Peace of Shelby County, Ky., by James Craig, Clerk of Shelby County, Ky., and by Isaac Ellis, Presiding Justice of the Peace of Shelby County. [689]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to PHILIP MAZZEI.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp., with attached address leaf. #11220.

scopecontent.p: Conveys personal and public news. Topics include his health; Mazzei's marriage; a humorous comment on marriage in general; vetches; cymling and squash seeds, with a suggestion for hybridizing; the sale of Colle; the poverty of an old friend; Bishop James Madison and his new cabinet officers.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JAMES WARREN.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Letterpress copy in DLC. Printed: L & B X 231-232.

scopecontent.p: Rejoicing over the victory of the Republican Party. [690]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to BENJAMIN WARING, Columbia, S. C.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Letterpress copy in DLC. Printed: L & B X 235-236.

scopecontent.p: The will of the people is the only legitimate foundation of government. [691]

did.unittitle: SURVEY NOTES CONCERNING BEDFORD COUNTY LANDS.
did.physdesc: D. 14 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Probably owned by T. J.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown. ACCOUNTS AGAINST THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Accounts submitted by Barnes, who acted as T. J.'s fiscal agent and commission merchant during the year 1801. [756]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to SAMUEL SMITH, Baltimore.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf. #2686. Printed: B of R VI 435 (MS. in DLC); Ford VIII 28-99.

scopecontent.p: Suggesting temporary acceptance of the post of Secretary of the Navy. Factors involved in the appointments of [William] Kilty, [Wilson Cary] Nicholas, and James Wilkinson. Importance of civilian control of the military. References to [Gabriel] Duval. [692]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to SAMUEL SMITH, Baltimore.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp., with attached address leaf. #2686. Printed: B of R VI 435 (MS. in DLC); Randall III 630.

scopecontent.p: Consultation regarding the Navy Department. [693]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CATHARINE CHURCH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; with attached address leaf. Franked by T. J. #11245.

scopecontent.p: Comments on being elected to the presidency of the United States: "The post is not enviable, as it affords little exercise for social affections. There is something within us which makes us wish to have things conducted in our own way, and which we generally fancy to be patriotism. This passion is gratified by such a position." Mentions that Maria Jefferson Eppes and Martha Jefferson Randolph are pregnant.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to MESSRS. EDDY, [JONATHAN RUSSELL], [THURBER], [SETH?] [WHEATON], AND [SMITH], Providence, R. I.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Washington] to BENJAMIN RUSH.
did.physdesc: D. [24] pp. numbered 1-16, 19-26 Barrow. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: TJR III 514-515; L & B 379-385; B of R VI 398 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Formerly a volume of stitched sheets. At some point, the volume was disassembled and pages 1-16 and the wrapper were laminated using the Barrow method. The remaining pages (19-26) were not laminated. The leaf for pages 17-18 is not present.

Pages 1-9, transcription of T. J.'s letter to Rush detailing religious views, [see entry above for original] including T. J.'s Syllabus on an Estimate of the doctrines of Jesus, compared with thoses of others. Three blank leaves laid in.

Pages 10-13, The philosophy of Jesus of Nazareth extracted from the accounts of his life and doctrines as given by Matthew, Mark, Luke, & John. Being an abridgement of the New Testament for the use of the Indians unembarrassed with matters of fact or faith beyond the level of their comprehensions. Title page followed by a table of references.
Pages 14-16, 19-26 blank.

Separate wrapper sheet contains an extract, in a different hand, from the purported deathbed speech of Julian the Apostate, as given in The Life of the Emperor Julian, by Jean-Philippe-René de La Bletterie, (London: Printed for M. Cooper, 1746); written on the verso of a printed sheet of blank bank payment orders, City of Washington, D.C. Jefferson sold his copy of this book to the Library of Congress in 1815.

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON vs. JOHN HENDERSON. COURT RECORD.
did.physdesc: D. 50 pp. Copy attested by John Nicholas, Clerk of Albemarle, and H. Dance, Clerk of Va. Court of Appeals. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Complete record of legal action arising from Peyton's purchase of the estate of Bennett Henderson. Suit over matter of rights reserved by Mrs. Elizabeth Henderson for her son, John, to permit him to convey water through her land from the Rivanna River to his mill. Peyton stopped him with injunction from Albemarle County Court, which was dissolved on appeal. Complete record of trial in county court at which Peyton attempted to prove document reserving this right was fraudulent. Deposition of witnesses, exhibits of certified copies of documents. Case decided in favor of Henderson. Peyton appealed to High Court of Chancery. Appeal refused. After inquest of jurors, Henderson established mill. Petition of appeal to George Wythe, Judge of District Chancery Court, from Peyton allowed. At Court of Appeals held at Capitol in Richmond, 7 January 1812, action of lower court affirmed. Names appearing in the record: William Alcock, James Barbour, Christopher W. Barker, James W. Bramham, N. Bramham, G. Carr, John Carr, Peter Carr, Kemp Catlett, Charlottesville, Va., Henry Chiles, Mr. Connard, James Craig, H. Dance, Martin Dawson, Isaac Ellis, Triplett T. Estis, John Fentress, Thomas C. Fletcher, Matthew Flournoy, Thomas L. Givin, Bennett Henderson, Bennett H. Henderson, Charles Henderson, Eliza Henderson, Elizabeth Henderson, Frances Henderson, Isham Henderson, Helman Henderson, James L. Henderson, John Henderson, Lucy Henderson, Matthew Henderson, Nancy Henderson, Richard Henderson, Sarah Henderson, William Henderson, Henderson & Canardard, Elijah Hogg, John R. Kerr, Sarah Henderson Kerr, John Key, Walter Key, Charles Lewis, James Lewis, J. W. Lewis, Reuben Lewis, William McKim, Isaac Miller, Milton, Va., Dabney Minor, William D. Meriwether, Edward Moore, John Nicholas, James Old, Richard Overton, George Poindexter, Richard Price, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Aaron Ray, Richmond, Va., Rivanna River, John Rogers, Shelby County, Ky., G. Termille, Mr. Thorp, Peter Tinsley, John Watson, Christian Wertenbaker (Wertinbaker), Christopher Wingfield. William Wingfield, W. Wood, Tucker Woodson, George Wythe, Charles Yancey. [907]

scopecontent.p: Suit against David Michie of Buck Island concerning claims of Elizabeth Henderson and her minor children to lands and mill formerly owned by Bennett Henderson at Milton. Brief contains letters or depositions of James Henderson, Richard Price, James Lewis, Elizabeth Henderson, John Henderson, Craven Peyton, Charles Henderson, David Michie, Kemp Catlett, William Wood, James Barbour, Elijah Hogg, and Martin Dawson. Appeal heard by George Wythe in Richmond. Contains documents certified in courts of Shelby County, Kentucky. Contains letters, David Michie to T. J., dated 1812 June 18, 1812 June 21, 1812 June 27, 1812 July 20, 1813 April 23, and 1813 May 30. Contains letters, T. J. to David Michie, dated 1812 June 20, 1812 June 22, 1812 June 27, 1812 July 20, 1813 April 20, and 1813 May 30. [2700-a]

J. regarding his share of the Henderson estate; statement of the real property belonging to the legatees; and miscellaneous notes on pertinent information. Names mentioned: Richard Anderson, N. Bramham, Eliza Bullock, Kemp Catlett, George Hay, Bennett H. Henderson, Charles Henderson, Eliza Henderson, Elizabeth Henderson, Isham Henderson, James Lewis Henderson, John Henderson, Matthew Henderson, Nancy Crawford Henderson, Sarah Henderson, and William Henderson; Henderson & Connard, David Higginbotham, Elijah Hogg, Mr. Johnson, John R. Kerr, Sarah Henderson Kerr, Walte Key, Isaac Miller, E. Moore, Matthew Nelson, Nancy Crawford Henderson Nelson, Craven Peyton, Richard Price, Thomas Eston Randolph, Richard Seabrook, Watson & Snelson, John Wood Lucy Henderson Wood, and Tucker M. Woodson. scopecontent.p: Regarding his account with [Thomas] Bell. Reference to Reuben Perry and to George Washington. [924]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.

scopecontent.p: Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr.'s election seems certain. [925]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Stump Island, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2143.

scopecontent.p: Martha's health. Election results. [927]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JAMES OLDHAM, Richmond.

scopecontent.p: Letter to Judge Gantt of Bladensburg, Md., regarding Oldham's concerns in the Jackson estate. Ornaments for Corinthian frieze. Mentions Mr. Andrews. [928]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to PHILIP MAZZEI.

scopecontent.p: T. J. writes about a certificate for Bellini's death, planting fruit trees and delaying the shipping of wines until October so they will not be spoiled by heat. He requests Mazzei to send him a bottle each of white Verdea and Muscatel.

did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-576. Printed: Randall III 136.

scopecontent.p: Payment for a horse. Plans to lay off portion of Poplar Forest (for Eppes?) with aid of [Charles] Clay and [Bowling] Clarke. Invitation to Monticello. Misleading letter of [James?] Elliot printed in the paper. [929]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JUSTIN PIERRE P. DE RIEUX.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Fragment. #3045.

scopecontent.p: Printed: B of R VI 390 (MS. in DLC). Failure of solid-stemmed wheat. [930]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accounts with Mr. Cheetham, Mr. Erwin, Mrs. Radcliffe, Colonel Colfax settled by John Richards and Mr. Ludlow. [931]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accounts with T. J. and General Kosciuszko. Reference to Van Staphorst & Hubbard. [932]

did.unittitle: ROBERT BRENT to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Accepts dinner invitation. [933]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library. #564.

scopecontent.p: [John] Henderson's interference in the collections for firewood. Deeds, depositions regarding the Henderson estate forwarded to George Hay. Requests remittance through George Jefferson. Mentions [Richard] Anderson. [934]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Arrangements for remittance through George Jefferson. Requests particulars of purchase from Eliza Bullock and a note of the quantity of tobacco received at the Henderson warehouses for the past years. Statement of the rights in the warehouses of the Henderson heirs, Elizabeth, John, James L., Charles, Isham, Bennett H., Frances, Lucy, and Nancy C. Henderson, Eliza Henderson Bullock, and Sarah Kerr. Mentions Richard Anderson, [James W.?] Bramham, Richard Seabrook, and Tucker M. Woodson. [935]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Lilly's plan to leave Monticello to supervise work of clearing the Rivanna River. Suggestion that Lilly might he retained by being allowed to oversee a farm as well as the nailery. Damage done to crops by the Hessian fly. Health of Martha, Anne, Ellen, Cornelia, Virginia, and Thomas Jefferson Randolph. Mentions Mrs. [Nicholas?] Lewis and [John] Craven. [936]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Payment for Bennett Henderson estate shares. Decline in Henderson's warehouse business can be remedied by cash commission, which would restore tobacco business now going to Columbia, Va. [937]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Payments to George Jefferson. Deeds to Bennett Henderson estate. Reference to John Bullock. [938]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON MEMORANDUM ON HENDERSON ESTATE.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Memorandum of the rights in the tobacco warehouses of the Henderson estate. (See entry, T. J. to Craven Peyton, 13 June 1805, for details.) [939]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Barnes' resources insufficient to handle T. J.'s business. [940]

did.unittitle: JAMES MONROE, to "DEAR SIR"

scopecontent.p: Monroe writes to recommend George William Erving for a consular post.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for T. J.'s gift of Commodore Preble's marsala and sherry wines. [941]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM WIRT, Williamsburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. McGregor Library, #5622.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Perilous thunderstorm. Letter from Etienne LeMaire. References to Mr. Burwell, Mr. and Mrs. Carey. [942]

did.unittitle: BOWLING CLARK[E], Hillscreek, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON Monticello, to WILLIAM WIRT.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #5622.

scopecontent.p: Praises Henry for giving "first impulse to the ball of revolution" and for oratory, but criticizes ignorance of law and avarice. [2710]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payments for T. J. to the Rev. Mr. Pryce and to Mr. Corkle. Barnes' account with T. J. enclosed. T. J.'s visit to Bedford County. [944]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Asks consultation to inform George Hay whether he should enter an appeal in the Henderson case. [945]

did.unittitle: GEORGE WHITE, Spread Eagle, Penna., to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #123. Printed: Ford-Bixby 116-117.

scopecontent.p: Asks patronage for a straw hat factory. Mentions Mr. Emery, American Consul in England. [946]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: James Madison's draft on T. J. will be honored. Payment to Mr. LeMaire for slaves' wages. Plentiful crops. References to Joseph Dougherty and Mr. Andrews. [947]

did.unittitle: PETER CARR in ACCOUNT WITH THOMAS JEFFERSON.

scopecontent.p: Account for nails, brads, spikes rendered by Gabriel Lilly for T. J., to Peter Carr for the years 1804-1805. [948]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to WILSON CARY NICHOLAS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. #38-576. Original owned by Dr. L. M. Blackford.

scopecontent.p: T. J. has asked Mr. Gallatin to send Nicholas a copy of the judgment against Robinsons administration. T. J. comments on the likelihood of war in Europe.

did.unittitle: WILLIAM RUSSELL BIRCH, PORTRAIT OF THOMAS JEFFERSON
did.physdesc: 1 pp. Pen and ink. 12x9 cm. #10059.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JOHN MINOR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. #38-578. Original owned by Dr. L. M. Blackford. Printed: B of R VI 327 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Asks Minor's opinion on whether the Virginia legislature would do anything for Tom Paine. [952]

did.unittitle: SULIMAN MELLI MELLI to THOMAS JEFFERSON

scopecontent.p: Contemporary copy made for Tobias Lear, U.S. consul general to Algiers. The correspondents try to ameliorate a diplomatic crisis caused by the U.S. seizure of a Tunisian ship which tried to run a blockade of the Tripolitan harbor.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON SPECIFICATIONS FOR ROOF AT POPLAR FOREST.

scopecontent.p: Includes sketches of ridge beams. [2712]

did.unittitle: DRAWINGS FOR A CARRIAGE.
did.physdesc: Ink. With: 1806 January 15. Mr. Reibelt, Baltimore, to [?]. ALS. 2 pp. #3352, McGregor Library.

scopecontent.p: For phaeton. Five "figs" and notes on three sheets. [2713, N-532]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to CORNELIA RANDOLPH, Dr. Bankhead's, Port Royal, Va.

scopecontent.p: "A dozen canons of conduct in life." [2714]

did.unittitle: BENNETT H. HENDERSON, Shelbyville, Ky., to CRAVEN PEYTON, Milton, Va.

did.unittitle: JAMES CRAIG, Shelbyville, Ky., to CRAVEN PEYTON, Milton, Va.
