scopecontent.p: Answer delayed by death of younger son. Henderson deeds. Acknowledgment of Hilsman (i.e. Bennett H.) Henderson delayed until he is of age. [954]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to [JOHN HOLMES FREEMAN], Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. McGregor Library, #453.

scopecontent.p: Instructions to the overseer. Brown (a slave) to go to Mr. Jordan at Lexington. Purchase of molasses, fish, and other provisions from [George] Jefferson and [John] Craven. Road repair. Trees to be planted. Payment of debts to James Walker, Cleviers (?) Duke, Thomas Eston Randolph. Essential to get nail factory under way to meet debts. Planting of oats, clover, peas. Mentions [Martin] Dawson, [David] Higginbotham, Gabriel Lilly, Martha Randolph, Jerry and Fanny (slaves). [955]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to SENATE OF U.S.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Location of original unknown. #3449.

scopecontent.p: Letters of Secretary of State. James Madison; Minister Plenipotentiary at Paris, John Armstrong; and Henry Waddell, in ease of ship New Jersey. [2715]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to MR. LAW

scopecontent.p: T. J. thanks Law for the loan of a book and speaks of occupation as a remedy for ennui.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ADDRESS TO CHIEFS OF INDIAN TRIBES: Osages, Kansas, Ottos, Panis, Ayowais, Sioux, Potawatamies, Foxes, Sacs, and Missouri.
did.physdesc: D. 3 pp. Contemporary copy. #2466. Printed: B of R VI 357 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Urging them to live at peace and cultivate the land. [956]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON PAPERS FOR SHIP ONTARIO.
did.physdesc: DS. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Johnson Crawford, Jr. #4309.

scopecontent.p: George Hitch, Master. Ship of New Bedford, Mass. Note on verso, signed by William Lyman, U.S. Consul at London, transfers command from David Nye, Jr., to George Hitch, Jr. [2716]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to DR. [EDWARD] MILLER.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #565.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for pamphlet on yellow fever. Copies sent to diplomatic agents to counteract the disastrous effects on commerce produced by other views. [957]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Acceptance of appointment of Collector of the District of Georgetown. [958]

did.unittitle: LUCY LEWIS, Monteagle, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Parcel from Charles Lewis (her son). Greetings from [Charles L.] Lewis. (her husband). [959]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CHRISTIAN MAYER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #4532. Printed: Betts, Garden Book, 320.

scopecontent.p: Corn. Mr. Reibelt was to order books from France, but Mayer did it instead. [2717]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Urging that there be no duel to settle the quarrel between Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. and John Randolph, but that he seek advice from Peter Carr, [George?] Divers, and [Wilson Cary] Nicholas. Notices of the matter in the National Intelligencer and the Enquirer. [960]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s accounts. [961]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to the BEY OF TUNIS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. 19th century transcript. #9737-a.

scopecontent.p: Contemporary copy made for Tobias Lear, U.S. consul general to Algiers. The correspondents try to ameliorate a diplomatic crisis caused by the U.S. seizure of a Tunisian ship which tried to run a blockade of the Tripolitan harbor.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to WILLIAM ROSCOE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by City of Liverpool Public Library. #5128.

scopecontent.p: Roscoe's History of the Pontificate of Leo X compared to Life of Lorenzo de Medici. Americans do not have time for scientific pursuits. [2718]

did.unittitle: ANNE CARY RANDOLPH, Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Barbecue and an oration in Charlottesville for the Fourth of July. News of Aunt Jane [Randolph], Aunt Lucy [Lewis], Aunt Harriet [Randolph], and Aunt [Martha] Carr. Miss Nicholson reports [Albert] Gallatin may not visit Monticello. [962]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of four barrels of white sugar on Schooner Brothers. [963]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JOHN H. FREEMAN.

scopecontent.p: Leaving for Edgehill and Monticello. Packages from Richmond. Work at mill, garden, and by Milton road. Mr. Burwell's horses and slave. [2719]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, SURVEY OF MONTICELLO, WITH OUTLINE OF BUILDINGS.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. 8 1/4" x 10". Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s accounts. Payments to S. H. Smith, Mr. Peal (Rubens Peale?), Mr. Cheetham and the Washington Academy. Drought in Washington has raised price of wheat. Package arrived in the Sloop Harmony. [964]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Cannot remit money. Valuation of the Henderson mill. [965]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payment of T. J.'s note. [966]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s accounts. Payment to James Brand. Receipt of wine. References to Thomas Carpenter, Etienne LeMaire, and William Short. [967]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payments to James Brand, Oliver Evans, Jones & Howell, and Thomas Carpenter. [968]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DAVID HIGGINBOTHAM, Milton.

scopecontent.p: William Stewart account. Mr. Lilly unavailable. Profit from nailery to apply to debt. [2721]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Martha Randolph and John (slave?) ill. Theft of money intended for Colonel Van Ness. Tobacco crop safe. References to Mr. Estis, J. Speir, and [Ralph?] Wormeley. [969]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, to CAPT. ANDREWS.

scopecontent.p: T. J. "presents his compliments to Capt Andrews & finds on further examination that his figures must be formed within an outline of 13 Inches square only they are to be 30 in number." The note is probably in reference to plaster decorations at Monticello.

did.unittitle: JOHN HENDERSON, Albemarle County. DEED TO MATTHEW HENDERSON AND JAMES LEWIS.
did.physdesc: D. 5 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

James Lewis and Matthew Henderson are to pay certain debts to David Higginbotham, John George, Brown, Rives & Co., Thomas Norvell & Co., Dr. Charles Everette and others. Witnesses: Henry Medearis, Flemg. Goolsby, John H. Martin, and Edward Stone. Copy attested by John Nicholas, Clerk. References to Hill Carter, Shelton Connard, Martha Henderson, Elizabeth Henderson, James and Richard Smith, and Thomas Wells, Jr. [970]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Lancaster, Pa., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Col. [Nicholas?] Lewis' daughters and Peyton attacked by fever. Death of Betsy Lewis. Details of Henderson estate to be settled in case of his death. Attended by Doctors Coon and Freemon. [971]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Work delayed on the Randolph house. John's illness. [972]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to SAMUEL SMITH, Baltimore.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2686. Printed: B of R VI 436 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Appointment of a successor to Robert Purviance. Discord among American officers in St. Louis. Enquiry for a box sent by Brig Lucy, Capt. Peckham, to Mr. Patterson, Consul at Nantes. Relations with the Spanish in West Florida and Louisiana. References to Natchitoches and Bayou Pierre, La. [973]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to MICAJAH CARR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #453.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Strange not the agent of Donald & Burton, London. Sends letter to Mr. Brown, plaintiff's attorney, to prevent steps prejudicial to Carr. [974]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to SAMUEL SMITH, Baltimore.
did.physdesc: AL[S clipped]. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2686. Printed: B of R VI 436 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Condolences for his loss. Mr. Buchanan's enquiry for package sent by Brig Lucy. [975]

did.unittitle: CAESAR A. RODNEY, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. File draft. 3 pp. Owned by George Green Shackelford. #5661-a.

scopecontent.p: Encloses letter from his father Thomas Rodney on situation in the West. Mentions letters from Allan McLane on problems of collecting revenue at port of Wilmington, and judicial decisions affecting revenue laws. Rodney fears Judiciary is undermining the Administration. Cevallos ordered all communication between Madison and Spanish legation turned over to Yrujo. Willingness to replace Judge William Paterson. [2722]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to MAYER AND BRANTZ.

scopecontent.p: Books and bill of lading. Encloses draft on U.S. bank at Baltimore. [2723]

did.unittitle: ANNE CARY RANDOLPH, Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for grass, fowls, and flowers. References to Mr. Shoemaker, [Craven] Peyton, and Martha Randolph. [976]

did.unittitle: THOMAS SEYMOUR, JONATHAN BULL, SYLVESTER WELLS, NATHANIEL PATTEN, DANIEL ALCOTT, THOMAS TISDALL, and HENRY SEYMOUR, Hartford, Conn., to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 5 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #6895.

scopecontent.p: Federalist libels against Republicans. Interference of churchmen in politics and corruption of Federalist newspapers. [2724]

did.unittitle: JOHN HENDERSON. PROPERTY SCHEDULE.

scopecontent.p: Schedule of the property of John Henderson, deeds, and papers in trust for purpose of securing certain moneys to James Lewis and Matthew Henderson. [977]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM ROSCOE to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Photostat. Original owned by City of Liverpool Public Library. #5128-a.

scopecontent.p: Sends Life and Pontificate of Leo X, by way of Ra[lph?] Eddens of Philadelphia. [2725]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, wrapper for accounts and vouchers

scopecontent.p: A small slip of paper, with ends sealed together by wax to form a circular wrapper. On the outside T. J. has written "Daugherty Joseph Acct. & Vouchers. 1808."

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Thorn hedges. Sowing oats in field bought from Mr. Craven. Corn planting. Small ewe that had been at Alexander's died. Joe wants tin for coopers. [2757]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [WILSON CARY NICHOLAS].

scopecontent.p: Check on the Bank of the U.S. for Burgess Griffin. [2757-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. #2873. Original owned by Harold J. Coolidge. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Compromise between Republicans and Quids in Lancaster, Pa., caucus for electors. Madison's chances in Pennsylvania, Connecticut, and Delaware. References to George Clinton, James Madison, James Monroe, and Simon Snyder. [1022]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to the DEMOCRATIC CITIZENS OF ADAMS COUNTY, Penna.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. #38-414-a. Printed: L & B XII 17-18; B of R VI 2 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: First principle of our government: the will of the majority. [1023]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH WHEATON. BILL TO [JOSEPH] DOHERTY FOR THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Bill for corn. [758]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Davy brings horse. Gardening. Mentions Mr. Chisolm and Mr. Dinsmore. Needs nail rod. [2758]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH WHEATON. BILL TO [JOSEPH] DOHERTY FOR THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Bill for corn. [758]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to EDMUND BACON.

scopecontent.p: Davy brings horse. T. J. comes later. Peter Hemings should cook for T. J., and Wormly should tend horses. Mentions Mr. Price. [2759]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH HARRISON, Clifton, to [THOMAS JEFFERSON].
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Surveying land touching Elkhill between Byrd Creek and James River, bought from D. Ross. Meredith Price survey not correct. Cannot locate marker tree on Joshua's branch. [2760]

did.unittitle: HENDERSON, McCAUL & CO. ACCOUNT AGAINST THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: D. 2 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: For November 1798 through July 1806, signed by James Lyle. Records payments from Gibson & Jefferson and C. Clarke. Mentions bonds for Mrs. Jane Jefferson and bond to Richard Harvie. [1024]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON. WILL. THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Second copy: R. J. AD. 1 pp. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: The will of T. J.'s brother. Land and slaves to be divided equally among five sons, Thomas, Robert Lewis, Field, [Isham] Randolph, and [James] Lilburne Jefferson. Executors named: Harding Yerkins, Robert Craig, Robert Lewis Jefferson, and T. J. [1025]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. #3509. Original owned by Randolph E. Shine.

scopecontent.p: Francis Wayles's education and T. J.'s new horse.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JAMES MADISON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #495.

scopecontent.p: Appoints Robert H. Jones of Warrenton, [N. C.], District Attorney for North Carolina. [1026]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Peyton's account. Jerry gone to Bedford. Canal and boat. Mr. Maddox works at stables. Mentions horses, Mr. Chisolm. [2761]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Brown needs money from Bishop. Slaves working for Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and cutting oats. River and canal. Parney corn. [2762]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to EDMUND BACON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Polygraph copy. #9849.

scopecontent.p: T. J. sends instructions on paying notes.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to WILLIAM PELHAM.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. With: AD (bound volume). 30 pp. #10097.

scopecontent.p: T. J. thanks Pelham for his specimen passages written in several phonetic alphabets and notes Voltaire's efforts to reform the French language. He asks Pelham to send him Austin's book on the human character of Jesus. Also included is a notebook, 1808, of sample alphabets sent by Pelham to T. J.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HENRY DEARBORN.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. On sheet with [1028]. Printed: Ford IX 201-202; L & B XII 119-120; B of R VI 116 (MS. in DLC). Another MS. in PPHi.

scopecontent.p: Threat of insurrection by Boston Tories if importation of flour from southern states is stopped. Instructions to Dearborn for War Department action. [1027]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ROBERT SMITH.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. On sheet with [1027]. Printed: L & B XII 121; B of R VI 348 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Boston opposition to stoppage of importation of flour. [1028]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ALBERT GALLATIN.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford IX 202-203; L & B XII 121-128; B of R VI 167 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Difficulties in execution of the Embargo Act. References to Orders in Council and to the Napoleonic Decrees. [1029]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES SULLIVAN.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca.1830. Printed B of R VI 447 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: To the Governor of Massachusetts, concerning enforcement of the Embargo. [1030]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON LIST OF BOOKS GIVEN TO THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Homer, Vergil, Lucan, Claudian, Silius Italicus, Ovid, Juvenal, Perseus, Horace, Seneca the tragedian, Plautus, Terence, Ausonius, Caesar, Suetonius, Tacitus, Justin, Sallust, Boethius, Cicero, Hippocrates. Also, Greek and Latin New Testaments and Orthodoxa Symbola. Printers: Elzevir, Morelli, and Jansson. [2763]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Arrival of boxes. Purchase of a horse for T. J. from Richard Thweatt. References to [Thomas] Bell, Mr. Eggleston, Francis Eppes, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [1031]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ALBERT GALLATIN.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: B of R VI 167 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Regarding a breach of duty by one of the U. S. Collectors. [1032]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN PAGE, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Endorsed by Page. #38-163-b. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Offers to transfer Page's office of Commissioner of Loans for Virginia to his son, Francis, because of Page's ill health. Page's endorsement: "Most generous & consolatory to me!!" [1033]

did.unittitle: ANNE CARY RANDOLPH AND CHARLES BANKHEAD, MARRIAGE CONTRACT.
did.physdesc: AD. Draft copy in hand of T. J. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Binds Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., Martha Jefferson Randolph, and affianced couple. Transfers Poplar Forest, Bedford County, lands to Bankhead. Verso: mathematical calculation and T. J.'s presidential mailing address. [2764]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-576. Printed: Randall III 264.

scopecontent.p: Purchase of horse. Marriage of Anne Randolph and Charles L. Bankhead. Action regarding the Embargo, Orders-in-Council, and Napoleon's decrees. Resistance to Napoleon in Spain. Reference to George Canning. [1034]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Horse purchased for T. J., paid by draft on Gibson & Jefferson, and forwarded by Martin, together with a petrified snake. References to Mr. Williams and Martha Randolph. [1035]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Montpelier, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Edgehill.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Tracing. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Gravy spoons to be converted into dessert spoons. Difficulties with his new horse. References to J. Peyton, Mr. Shoemaker, [Edmund] Bacon, James Madison, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [1036]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mill dam. Garden work. Corn prices. Money for Johnson. Horse Fitch Partner lame. [2765]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s papers. Construction of his mouldboard plow. Pleased to hear of the dynamometer. References to [William?] Meriwether and Nicholas Lewis. [1037]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Spoons and hooks for Thomas J. Randolph forwarded. Wine bottling. Remedies for T. J.'s rheumatism. [1038]

did.unittitle: THOMS JEFFERSON, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Polygraph copy. Moyer-Jefferson Papers, #9828.

scopecontent.p: T. J. asks Randolph to send his watch with either Dr. Porter or Dr. Say, who will be coming for the sitting of Congress. He also asks Randolph to have Mr. McAlister, an optician, make a magnifying glass and includes a small sketch of the design. T. J. encloses ten dollars for two alabaster lamps.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to T. J. RANDOLPH.

scopecontent.p: Letter from Martha J. Randolph. Bundle sent to Philadelphia, as well as box of books from Milton. Forgot to pack some Buffon volumes. T. J. wants his mamaluke bit plated in Philadelphia. Dr. Rush praises T. J. Randolph. [2766]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Museum [Philadelphia], to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Watch repair. Will send to New York for crystal seal. Cannot get Bell's Anatomy; using Fyfe. Mentions Voight, Dr. Porter, Dr. Mitchell. [2767]

did.unittitle: JAMES and LUCY LEWIS. DEED to CRAVEN PEYTON, Albemarle County.
did.physdesc: DS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Conveying the mill site of the Bennett Henderson estate. Witnessed by Charles D. Thomas, N. K. Thomas, Joel Shiflett, and Whittiker Carter. Recorded 4 April 1809 by John Nicholas, Clerk of Albemarle County Court. Mentions John Henderson and Matthew Henderson. [1039]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Museum, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Progress in Medical School. References to Philip S. Physick, James Woodhouse, Caspar Wistar, and Benjamin Say. Purchase of Bell's Anatomy. [1040]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AL. Fragment. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Note to Mrs. Carter for John Pace's and Nicholas Gianniny's corn. Mr. Lammons, stone mason, not yet working. Davy wants to see his wife Christmas. [Break in text]. Mentions miller and Robert Teril. [2768]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to OLIVER EVANS, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Owned by George Green Shackelford. #5661.

scopecontent.p: Machinery used in T. J.'s mill was patented by Evans. T. J. to pay Evans' agent, John Moody, by draft on U.S. Bank at Philadelphia. [2769]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #2143.

scopecontent.p: Requesting that he make payments to Mr. McAlister and Mr. Pemberton. Shipment of a polygraph to [Rubens?] Peale. Advice on notetaking, with Sallust and Tacitus as models. Counsels reserve on political subjects. [1041]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Walker's directions for bolting cloth. Garden work. Capt. Davis' money for livestock from Hancocke Allen's sale. Nail rod. [2770]

did.unittitle: OLIVER EVANS, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. On verso of ALS, 1808 December 6, T. J. to OLIVER EVANS. Owned by George Green Shackelford. #5661.

scopecontent.p: Thanks T. J. for payment sent to his agent, John Moody, for use in T. J.'s mill of machinery patented by Evans. Mentions Congressional act concerning his patents. His belief that the Mississippi River can be navigated with boats propelled by steam. [2771]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CATHARINE CHURCH CRUGER.

scopecontent.p: T. J. regrets not being able to assist in giving the license solicited by [J. C.] Cruger. Comments on Martha Jefferson Randolph and her large family.

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Corn purchases, involving Higginbotham and Pace. Garden work. Returning from Washington, found steer left by Mr. Freeman with Mr. Willis near Orange Court House. Nail rod. [2772]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to RICHARD FITZHUGH, Ravensworth.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #3763.

scopecontent.p: Introduces Alexander Wilson, to discuss birds with Mr. Coffer. [2773]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: ALS. Draft copy. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Smallpox vaccine from Dr. Wistar for Edgehill. Funds with Mr. Peale. Homespun from Philadelphia. Mentions Mr. Ronaldson, clothes merchant. [2774]

did.unittitle: CORNELIA RANDOLPH, Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Is reading Dramatic Dialogues, a gift from Mrs. Smith to Ellen. [1019] and [1042]

did.unittitle: CHARLES L. BANKHEAD, Port Royal, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Will keep a watchful eye on T. J. Randolph. Evil of polemical debate. References to Anne Cary Randolph Bankhead and John Bankhead. [1043]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Davy leaves today. Nathaniel Hooe's runaway slave, Gabril, working for Bacon. Hooe agrees to Bacon's hiring Gabril for the coming year. Garden work. [2775]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Museum, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Insurrection in Amherst. Payments to Mr. McAlister and Mr. Purke. References to Mr. Pemberton, [Rubens?] Peale. [1044]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. Fragment. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Davy left before aspens ready. Killed slaves' dogs. Debates planting flax and cotton. Mr. Watkins comes. Phill Hubbard and Bedford Davy to do sawing. Mentions Mr. Chisolm, garden work, and Sheppard. [2776]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Request that T. J. inform [Andrew] Benade of money in Philadelphia bank;. Hopes to have Henderson suit dismissed in Court of Appeals. [1045]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests for money received by Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. Innoculation of Jefferson, Virginia, and Anne Randolph. Reference to Mr. Hackley. [1046]

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Determination to sell Varina to pay his debts, possibly to a Mr. Patterson. Prefers to sell property rather than slaves. Reference to Wilson C. Nicholas. [1047]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to ANDREW BENADE, Bethlehem, Pennsylvania.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Moravian College for Women Library, Bethlehem. #3111.

scopecontent.p: Draft to Craven Peyton. [2776-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Order on Gibson & Jefferson. Remittance to [Andrew] Benade. Wishes to sell part of Henderson's land between Colle and Milton, Va., to pay his debts. [1048]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Money from George Jefferson in Richmond. Money due Johnson Rowe, Richard Johnson, Anderson Rowe, Charles Houchens, and John Pace. Washington lamb flock. Purchases from Mr. Higginbotham at Milton. Garden work. Mr. Watkins arrived. Stone masons working. Davy brought no raspberries. Mrs. Dangerfield's slaves. Runaway slave. T. J. note mentions Nicholas Giannini. [2777]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to WILLIAM EUSTIS, Boston.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. #38-414-a. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. Printed: Ford IX 235-236; L & B XII 222-229; TJR IV 120-121; B of R VI 144 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of Resolutions of the Republican Citizens of Boston. Will of the majority must prevail. [1049]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Monteagle, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Sale of the Bennett Henderson estate lands owned by T. J. Better sale to people north of the Susquehanna. [1050]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Garden work. Nail making. Mr. Watkins took Sheppard, navy, and Bartlet. Moses, Joe, Jim Hubbard, Lewis, John, Wormly, and Wagner Davy working. [2778]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to CRAVEN PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Instructions for selling portion of Henderson property. [Andrew] Benade acknowledged receipt of money. [1051]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Museum, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Permission granted to study in the Philosophical Society. Trip to Washington. References to Caspar Wistar and [Rubens?] Peale. [1052]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to EDMUND BACON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: No Milton mail. Wants wool sample from Merino sheep. [2779]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to CHARLES WORTHINGTON.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Victor B. Levit. #8265-b.

scopecontent.p: Draft on Office of Discount and Deposit, Washington. [2779-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JOHN COX.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Draft on Office of Discount and Deposit, Washington. [2779-b]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to SAMUEL HARRISON SMITH.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Draft on Office of Discount and Deposit, Washington. [2779-c]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ACCOUNT WITH PETER MILLER.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. In unidentified hand. #6004.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s bread buying. [2780]

did.unittitle: JOHN FELLOWS, New York, to THOMAS JEFFERSON
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #8933.

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Wool sample enclosed. Corn buying. [2781]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Edgehill, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Application for Mr. Moultree, son of Dr. James Moultree. Introducing Beverley Randolph, Martha's nephew. Innoculation of Benjamin and James. Geraniums, arbor vitae, and sweet-scented grass. Books for Mary Randolph. Hammocks sent by William Brown from Campeachy (i.e. Campeche) to Mrs. [Elizabeth] Trist. Mentions David R. Williams. [1053]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to EDMUND BACON.

scopecontent.p: Bacon's trip to Washington delayed until arrival of Milton post. Wagon to carry corn and oats for horses, and bacon. Fodder, only, to be purchased on road. 8 horses and mules expected. 8 horses and 8 people returning to Monticello. [2781-a]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, [Monti]cello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. Fragment. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: [Break in text]. Ditch digging and fence building. [2782]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Muzeum Narodowe w Krakowie, Poland. #9013.

scopecontent.p: Secretary, Mr. Coles, carries public dispatches. Losses of exports caused by embargo. U.S. may enter war if enemies' edicts not repealed before Congress meets. Kosciuszko's financial affairs. John Barnes disabled. Retirement from Presidency imminent. [2782-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to SAMUEL LATHAM MITCHELL.

scopecontent.p: Letter from Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., care of Mr. Barker. [2783]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington, to JAMES WALLACE, Fauquier Court House.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library. #2318.

scopecontent.p: Request for wild geese, summer duck, balsam, cassia tree, sunbriar, and mammoth apple tree. [1054]

did.unittitle: REPUBLICANS OF CONNECTICUT. RESOLUTIONS.
did.physdesc: D. 5 pp. Attested copy. #38-414-a.

scopecontent.p: Approval of the Embargo and measures to avert war. Disapproval of conduct of Federalists and of action of members of Connecticut legislature in declaring acts of Congress unconstitutional; present convention represents individual opinion, not official action. Mentions George Washington. Signed by Jabez Fitch, Chairman. Attested copy by Jonathan Low, Secretary. [1055]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Washington.
did.physdesc: ADS. 2 pp. and ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Bills and accounts submitted by Barnes as financial and purchasing agent for T. J. [1069]

did.unittitle: EMBARGO PENALTY DOCUMENT.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-576. Printed: Randall III 319.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RANDOLPH JEFFERSON.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ALBEMARLE COUNTY. PLAT OF LEGO.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. 11 l/2" x 9". Photostat. Original owned by Miss Olivia Taylor. #5214.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON LIST OF FARM ACREAGES AND SLAVES BORN 1743-1809.

BURGESS GRIFFIN'S LIST OF BLANKETS AND BEDS AT POPLAR FOREST.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to SAMUEL KERCHEVAL.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN GARLAND JEFFERSON.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payment of General Kosciuszko, mentioning Baring Brothers, Bowie & Kurtz, and Hoffingan & Co. [1077]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Muzeum Narodowe w Krakowie, Poland. #9013. Printed: L and B XII, 365-70, extract.

scopecontent.p: Explains reticence in writing candidly while in Presidency. War in Europe. Chesapeake affair. U.S. preparations for defense: military stores, sulphur, arms, artillery, founderies, military school, soldiers, seaport defenses at New York and New Orleans, gunboats. Recommendations to Congress for settlement of territory of Orleans by land grants not carried out, nor classing of militia by age. Privateers and pirates. Admiration of Madison. Retirement to Monticello, family, books. Schedule of day spent in correspondence, shops, garden, on horseback at farms, society of friends, and reading. Health. Discusses ploughs, harrows, seeding, harvesting, and politics with his neighbors. Education of young men living at Charlottesville. Personal finances and debt. John Barnes, Kosciuszko's stock, and T. J.'s financial indebtedness to Kosciuszko. [2793-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Pros and cons of T. J. R.'s proposal to study half of each day in his own room. References to Mr. Girardin and to Mr. Wood. [1078]

did.unittitle: GEORGE JEFFERSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: Draft received from Charles Johnston. No news of Shoemaker's flour. [1079]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [ROBERT] FULTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-239-a. Photostat. Location of original unknown.

scopecontent.p: T. J. thanks Fulton for his pamphlets on the torpedo. T. J. states that "your torpedoes will be to cities what vaccination has been to mankind."

did.unittitle: GEORGE JEFFERSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Endorsed by T. J. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney. #1633.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM W. WOODWARD.

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD THWEATT, Petersburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: Business with Mr. Ladd delayed by rheumatism. [1083]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Purchase of oil. Plans for summer vacation. Confined to bed by cut of Achilles tendon. [1084]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD THWEATT, Petersburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Stony Point, Virginia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RANDOLPH JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 18.

scopecontent.p: Invitation to visit Monticello before T. J. leaves for Poplar Forest. [1087]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 1-2.

did.unittitle: JOHN STEELE, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Seeds care of Collector of Richmond. [2794]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Edgewood, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 2-5.

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD THWEATT, Petersburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Ladd's report regarding debt due the Wayles estate from the Fleming estate. Requests hiring of an associate in Richmond, George Hay or Mr. Williams. Mentions Edmund Randolph. [1090]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, VOUCHER TO CASHIER OF BANK OF PENNSYLVANIA.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Owned by George Creen Shackelford. #3525-p.

did.unittitle: MARTHA C. LEWIS, LUCY B. LEWIS, ANN M. LEWIS, and CHARLES L. LEWIS, Livingston County, Kentucky, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Owned by the Misses Margaret and Olivia Taylor. #8937.

scopecontent.p: Death of Mrs. Charles L. Lewis. Move to Kentucky and conditions there. Loss of slaves. Poor financial condition. Indebtedness to Mr. Peyton Asks T. J.'s intervention also, Uncle Randolph, Mr. Randolph, P. Carr, and D. Carr. Mentions Aunt Carr, Mrs. Randolph, and Polly Carr. Description of Ohio River, shovel fish, buffalo fish, carp, and other fish. [2795-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN B. COLVIN.
did.physdesc: L. 4 pp. 19th century copy. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Ford IX 279-282; L & B XII 418-422; T. J. R. IV 149-152; B of R VI 92.

scopecontent.p: Observance of written law must at times give way to laws of necessity. Examples from Washington's actions at Yorktown and happenings in his own administration. References to Aaron Burr, purchase of Florida, John Randolph, Chesapeake Affair, and James Wilkinson. [1091]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CAESAR A. RODNEY, Wilmington, Del.

scopecontent.p: Information as to whether Edward Livingston could maintain an action in Richmond for a trespass committed in New Orleans (Batture controversy). Consultation with James Madison, Robert Smith, and Albert Gallatin on this matter. Recommends Levi Lincoln to replace the deceased William Cushing on the Supreme Court. References to George Hay, William Wirt, and L. W. Tazewell. [1092]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES DINSMORE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #14242. Printed: Looney, III, 19-20.

scopecontent.p: T. J. requests sash planes and templates so Johnny Hemings can proceed with sash doors for Poplar Forest. Send by stage to the care of [David] Higginbotham.

did.unittitle: GEORGE JEFFERSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat. #1633. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney.

scopecontent.p: Shipment of window glass by [John] Craven. Mentions Mr. Shoemaker. [1093]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PETER MINOR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 9 pp. #4899. Printed: Betts, Farm Book, 376-78, extract.

J.'s dam does not interfere with rights of others. Rappahannock River and Appomattox Mills disputes. Mentions Henry Williams, Milton, and Secretary's Ford. [2796]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Cocke Papers, #3184.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of two ewes for himself and six for Col. [William?] Fontaine. [1094]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mill Brook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CHARLES HOLT, New York.

scopecontent.p: Refuses subscription to The Columbian, preferring local newspapers, Tacitus, and Horace. Presents tribute to the Bee, Holt's former paper. [1096]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DAVID GELSTON.

scopecontent.p: T. J. asks Gelston, collector of the Port of New York, to forward a plough purchased by John Armstrong in France to Richmond in care of Gibson & Jefferson who will pay freight.

did.unittitle: THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., and MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH. DEED to JOHN WATSON, Albemarle County.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON INDENTURE WITH GEORGE DIVERS AND DIRECTORS OF RIVANNA COMPANY. AD.
did.physdesc: File draft. 2 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Right of way over T. J.'s canal and river holdings from Secretary's Ford to Sandv Falls at Shadwell. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [2798]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s order on Jonathan Smith, cashier of the Bank of Pennsylvania, for payment to Kosciuszko. [1099]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Returning a pamphlet that was in the hands of [Henry] Clay. Predicts failure of the bill for renewal of charter of the Bank of the United States. [1100]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DESTUTT DE TRACY.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON TRIGONOMETRY PROBLEMS.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Demonstration of instrument error at noon. Possibly an attempt by T. J. to determine the latitude of Poplar Forest. [2799]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PETER MINOR.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Typescript copy. Original owned by Miss Belle Bidgood. #38-744.

scopecontent.p: Offers aid to Rivanna Navigation Company, since his mill dam is an obstruction in the river. [1102]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ROBERT PATTERSON.

scopecontent.p: Nautical Almanac. Mentions John Garnett's edition and English edition. [2799-b]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to GEORGE JEFFERSON, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #1633. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney.

scopecontent.p: Congratulations on his being named to the Lisbon consulship. Instructions regarding the proprieties of accepting his commission. Order for turpentine to fight scab in his sheep flock. [1103]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to GEORGE JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #1633. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney. Another MS. in Vhi.

scopecontent.p: Reasons why Patrick Gibson (an Englishman by birth) cannot be appointed consul at Lisbon instead of George Jefferson. [1104]

did.unittitle: SAMUEL CARR, Dunlora, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Purchase of horse from Mr. Clarkson. Thanks for beans. [1105]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ORCHARD RECORD.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

did.unittitle: POPLAR FOREST PAPERS.
did.physdesc: 66 items. Many in Jefferson's hand or having his notes. McGregor Library. #564.

scopecontent.p: Deeds, surveys, plats, field notes, memoranda. In 1811 a boundary dispute which arose with Samuel Scott, one of the abutting property owners (who was believed to have encroached on land Jefferson had sold to Samuel J. Harrison of Lynchburg) involved searching of all early patents and surveys in the neighborhood, some dating from 1762. In 1811 also, Jefferson was engaged in road building and other extensive improvement on his Poplar Forest tract. Some of the documents are mathematical calculations and field notes, others are elaborately certified surveys. did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RECOLLECTIONS OF PATRICK HENRY.
did.physdesc: AMS. 6 pp. McGregor Library, #5622. Printed: Ford IX, 339-45. Originally calendared as 1805 August 4.

scopecontent.p: Met Henry at Nathaniel West Dandridge's home in Hanover while traveling to William and Mary College. Henry's legal training inadequate. Peyton Randolph, John Randolph, and Robert C. Nicholas reluctantly signed license; George Wythe would not sign. Henry, Burgess for Hanover, stopped John Robinson's loan office scheme. Henry's support for George Johnston's resolution against English Parliament's stamp tax crushed power of Peyton Randolph, Richard Bland, Edmund Pendleton, Robert C. Nicholas, George Wythe, Peter Randolph, etc. T. J. Burgess for Albemarle when Lord Botetourt Governor of Virginia. Henry and T. J. agreed on principles while serving in House of Delegates. Henry and Richard Henry Lee poor performers at first Continental Congress. Edmund Pendleton and Benjamin Harrison reported that William Livingston, Governor of New Jersey, John Jay. and John Dickinson surpassed Henry and Lee. Address to King and people of Great Britain. When Lord Dunmore called Peyton Randolph to Virginia Assembly concerning Lord North's proposals, T. J. replaced Randolph in Continental Congress. Mentions George Washington and Declaration of Independence. Henry appointed Colonel of Virginia Convention's 1st regiment. Lived at Roundabout in Louisa. Hunted deer in Fluvanna. Bought land of Mr. Lomax on Smith River. Yazoo speculations brought condemnation from Virginia Legislature. Case of Jones and Walker. British debts. Henry opposed U.S. Constitution and hated George Washington. Hamilton's funding system. Henry declined mission to Spain, hoped to be Secretary of State. Deserted Republicanism for Federalism. [2711]

Survey. 100 acres of land, Campbell County, Ivy Creek, bounded by Wilkinson, Johnson, [Richard] Tullos. Plat. Richard Stith, Surveyor. Wm. Peter Martin, C. C. d. 5, 19 December 1795. Grant issued 1797, attested 1812. e. 15 November 1796. Letter from Samuel Scott, Campbell County, offering to buy land on Ivy Creek. Suggests 2 or 3 men as judges. Refers to Bowling Clarke, Jefferson's overseer. f. 26 December 1803. Survey for Edmund Tate of 54 3/4 acres in Campbell County on Ivy Creek. Mentions Wilkerson, Johnson (now Couch), Tullos. Assigned to Samuel Scott. Wm. P. Martin, Surveyor. g. 15 November 1809. Survey of T. J.'s land in Campbell County by William P. Martin, Surveyor. Mentions Wilkerson, Couch, Tullos, Samuel Scott. did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Payment of taxes in Bedford County through draft on Gibson & Jefferson, Richmond. Prospects of paying his account. [1203]

did.unittitle: JOHN SPEYER, Stockholm, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Moyer-Jefferson Papers, #9828.

scopecontent.p: Forwards a letter from Madame de Staël [not present].

did.unittitle: ABNER CALLAWAY to THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requesting a loan of 200 bricks, to be returned with those lent to Colonel Watts. [1204]

did.unittitle: GIBSON & JEFFERSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s bond to T. Gwathmey due for payment. Wheat and flour prices. [2827]

did.unittitle: BURGESS GRIFFIN to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Carter B. Page holds T. J.'s bond in Richmond. [1205]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Recommending that T. J. lease Hour mill to John Eliason since Mr. Shoemaker has broken his lease. No news of John Morton or General Kosciuszko. [1206]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON DEED to BENJAMIN JOHNSON, Bedford County.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Exchange of lands in Bedford and Campbell Counties for mutual benefit. Mentioned: John Gill, David Johnson, John H. Moreman, Samuel Poindexter, Daniel Robertson, and John Wayles. Witnessed by Lemuel Johnson, Jeremiah A. Goodman, Nirwood Daniel, Stephen Butler, and Lilbourn Johnson. [1207]

did.unittitle: LIST OF MILITIA SUBSCRIPTIONS.
did.physdesc: D. 2 pp. Photostat. Maury Papers, #61.

scopecontent.p: Subscribers beside T. J. for raising an Albemarle Company included: Charles Bankhead, R. M. Bell, J. Bishop, Chiles M. Brand, Peter Carr, G. Carr, John Craven, Charles Day, Dixon Dedham, James Dinsmore, George Divers, Charles Everette, James Garnett, Alexander Garrett, Elijah Garth, John M. Guy, John Kelly, William Kelly, Samuel Leitch, Reuben Mansfield, Wilson Medearis, Thomas J. Randolph, William Watson, John Wayman, John Winn. [1208]

did.unittitle: W. & R. MITCHELL. GRISTMILL ACCOUNT.
did.physdesc: 2 items, 1 T. J. AD. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Account rendered to T. J. for wheat and flour. Terms for grinding wheat. [1209]

did.unittitle: POPLAR FOREST ACCOUNT.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Account of tobacco sold to Samuel J. Harrison in 1812. [1210]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, PLANS FOR GARDENS AT MONTICELLO.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s descriptions of plans for designing, building and planting vegetable gardens at Monticello.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON et al. to [JAMES] LEITCH, Charlottesville.
did.physdesc: ALS. 5 items. #38-755.

scopecontent.p: Orders to Leitch for a cross-cut saw, olive oil, hand irons, rice, and 4 yds. of diaper; three from T. J., one from T. J. Randolph, and one from Martha Randolph. [1211]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Charlottesville, LETTERCOVER to NICHOLAS PHILIP TRIST, Donaldsonville, Louisiana.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5385-n.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 5-6.

scopecontent.p: Asks protection from a petition presented to the legislature by the Rivanna Company for an enlargement of their powers. Threatens T. J.'s mill. [1212]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: John Eliason requests interview regarding leasing of T. J.'s mills. References to General Kosciuszko, John Morton, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [1213]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JEREMIAH GOODMAN, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5555-a.

scopecontent.p: Dick arrived via Lynchburg. Mr. Gibson and wheat. Tobacco at Lynchburg to Mr. Harrison. Mr. Perry too slow. Goodman's debts. Mentions Mr. Darnell. Richmond. [2830]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES RONALDSON, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Miss Sarah Mortimer. #5506. Printed: L and B XIII,204-6; Betts, Garden Book, 505, extract.

scopecontent.p: Cork tree from Paris. Olives from Aix, sainfoin from Malta, and acorns from Marseilles African rice in Georgia and Kentucky. Household manufactures. Marine hospitals, seamen, Mr. Gallatin. Grain trade with enemies. War in Iberia Peninsula and the Baltic. [2831]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 6.

scopecontent.p: Defense of T. J.'s rights against the petition of the Rivanna Company. References to [Philip P.?] Barbour and [Chapman] Johnson. [1214]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES RONALDSON.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Fragment. 19th century copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: L & B XIII 204-206; Ford IX 370-373; B of R VI 397 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Difficulties in attempting to introduce new plants and trees: the cork tree, the olive tree of Aix, sainfoin, and upland rice. Development of cotton and cotton weaving. Household manufacture. [1215]

did.unittitle: JAMES LIGON for GIBSON & JEFFERSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Funds to credit of James Hamilton of Williamsboro, North Carolina, in Bank of Virginia. Mentions Mr. Gibson. [2832]

did.unittitle: DAVID HIGGINBOTHAM BOND TO WILLIAM SHORT. In hand of THOMAS JEFFERSON.

scopecontent.p: Higginbotham, of Albemarle County, to pay Short, of Philadelphia, in U.S. dollars, through Bank of Richmond. Short assigns to Joseph and George [Marx?]. Witnessed by Carter H. Harrison. [2833]

did.unittitle: DAVID HIGGINBOTHAM BOND TO WILLIAM SHORT. In hand of THOMAS JEFFERSON.

scopecontent.p: Text as 2833; not assigned. Marked paid. [2834]

did.unittitle: DAVID HIGGINBOTHAM BOND TO WILLIAM SHORT. In hand of THOMAS JEFFERSON.

scopecontent.p: Text as 2833; not assigned. Signature of David Higginbotham crossed out by Short, who notes on verso, 1816 May 4, that the obligation was satisfied with land found outside the Indian Camp estate limits. [2835]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mr. T Taylor, presumably for Mr. Gallego, offers to buy land from T. J. Edmund Randolph at Winchester. Mr. Randolph's boat to bring powder. [2836]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 7-8.

scopecontent.p: Services by Cabell, [P. P.?] Barbour, and [Chapman] Johnson in the Virginia legislature in defense of T. J.'s rights against the bill petitioned by the Rivanna Company. Action in the Senate and House of Delegates. Use of T. J.'s canal by the company and exemption of T. J.'s and his customer's produce from tools were involved. [1216]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Woodlawn, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 24.

scopecontent.p: Sends Squire for garden seeds. Invitation to visit. Delayed at Woodlawn by Mrs. [David] Pryor's illness. [1217]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DABNEY CARR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Requests that he bring a letter to attention of Edmund Randolph. Offer for his tenement excellent. [1218]

did.unittitle: DAVID HIGGINBOTHAM BOND TO WILLIAM SHORT. In hand of THOMAS JEFFERSON.

scopecontent.p: Rent on the Indian Camp lands. [2837]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RANDOLPH JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 25.

scopecontent.p: Send seeds for vegetable and flower garden. Will call on Randolph on way to Bedford if road passable. [1219]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-163.

scopecontent.p: Sends seed of broom and sprout kale plants. [1220]

did.unittitle: DABNEY CARR, Winchester, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Letter for Edmund Randolph forwarded through Dr. Grayson. Randolph lives with son-in-law, Bennett Taylor. [1221]

did.unittitle: WILL OF ANNE SCOTT JEFFERSON MARKS. In hand of THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Debts of Hastings Marks. Bequests to children of Martha Jefferson Randolph. Thomas Jefferson Randolph, executor. Witnessed by William McLung, Hugh Chisholm, and E. Bacon. [2838]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS EPPES, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Scolding his grandfather for failing to write. [1222]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH HORNSBY, [Kentucky].
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Requests his aid in getting his title to Henderson land confirmed by Mrs. Thomas Hornsby, last of minor heirs of Bennett Henderson. William D. Meriwether has influenced Hornsby in this. Mentions Craven Peyton, William Pope Duval, and Gov. Christopher Greenup. [1223]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RODOLPHUS DICKINSON, Greenfield, Mass.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #1043. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Thanking him for a copy of his book, View of Massachusetts Proper. [1224]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: William Marshall, hired by Mr. Taylor to handle Mazzei's affairs. T. J. and Mr. Randolph must sign bill. Flour prices. [2839]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Letter of introduction for John Eliason, who is interested in managing T. J.'s mill. [1225]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Encloses letter from George Williams of Baltimore with news of General Kosciuszko. [1226]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Unable to make payment because he was caught by the blockade before the sale of his flour. Sale ordered through Patrick Gibson of Richmond. Export from Norfolk possible. [1227]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s arrangements for repayment of debt satisfactory. Attempts to run flour through Dismal Swamp may raise prices; large quantity in Richmond keeps price low. [1228]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Bill of sale, drawn by William Marshall for Mr. Taylor, transferring Mazzei's lands, invalid, unless Mazzei U.S. citizen. Flour sale. [2840]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to CHARLES CLAY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Photostat of printed extract from unidentified newspaper. Deposit of Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5385-a.

scopecontent.p: Spinning machine. [2841]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Negotiations on the exchange of T. J.'s land in Bedford for J. W. Eppes' Pantops near Monticello. If exchange be made, Eppes wishes land in Bedford in feesimple without reversionary claims. Resentment at T. J.'s favoring the Randolphs. Francis Eppes in school at Lynchburg, boarding with Seth Ward. President's majority in Congress. Failure of General Dearborn. Fever among the troops. Surrender of York (Toronto). [1229]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RANDOLPH JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 26-27.

scopecontent.p: Request for carp to stock his fish pond. Gift of a spinning-jenny. Plans for a visit at Snowden on way to Bedford County. Course of reading for James Lilburne Jefferson, Randolph's son. Suggestions for farming operations and crop rotation. [1230]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 28.

scopecontent.p: Carp for T. J.'s fish pond. James Lilburne Jefferson to begin course of reading. Grateful for spinning jenny. Invitation to Anna Scott Marks to visit. T. J.'s farming methods too difficult. [1231]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mazzei's power of attorney acceptable to Mr. Taylor. Flour prices. Burr has powder; other powder from T. White. [2842]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN ELIASON, Georgetown.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Owned by the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #6449. Printed: Betts, Farm Book, 393, extract.

scopecontent.p: [Thomas Eston] Randolph to keep mill. Terms of tenancy. [2843]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s account with Barnes. Remittances received from Gibson & Jefferson and sent to General Kosciuszko. Recommending John Eliason. References to George Williams, John Morton, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [1232]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Recommending T. J. charge General Kosciuszko one year's interest for services rendered in regard to public stock. Includes an account, 1809 to 1813. [1233]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Suggests a remittance might be made to General Kosciuszko through George Williams of Baltimore and Russell & Morton of Bordeaux without resorting to a bill of exchange. Present rate of exchange. Defeat of Bonaparte in Russia. Lawless division of Poland by Austria, Prussia, and Russia. [1234]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 30.

scopecontent.p: Wife grateful for gardening book; her illness. No woman available to learn to spin. Expects Anna Scott Marks for visit. James Lilburne Jefferson has joined the volunteers. No carp available. Will send for ram in cooler weather. [1236]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 7 pp. #38-576. Printed: Ford IX 388-395; L & B XIII 269-279; TJR IV 196-201.

scopecontent.p: Importance of the rule that taxation and loans go hand-in-hand, so as not to alienate the land from the next generation. Money should be issued by the government, not by private banks. Reference to Francis Eppes. [1237]

did.unittitle: FRANK CARR, Charlottesville, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Encloses sample of antimony found in neighborhood. (The antimony was sent to Correa de Serra). [1238]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Method of remittance to General Kosciuszko: K. to draw a bill of exchange on Barnes. [1239]

did.unittitle: DABNEY CARR, Winchester, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Encloses deed from Edmund Randolph, whose health is low. (He died 13 September 1813). [1240]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 31.

scopecontent.p: Sends girl to learn to use spinning jenny. Expects visit. [1241]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to BENJAMIN ROMAYNE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #726. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Expressing his thanks for a Republican oration sent to him by Dr. Romayne. [1242]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 32.

scopecontent.p: Progress of girl learning to spin. Plans for trip to Bedford, Snowden. Will send jenny. [1243]

did.unittitle: THOMAS HORNSBY, Shelbyville, Ky., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Charlottesville.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Sale of property of minor Henderson children to Craven Peyton was done without their knowledge or permission. Justifies his action regarding his wife, Frances Henderson Hornsby's share. Mentions Elizabeth Henderson, Charles Henderson, James L. Henderson, Joseph Hornsby, Christopher Greenup, and William Meriwether. [1244]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Paid Mr. Hooe and Judge Holmes. Chocolate by mail. David Higginbotham paid. Forwards statement of sale to Mr. Taylor. Mr. Derieux, at Eagle Tavern, claims Mazzei's property. [2844]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH

scopecontent.p: T. J. orders 25 pounds of brown sugar.

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Judah's note discounted. No money from O. Philpotts for tobacco, although William Hay, Jr., sues. [2845]

did.unittitle: CHARLES L. LEWIS, Salem, Livingston County, Kentucky, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Owned by the Misses Margaret and Olivia Taylor. #8937.

scopecontent.p: Asks financial help to be sent by Mr. Woods. [2845-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to DAVID HIGGINBOTHAM.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Gamble wants to know about common on land in Richmond. Papers of James Buchanan and Col. Byrd, and Carter's deed. [2846]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 33.

scopecontent.p: Requests loan of $40. Inquires about slave Fanny's progress in learning to spin. [1245]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 34.

scopecontent.p: Borrowed money for Randolph Jefferson. Poor year for corn, wheat, and livestock. Progress of Randolph's slave in spinning. Advises that he wait to sell his wheat until winter drives off blockading ships. [1246]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Deed to Mr. Taylor when he returns from Springs. [2847]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to SAMUEL H. SMITH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Owned by George Green Shackelford. #5661-a.

scopecontent.p: Recommends Joseph Dougherty for position with Smith. National Intelligencer subscription mentioning Mr. Gale. Regrets that Mrs. Smith had to leave country for city life. [2848]

did.unittitle: PETER MINOR, Ridgeway, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: Thanking Jefferson for his aid in getting Minor the position of principal assessor. [1247]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Sends draft on Gibson & Jefferson. Last year's flour sold at low price due to blockade. Poor crops this year. Order for sugar, tea, molasses, and a clamp for a dry rubbing brush. [1248]

did.unittitle: BROWN & ROBERTSON, Lynchburg, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of draft on Gibson & Jefferson. Sending all articles except molasses. [1249]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM CANBY to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. Owned by Isaac Jeanes. Recipient's copy in MHi. #4598-b.

scopecontent.p: Religious questions. [2848-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to CHARLES JOHNSTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Apologizing for his inability to pay his bond. References to [Burgess] Griffin. [1267]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 35.

scopecontent.p: Sends spinning jenny. Plans for visit with Randolph. Mentions Henry Flood, Noah Flood, and the Gibsons. [1250]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 8 pp. #38-576. Printed: L & B XIII 353-368; Ford IX 395-403 n; B of R VI 143 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Opinions on government finance, taxes, and debts. Must defray the expenses of the war in our own time. Bank paper must be suppressed and the circulating medium restored to the nation. Detailed consideration of the rate of interest on government loans. Reference to Francis Eppes. [1251]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 4 pp. Extract by Joseph C. Cabell. Cabell Papers, #38-111. Bears: 1813 November 6 T. J. to John Wayles Eppes and 1813 June 24, T. J. to John Wayles Eppes.

scopecontent.p: Importance of loans and taxes going hand-in-hand. Paper money should be issued by government and backed by taxes, not by banks. [1299]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to WILLIAM CANBY.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. 19th century copy. Owned by Isaac Jeanes. #4598-b. Printed: L and B XIII, 376-78. Polygraph copy in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Religious questions. Mentions Jesus, Richard Mott, Papists, Quakers, Presbyterians, Methodists, Baptists, Aristides, Cato, William Penn, John Tillotson, Euclid, geometry, and St. Athanasius. [2848-b]

did.unittitle: CHARLES L. BANKHEAD to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requests hamper of charcoal to dry his malt. [1252]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES MARTIN.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. #38-414-a. Printed: Ford IX 419-421; L & B XIII 381-384; B of R VI 316 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Preference for shorter term for senators. Conduct of Federalists in Massachusetts in this crisis. Her secession would be followed by humiliating return to the union. [1253]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH SLAUGHTER MAP OF TOMAHAWK CREEK LANDS.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. 22" x 12 1/2". Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON BLANK CONTRACT.
