scopecontent.p: Lease for people of Milton to cut firewood between Milton and Colle. [2852]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. File draft. 2 pp. McGregor Library, #4019.

scopecontent.p: Drafts from Bedford to Brown and Robertson, sheriff of Bedford, Nimrod Darnell, and Jeremiah A. Goodman. Payments to Craven Peyton, David Higginbotham, William Garth (deputy sheriff of Albemarle) and Gales and Seaton (editors of National Intelligencer), Washington. Flour prices. Drought. Wheat, corn, tobacco. British blockade of Chesapeake Bay impossible to maintain in winter. [2850]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Remittances to General Kosciuszko. Purchase of exchange from George Williams. Payment of order to J. Smith. [1254]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Attends to drafts. Encloses notes care of Mr. Higginbotham as mails undependable. Flour prices. Mr. H. paid for repairing T. J.'s watch. [2851]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Difficulties in purchasing a bill of exchange from George Williams on Russell & Morton. [1255]

did.unittitle: GEORGE WILLIAMS to JOHN BARNES RE ACCOUNT OF TADUESZ KOSCIUSZKO.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Originally enclosed with Barnes' letter to T. J. of 1813 November 10? [1070]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 20 pp. File draft[?]. #38-576. Partly printed: L & B XIII 404-432; TJR IV 211-227; Ford IX 403-417 n; B of R VI 143 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Opposition to re-establishment of the Bank of the U. S. Relative advantages of paper money and specie as media of exchange. General government should have sole right of establishing banks of discount for paper. Question of the public debt. References to Adam Smith and David Hume. (A cancelled paragraph dealing with the establishment of the Bank of the United States follows the first paragraph of this draft. It appears in none of the printed editions listed above.) [1256]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Williamsburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: AD. 1 pp. #201. Partly printed: Cabell 8-9; B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Bill to extend powers of the Rivanna Co. Requests return of Say's Traité d'economie politique. References to Col. [Nimrod] Bramham, [George] Divers, and Dabney Minor. [1257]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Purchase of bill of exchange from George Williams; acknowledgement by General Kosciuszko of money received from Russell & Morton. [1258]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS HORNSBY, Shelbyville, Ky.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Requests that he meet with Gov. Christopher Greenup to adjust the differences regarding confirmation of Frances Henderson Hornsby's deed for her share of the Bennett Henderson estate, a deed made while she was a minor. References to James L. Henderson, Eliza Henderson, Elizabeth Henderson, John Henderson, and Craven Peyton. [1259]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Sends money. Flour prices. [2853]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Williamsburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 10-12.

scopecontent.p: Bill concerning T. J. and the Rivanna River Co. will pass the Virginia Assembly. Disagrees with T. J. on the length of the charter. Prefers Jean Baptiste Say's book on political economy to Adam Smith's. [1260]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Monticello], to BARON ALEXANDER VON HUMBOLDT.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Photostat. #38-257. Original in DLC. Printed: Ford IX 430-433; L & B XIV 20-25; B of R VI 224 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Acquaintance with José Correa da Serra. Receipt of Von Humboldt's books on astronomical observations and on New Spain. Revolutions in Latin America may lead to military despotisms. Important that American governments be separated from the "broils of Europe". Unprincipled policy of England has prevented a peaceful policy with the Indians. Brutalization and extermination of Indians compared to treatment of Ireland. British Arrowsmith and American Pike guilty of plagiarism. Delay in the publication of the journal of the Lewis and Clark expedition. Gift of tobacco seed to Von Humboldt. [1261]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 12-13.

scopecontent.p: Books forwarded through General Moore. Reelection of Governor Barbour expected despite discontent throughout the state. Consultation with Charles Everett and Jesse W. Garth relative to the petition of the Rivanna River Co. [1262]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Remittance to General Kosciuszko via George Williams and Morton & Russell is not possible. Congratulations on Thomas M. Randolph, Jr.'s safe return. [1263]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s note. Flour prices. Embargo has stopped West Indies trade. [2854]

did.unittitle: ELIZABETH HENDERSON. DEPOSITION.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Deposition denying knowledge of sale of her daughter's property to Craven Peyton by James L. Henderson until several years after the transaction. [1264]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CHARLES CLAY.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #2288. Printed: B of R VI 86 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Price of Mr. Forbes' wool-carding and cotton-carding machines. [1265]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Flour sales and w heat prices. [2855]

did.unittitle: DABNEY MINOR, Albemarle County, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 10.

scopecontent.p: Agreement between T. J. and the Rivanna Company directors that bill be passed. References to [Charles] Everett and E. Garth. [1266]

did.unittitle: [W. & R. MITCHELL]. ACCOUNTS AGAINST THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: D. 2 items. One endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Accounts of the milling of the Poplar Forest wheat crop. [1268]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ACCOUNT WITH DR. WILLIAM STEPTOE.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. In hand of William Steptoe; endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Services rendered and medications prescribed. Patients include slaves Aggy, Maria, Ambrose, and Sally. Mentions Mr. Clay. [2857]

did.unittitle: JOSÉ FRANCISCO CORREA DE SERRA, PLAN FOR A BOTANICAL GARDEN FOR A PUBLIC SCHOOL.
did.physdesc: D. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat. #7254-b.

did.unittitle: THOMAS HORNSBY, Shelbyville, Ky., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Sends Elizabeth Henderson's deposition regarding the shares of the minor children of Bennett Henderson. Asks about John Henderson's mill race. Value of land mortgaged to Craven Peyton as security for property near Big Bone Lick, Ky., he purchased from James L. Henderson in Virginia. References to William Meriwether and Christopher Greenup. [1269]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON.

scopecontent.p: Regarding flour prices, and 100 barrels of flour T. J. has ready for sale.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER.
did.physdesc: L. 3 pp. Copy by Ellen Randolph. #38-130. Printed: L & B XIV 54-63 (minor variations); B of R VI 95 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Congratulates him on his edition of Justinian's Institutes, but wishes he had put his time into Bracton's De Legibus Angliae. Would like to see Blackstone's work supplemented by specification of particular cases of which his principles are the essence. Cannot give name of author of Commentaries on Montesquieu [Destutt de Tracy]; manuscript now in T. J.'s hands. [1270]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 13-16; L & B XIV 67-70; B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Encloses letters written to John Wayles Eppes regarding public debt, banks, and money. Advises gradual reduction of paper money in Virginia. Favors division of state into hundreds or wards. [1271]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Sends money. Flour prices and sales, some to Alexandria, Va. [2858]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 16-18.

scopecontent.p: Expresses limited approval of a state banking system. Voted for chartering Bank of Virginia. Restriction of the residence of a member of the House of Representatives to the district from which he was elected. Bill respecting the Rivanna River Company. Reasons for the division of state into wards. [1272]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 19-21; Ford IX 451-453; L & B XIV 82-85; TJR IV 238-239; B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Receipt of Say's Traité d'economie politique. Opinions as to whether states may prescribe any qualifications for members of Congress not contained in the Constitution. Line of demarcation between powers of the state and national governments. Maintains an interest in only two subjects: public education, and the division of counties into wards or hundreds. [1273]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to MRS. ELIZABETH TRIST, at Mr. Gilmer's, near Henry Court House.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by John R. Burke. #5422.

scopecontent.p: Ellen Wayles Randolph's translation of letter. Martha's new daughter Septimia Ann. Children have whooping cough. Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. probably leaves in spring to campaign T. J. Randolph's girl friend at Warren. Mr. Gilmer's brothers well. Dr. Gilmer left Milton for place bought from Key near Mr. Minor. [2859]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JEREMIAH GOODMAN, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #3177. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation.

scopecontent.p: Remittance through Patrick Gibson of Richmond. Instructions for sowing clover, shipment of beef and tobacco, rationing of salt. No flour sold. Orders to kill all dogs in excess of two, since they are taxable. [1274]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 21-23.

scopecontent.p: Assembly's action on residence requirements for Congressmen. Passage of the Rivanna River Company bill in form agreed upon by T. J. and [Dabney] Minor. Bill to charter bank at Wheeling. [1275]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Nail rod, corks, and powder by Mr. Johnson. Flour prices. T. J. accounts with Samuel P. Adams, James Brown, Jr., and Ignatius J. Dick. [2860]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Inability to make remittance to George Williams for General Kosciuszko. [1276]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Confidence in the credit of the Bank of Pennsylvania; opposes disposal of General Kosciuszko's bank stock. Beneficial results of banks overshadow their evils. [1277]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN BARNES, Georgetown.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat. #2224. Original owned by Wayne M. Hart.

scopecontent.p: Orders to convert Kosciuszko's stock in the Bank of Pennsylvania to government stock. Lack of confidence in banks. Failure of the Manhattan Bank. [1278]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s note falls due. New one enclosed for signature. Prospect of peace and trade with Holland influence tobacco market, but not flour prices. [2861]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Conversion of General Kosciuszko's shares in the Bank of Pennsylvania to government stock. Remittance to General K. Importance of stopping the increase of banks. Effect of the failure of the Bank of Manhattan on other banks. [1279]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Note may not be received. Will pay anyway, renew new one when received. Flour prices. Encloses money. [2862]

did.unittitle: MARTIN DAWSON & CO., Milton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s note to Craven Peyton for corn purchases. Will accept draft on Richmond or cash at Charlottesville. [2863]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Carysbrook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 24.

scopecontent.p: Return of T. J.'s letters on banking and finance which have been shown to William C. Rives, [John?] Tucker, Thomas Ritchie, and [John H.] Cocke. [1280]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Considers transfer of T. J.'s and General Kosciuszko's Bank of Pennsylvania stock into loan office certificates unwise. [1281]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: New procedure for handling T. J. s notes. Encloses notes. Flour sales. [2864]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HENRY M. BRACKENRIDGE, Baton Rouge
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. with attached address leaf. #14262.

scopecontent.p: T. J. thanks Breckenridge for a copy of his recently published book, Views of Louisiana. Says book is a "valuable contribution towards the knowlege [sic] of a great country which nature has destined to become the most interesting portion of the western world."

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Carysbrook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Cary [Wilson J. Cary? Wilson M. Cary?] not at home. [1282]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Notes received. Encloses bank notes. [2865]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Figures proving Bank of Pennsylvania stock is preferable to loan office certificates. [1283]

did.unittitle: PETER CARR to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Introducing the son of Dr. John D. Orr, a student of [Louis H.] Girardin. [1284]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: More facts to prove it is preferable to keep General Kosciuszko's Bank of Pennsylvania stock rather than converting to government stock. [1285]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Cocke Payers. Printed: B of R VI 89 (MS. in DLC). #3184.

scopecontent.p: Offers to purchase a dark bay horse. Payment to be made after repeal of embargo permits sale of flour by Gibson & Jefferson. (Payment noted by Cocke's endorsement). [1286]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Repeal of restrictions brought flour buyers. Awaiting armistice. Mr. Albert bought tobacco. Powder. [2866]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Photostat. #2283. Original owned by Polish Roman Catholic Union of America.

scopecontent.p: T. J. discusses Tadeusz Kosciuszko's investments and the monetary situation of the United States.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Payment to General Armstrong for articles he forwarded for T. J. Madison has left for Montpellier. Reference to Mr. Harper and the Cossack dinners. [1287]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to SAMUEL BROWN.

scopecontent.p: T. J. sympathizes on the death of a loved one and comments on his own losses. He mentions the invention of a vapor bath, and the rise of household industries necessitated by the War of 1812, rejoices in the downfall of Napoleon, predicts bankruptcy for England, and requests a botanical specimen for Correa de Serra.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Agrees to conversion of General Kosciuszko's shares of Bank of Pennsylvania stock into government stock. Requests letter of introduction to James Monroe or to William H. Crawford in order to get a bill of exchange for remittance to General Kosciuszko. [1288]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Purchase of government stock for General Kosciuszko. Reference to the Bank of Columbia. [1289]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Sends bank notes. Flour sales await armistice. [2867]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CRAVEN PEYTON, Monteagle.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by John Peytom #5843-c.

scopecontent.p: Encloses John Henderson's quitclaim for Peyton's use in defending against Elizabeth Henderson's claim that Peyton purchased for T. J. lands of minor Henderson children without her knowledge or permission. Mentions James Henderson, Thomas Hornsby. [2867-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to GEORGE W. CAMPBELL.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. #2283. Original owned by Polish Roman Catholic Union of America.

scopecontent.p: T. J. asks Campbell if it is possible for the Treasury to arrange for Tadeusz Kosciuszko to receive payment of annual interest due him and interrupted because of the war.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Exchange of Kosciuszko's Bank of Pennsylvania stock for loan office certificates. Letter from Mr. Taylor regarding bank stock, government stock, and bills of exchange. [1290]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sale of Kosciuszko's bank stock; purchase of government stock. [1291]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sale of Kosciuszko's Bank of Pennsylvania stock. Remittance to Kosciuszko. Barnes in debt to purchase the General's government stock. [1292]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ELIZABETH HOUSE TRIST.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. #5213-d.

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Flour prices declining. [2868]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to THOMAS LAW.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. #9561. Printed: L and B XIV,138-44.

scopecontent.p: Received and read Law's Second Thoughts on Instinctive Impulses. Agrees with his philosophy of morality in man. Wollaston's theory whimsical. Truth, love of God not foundations of morality as atheists, Deists virtuous men. Diderot, d'Alembert, d'Holbach, Condorcet examples. Taste, egoism also false. Helvetius quoted, refuted. Man's innate moral instinct true basis of morality. Education a corrective for its absence. Virtue conditioned by utility. Lord Kames, in Principles of Natural Religion, says the same. [2868-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON in account with W. & R. MITCHELL.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Bill for flour. [1293]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sale of Kosciuszko's bank stock finally completed. Remittance to the General through Baring Brothers of London. Difficult trip from Philadelphia. [1294]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Unable to meet payments since last year's flour unsold and bad drought this year. Peace orneutral commerce will help the growing crop. Plans tobacco crop. Mentions Patrick Gibson. [1295]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Purchase of bill of exchange to send remittance to General Kosciuszko. Encloses account with T. J. Mentions Mr. Nourse. [1296]

did.unittitle: ACCOUNT OF TADUESZ KOSCIUSZKO WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Originally enclosed with Barnes' letter to T. J. of the same date. [1070]

did.unittitle: JOHNS BARNES to TADUESZ KOSCIUSZKO.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Originally enclosed with Barnes' letter to T. J. of 1814 June 27. [1070]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARCHIBALD ROBINSON [ROBERTSON], Lynchburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Patrick Gibson is remitting money due to Jeremiah A. Goodman through Robertson. Order for sugar. [1297]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Hopes for payment from T. J. Will make remittance to Jeremiah Goodman. [1298]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Bowie & Kurtz' bill of exchange on William Murdock given to James Monroe to be transmitted to Baring Brothers for General Kosciuszko. Desire for peace among Federalists. [1300]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Muzeum Narodowe w Krakowie, Poland. #9013.

scopecontent.p: Embargo and blockade prevent John Barnes from sending remittances to Kosciuszko. Insecurity of U.S. banks. Investment in Pennsylvania bank stock transferred to U.S. government loan. Peace between England and France. Great events at Paris. Mentions Mr. Morton, Boice & Kurtz, William Murdock of London, Messrs. Barings Brothers & Co. of London. [2868-b]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Remittances to Kosciuszko. Difficulties encountered and expenses incurred in conversion of Kosciuszko's bank of Pennsylvania stock into government stock. Notes that Kosciuszko's capital is increased but interest reduced by this transaction. [1301]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Growth of Philadelphia. Criticism of a gentleman not named. Great Britain's jealousy of our liberty and wealth. [1302]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Nail rod. T. J.'s account. [2869]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Remittance to General Kosciuszko. Payment for his government stock. Result of the commissioners at Ghent awaited. Inability of Britain to subjugate the United States. References to James Monroe, Mr. Pleisentson (of Mr. Monroe's office), and William H. Crawford. [1303]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Visit from Mr. Taylor. Mr. S.'s house has fallen under the hammer of the auctioneer. Outcome of the war. Reference to Etienne Le Maire. [1304]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J., 38-163. Printed: B of R VI 89 (MS. in DLC). #38-163.

scopecontent.p: Unable to pay for horse by order on Gibson & Jefferson because flour not sold. Hopes for peace. [1305]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CRAVEN PEYTON, Monteagle.

scopecontent.p: Charles L. Lewis' deed. [2870-a]

did.unittitle: PETER CARR, Carr's Brook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Meeting of the committee consisting of John Winn, James Leitch, John Nicholas, [Frank] Carr, and Alexander Garrett, for viewing sites for Albemarle Academy. [1306]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM WIRT.
did.physdesc: ALS. 8 pp. McGregor Library, #5622. Printed: L and B XIV, 162-73.

scopecontent.p: Recollections of Patrick Henry. Topics: Loan Office scandal, Journals of House of Burgesses, Address to King, Memorials to Houses of Lords and Commons, Stamp Act, Royle's Virginia Gazette, Parson's Cause, Two-penny Act, Resolutions of 1765, T. J.'s revision of Virginia laws, Philips case, proposals for dictator. Names: John Robinson, James Maury, John Camm, Richard Bland, Nathaniel West Dandridge, John Littlepage, John Marshall, John Daly Burke, Peyton Randolph, Peter Randolph, George Wythe, Edmund Pendleton, Robert Carter Nicholas, Henry Lee, Richard Henry Lee, John Page, George Mason, George III of England, Edmund Randolph, Josiah Philips, Thomas L. Lee, John Taylor of Caroline, Andrew Moore, Edward Stevens. Places: Hanover, Williamsburg, Dismal Swamp, Staunton, Fredericksburg. [2871]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Requesting remittance from T. J. to cover installment due on General Kosciuszko's government bonds. Defense of Washington against the British. [1307]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS HORNSBY, Kentucky.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Requests papers regarding Elizabeth Henderson's dower rights in the Bennett Henderson estate, especially with regard to John Henderson's mill race. Needs to repel fraudulent claim of [David] Michie. Mentions James L. Henderson and Christopher Greenup. [1308]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DABNEY CARR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Depositions in the question between T. J. and [David] Michie. Flood damage suffered by Peter Carr, Samuel Carr, and Peter Minor. Danger to Washington. Hopes for peace. [1309]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Impossible to send funds North. Transactions with Mr. Dufief and Mr. Barnes. Mr. Johnson brings cotton and castings. Nail rod. Mr. Randolph to send earthenware. [2872]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Failure of Patrick Gibson to remit to Barnes in time to make payment on General Kosciuszko's government stock. Retreat of our army from Bladensburg through Washington and Georgetown. President's encouragement of troops. Barnes deserted by Mrs. Ratcliffe and the slaves. [1310]

did.unittitle: DANIEL F. CARR, Charlottesville, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Request for money. (Endorsed by T. J.: "gave ord. on Gibson & Jefferson for 50 D.") [1311]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DANIEL F. CARR, Charlottesville.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Order on Gibson & Jefferson of Richmond. [1312]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to SAMUEL CARR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Requesting that Roland Goodman be excused from military duty because of consumption. [1313]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PETER CARR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 8 pp. File draft. #38-111. Printed: L & B XIX 211-221; Cabell 384-390; Niles Register X 34-35; Joseph C. Cabell Sundry Documents on a System of Public Education 12-18; B of R VI 71 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Plans for public education throughout the state providing elementary schools for all, with general college and professional schools for scholars. Elaborate discussion of the curriculum for Albemarle Academy. [1314]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. #3509.

scopecontent.p: T. J. comments on Wayles' health and then discusses the progress of the war, concluding by saying that "our people are too happy at home to enter into regular service, and that we cannot be defended but by making every citizen a soldier as the Greeks & Romans who had no standing armies."

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 24-27.

scopecontent.p: Preparations for defense of Richmond against the British. Lack of money in treasury at Washington and Richmond. Loans from Bank of Virginia and from the Farmers' Bank to the state. Stopping of specie payment in these banks. Suggests Colonel Nicholas as next governor. [1315]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 27-30.

scopecontent.p: Congress should have sole right of emission of paper money, based on taxation. But approves state auditors issuing certificates of indebtedness which will pass as currency until Congress shall undertake these measures. [1316]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. File copy. 1 pp. #9562.

scopecontent.p: Wishes loan extension to cover taxes in Bedford. Credit of bank paper doubtful. Merchant support might help. Jugs from Mr. R. Randolph and glass from Capt. Oldham. Oil and corks from Gibson. Mentions Hour, wheat, and tobacco. Trip to Bedford. [2872-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 30-31; L & B XIV 199; B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC) .

scopecontent.p: Disapproves of depositing in the bank money from sale of glebe lands and from the Literary Fund. [1317]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Note received and enlarged. System of curtailing notes ended, but doubtless soon resumed. Bank measures necessary, merchants doing everything possible. Encloses money. Will send supplies by Johnson, pay Mr. Oldham for glass. [2873]

did.unittitle: MR. S[TACK] to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Regulations proposed for Albemarle Academy regarding tardiness, recitations, deportment, morals, and property damage. [1318]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Banking crisis due to failure of Northern and Southern banks to cooperate. Failure of the late public loan. Confidence in final victory. Good fortune in transferring General Kosciuszko's bank stock into government stock. [1319]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES MADISON.
did.physdesc: L. 3 pp. Copy. #201. Printed: Ford IX 489-492; L & B XIV 202-207; B of R VI 309 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Copy sent to Joseph C. Cabell with letter of 1814 October 16. Opinions on what should be our object in the war with Great Britain. Paper money emissions. [1320]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: L. 3 pp. Copy. #201. Printed: Cabell 31; B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC) .

scopecontent.p: Encloses copy of letter to James Madison regarding public finance. [1321]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 32.

scopecontent.p: Issuing of state certificates to bolster public credit. [1322]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE.

scopecontent.p: Endorsed by T. J. Printed: B of R VI 89 (MS. in DLC). Payment for horse. Expects long war. Reliance on militia. [1323]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to T. J., Bedford County.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Renewal of a note. Letter forwarded to T. J. through Samuel J. Harrison. [1324]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Encloses note for renewal. Forwards copy to Bedford by Samuel J. Harrison. Drafts will be paid on presentation. [2874]

did.unittitle: W & R. MITCHELL, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Enclosing an account with balance due the Mitchells. [1325]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Will pay draft on Patrick Gibson to Mr. Clayter. Requests payment of account if possible. [1326]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to CHARLES CLAY.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Photostat. Deposit of Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5385-a.

scopecontent.p: Spectacles from Mr. McAlister in Philadelphia. [2875]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS EPPES, Mill Brook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Inability to go to school. Wishes to see T. J. [1327]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588. Another MS. in MHi. Printed: Davis, Francis Walker Gilmer 78.

scopecontent.p: Letter for Dr. Caspar Wistar. Hopes Gilmer will live permanently in Virginia where he will be without rivals in public life. [1328]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DR. ROBERT PATTERSON.

scopecontent.p: T. J. resigns as Chairman of the American Philosophical Society "for in truth I cannot be easy in holding as a sinecure an honor so justly due the talents and services of others."

did.unittitle: WILLIAM MITCHELL. ESTIMATE for THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Mitchell's terms, per John McAllister, for grinding Jefferson's wheat. [1329]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Copy of letter from Baring Brothers & Co., London, acknowledging acceptance of a bill of exchange on William Murdock in favor of General Kosciuszko. Barnes hopes the national credit will be upheld. [1330]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Dr. Brockenbrough and John Harvie's note. No money from O. Philpotts. Tobacco and flour prices. [2876]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Jacquelin Harvie paid John Harvie's note. [2877]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Scrip certificates left with [Joseph] Nourse to purchase government stock. Requests power of attorney to receive dividends. [1331]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON. ALS.
did.physdesc: Draft copy [?]. 1 pp. On verso of lettercover to T. J., Monticello, via Milton. #5914.

scopecontent.p: John Harvie's payment. Tobacco and wheat. Ghent negotiations indicate Great Britain to accept peace. Judgments against O. Philpotts. Directs payment to Jeremiah Goodman at Poplar Forest near Lynchburg. [2878]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 32-35.

scopecontent.p: Tracy's work on political economy. Possible solutions of the problems of financing the state government: loan from the Farmer's Bank;; issuance of treasury notes by the state; or a private loan by citizens. Thomas Mann Randolph's petition to open the falls near Milton and charge tolls on traffic conflicts with the Rivanna River Charter. References to Charles Yancey and William Wood. [1332]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 36.

scopecontent.p: Asks that watch and dog be sent by Stephen. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [1333]

did.unittitle: JEREMIAH A. GOODMAN, Poplar Forest, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Dick leaves for Monticello with supplies, wheat for mill. Wheat prices for Mr. Mitchell. Phill Hubbard at Poplar Forest, perhaps to marry Hanna. Farm business. Mentions Mr. Darnell, Lewis Brown, Mr. Clarkson, and Mr. Cole. [2879]

did.unittitle: MR. STACK to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Proposed course of classical education for Albemarle Academy. [1334]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON LIST OF SLAVES BORN 1743-1814.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by James Monroe Museum and Memorial Library, Fredericksburg. #3159.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 35-38; Ford IX 499-501; B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Paper money. Destutt de Tracy's Review of Montesquieu. Jean Baptiste Say plans to come to the U. S. Sends papers regarding petition of Albemarle Academy and on public education throughout the state. Defensive war with the Rivanna Co. Mentions Peter Carr, Thomas Cooper, William Duane, Francis W. Gilmer, [Joseph] Milligan, printer of Georgetown, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and William Cabell Rives. [1335]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JEREMIAH A. GOODMAN, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. #2285. Original owned by Mrs. Laird U. Park.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of hogs and wheat very unsatisfactory. Sends plows, bottled beer, and wool by Dick. Urges better care of his sheep. Mr. Watkins to make a wheat machine for T. J. Intermarriage among T. J.'s slaves. Phill not to be punished for running away. Urgent that tobacco be sent to Richmond. References to [William] Mitchell, [Archibald] Robertson, and to the following slaves: Phill, Hanah, Dick, Nanny, Reuben, Daniel, and Stephen. [1336]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. Draft copy [?]. 1 pp. On verso of lettercover to T. J., Monticello. #5759.

scopecontent.p: Payment to T. J. Randolph. Flour and tobacco sales. Hopes British will not delay treaty to get part of Maine. [2881]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Public stock in T. J.'s name belonging to General Kosciuszko. [1337]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM PLUMER.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. #38-414-a. Printed: L & B XIV 235-238; B of R VI 376 (MS. in DLC) .

scopecontent.p: Thanks for Plumer's pamphlet. Treasonable action of Massachusetts. [1338]

did.unittitle: PETER CARR, Carr's Brook, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 6 pp. (including 5 pp. enclosure). Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Severe attack of rheumatism. Requests supply of port or claret. Copy of his will, dated 16 January 1815. Property to his wife, Hetty Smith Carr, for life, then divided among his children at her discretion. Specific bequests to his sisters Cary Carr, Mary Carr, to his nieces, Martha, Lucy Ann, Virginia, and Mary Jane Terrell, brothers, Samuel Carr and Dabney Carr, step-son, George P. Stevenson, son, Dabney Carr, nephew, Dabney Terrell. Recommends the advice of Wilson C. Nicholas. Witnessed by Christopher Hudson, Dabney Minor, and Virginia Terrell. Memorandum attached concerning sum owed by Robert Carter Nicholas and provisions for adjustment of estate between Ellen B. Carr, Dabney S. Carr, Jane M. Carr, and George P. Stevenson. [1339]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM CARUTHERS, Lexington, Va.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 p. with address. #11407.

scopecontent.p: Presents compliments. Requests an enclosed letter [not present] be delivered.

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 37.

scopecontent.p: Sending Squire for dog. Requests return of his watch. Asks for scions of fruit trees and for vegetable seeds. Expects to be summoned in [Thomas Mann?] Randolph and Craven Peyton's suit. [1340]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 38.

scopecontent.p: Sending watch, dog, vegetable seeds. Directions for the vegetables. Peace confirmed. Effect on wheat, tobacco, and corn prices. [1341]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CHARLES CLAY.

scopecontent.p: Sends T. J.'s lenses with Clay's spectacles. Victory at New Orleans. [2883]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 38-41.

scopecontent.p: Petition regarding the setting up of an academy in Albemarle County; possible effect on the College of William and Mary. Hopes it will induce such men as Jean Baptiste Say to reside in Virginia. Disposition of his slaves from Corotoman taken by the British. References to Dr. [Charles?] Carr, Peter Carr, Admiral Cockburn, John A. Smith, Destutt de Tracy, David Watson, and Charles Yancey. [1342]

did.unittitle: TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. In French. Endorsed by T. J. #6237.

scopecontent.p: Believes T. J. has become Secretary of State again. Requests interest due him, and principal after formal peace with England. Advises establishment of a military college to insure republican spirit necessary for a free state. [2883-b]

did.unittitle: T. B. GREER. RECEIPT to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Bedford County tax receipts, by William Salmon for Greer. [1343]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to GENERAL [HENRY DEARBORN].
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by Dearborn. Photostat. #2873. Original owned by H. J. Coolidge. Printed: L & B XIV 287-289; Randall III 399; TJR IV 257-258.

scopecontent.p: Pleasure over the victory of New Orleans and the Peace of Ghent. Mentions the treason of William Hull, Dearborn's victories at York and Fort George. Apostasy of Massachusetts in forsaking the counsel of the two Adams for that of Strong. Hopes for visit from Dearborn and Caesar Rodney. [1344]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Sends money. Flour sales. Northern and European markets. Ship from France ruined Havana market. Shadwell flour. None from Bedford. Tobacco prices. [2884]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Printed: Va. Mag. Hist. XLVI 119.

scopecontent.p: Ellen's visit to Warren delayed by death of a horse. Mrs. Marks' visit to Randolph Jefferson. [1345]

did.unittitle: DEED OF TRUST ON CARLTON.
did.physdesc: DS (AD by T. J.). 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carlton Papers, #38-216.

scopecontent.p: Charles Lewis Bankhead and Anne Cary Bankhead, to John Bankhead, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and Reuben Lindsay, all of Albemarle County. Witnessed by Edmund Bacon, W. Ballard, Robin Goodman, and T. J. Randolph. Recorded 1 May 1815 and again 5 August 1822 by Alexander Garrett, Clerk of Albemarle, and 12 August 1822 by John Pendleton, Clerk of Caroline. Deed of trust to tract of land called Carlton and to 37 slaves, and cattle, hogs, furniture, and dwelling; to be used to pay the creditors of Anne C. and Charles L. Bankhead, and thereafter for the maintenance of Anne and Charles. Mentions John Kelly, James Leitch, Molly Lewis, Robert Streshly, and John J. Taylor. [1346]

did.unittitle: TRIPARTITE INDENTURE between THOMAS JEFFERSON on the first part, ANNE CARY BANKHEAD on the second part, and JOHN BANKHEAD of Caroline County, THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., and REUBEN LINDSAY.
did.physdesc: ADS by T. J. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carlton Papers, #38-216.

scopecontent.p: Witnessed by Robin Goodman, Edmund Bacon, and W. Ballard. Recorded 1 May 1815 by Alexander Garrett, Clerk of Albemarle County Court. Deed to land in Albemarle County, to be held in trust by Bankhead, Lindsay, and Randolph for the maintenance of Charles L. Bankhead, Anne C. Bankhead, and their children. [1347]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH JEFFERSON, Snowden, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231. Printed: Mayo 39.

scopecontent.p: Arrival of Anna Scott Marks. Sale of land to Charles A. Scott to pay off debts. Will send fish when possible. Visit of Thomas J. Randolph and young Wilson Nicholas. [1348]

did.unittitle: JEREMIAH A. GOODMAN, Poplar Forest, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Papers on Scott served to Bedford sheriff. Tobacco to Richmond, except that for Lynchburg sale. Wheat sales to pay Mr. Mitchell. [2885]

did.unittitle: ACCOUNT OF TADUESZ KOSCIUSZKO WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Account for 1814 May 12-1815 April 8. Originally enclosed with Barnes' letter to T. J. of 1815 May 25. [1070]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. on 1 leaf; on verso of an address leaf detached from a letter sent to T. J. (possibly from John Vaughan of Philadelphia dated 1815 March 19). Docketed by T. J. The leaf is addressed to "Thomas Jefferson, Monticello, Virginia" with "Milton" added in a different hand between the words "Monticello" and "Virginia"; here is also a "Free" frank stamp, a partially legible postmark, and the remnants of a wax seal. #16346.

scopecontent.p: T. J. writes to Patrick Gibson regarding the sale of tobacco which T. J. has recently learned "sells high and readily"; he asks Gibson to sell his tobacco "as soon as you think advisable." As for the sale of his flour, T. J. suggests it is "best to give time for the European vessels which would not adventure to sail until they learnt there our ratification of the treaty, to arrive and produce here a full competition of demand" which he thinks will happen in May. T. J. asks Gibson to sell the flour "for whatever price shall then be going" unless Gibson receives a comparable price before then. T. J. states that he will "in the course of the present week or next" send Gibson $2000 of Treasury notes. T. J. closes with expressions of esteem and respect. [1345]

did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to Mrs. ELIZABETH TRIST, Mr. Gilmer's, near Henry Court House.

scopecontent.p: Victory at New Orleans proves popular support for Union there and in Kentucky, and Tennessee. Andrew Jackson's threatened removal: rule of law versus national survival. Bonaparte an usurper, Bourbons expelled, but people must rule. U.S. maxim not to meddle in European affairs. U.S. system distinct in interests, but connected in commerce. England governed by merchants, not by common sense. Will not permit U.S. to remain at peace, but will renew Orders in Council, resume impressment, force war on U.S. as they forced France to become nation of soldiers. Mr. and Mrs. Divers well. Peas in. Monticello family well. T. J. Randolph's marriage. Peter Carr's death. Mentions Mr. and Mrs. Peachy Gilmer. [2888]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM WIRT, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 6 pp. McGregor Library, #5622. Printed: L and B XIV, 335-42.

scopecontent.p: Rhode Island Resolutions, mentioning Richard Henry Lee, Francis Lightfoot Lee, John Adams, Thomas Johnson, Edmund Randolph, William Fleming, John Fleming, John Robinson, Peyton Randolph, Edmund Pendleton, George Wythe, and Richard Bland. Virginia aristocracy isolated from European society. Wild Irish in Valley of Virginia between Blue Ridge and northern mountains. Social strata: aristocrats, half-breeds, pretenders, yeomanry, overseers. Bland's pamphlet, Dickinson's Letters from a Pennsylvania Farmer. Allows quotes in loan office, Josiah Philips cases, hut not on Henry and Lee addresses. Benjamin Harrison, Robert C. Nicholas gave some information. T. J. role in Burgesses session welcoming Lord Botetourt. T. J. prepared answer in 1775 to Lord North's propositions at session called by Lord Dunmore. Mr. Nicholas represented James City County at Williamsburg. T. J. first met Patrick Henry in 1759-60 at Nathaniel West Dandridge's, whose sister Mrs. Spotswood married John Campbell. [2891]

did.unittitle: M. A. C. MONROE, Salem, Ky., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: In suit between Mitchie B. Jefferson, widow of Randolph Jefferson, and Thomas Jefferson, Robert Lewis Jefferson, Field Jefferson, Isham Randolph Jefferson, and James Lilburne Jefferson, sons of said Randolph Jefferson. Declaration regarding his part in writing Randolph Jefferson's first will, and his belief that it was not Randolph's intention to change that will while in sound and healthy mind. Debts run up by Mrs. Jefferson, by writing forged orders. Mentions Mr. Moon and Mr. Johnson, storekeepers; Zachariah Pryor; Anna Scott Marks. [1369]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DR. ROBERT PATTERSON, Philadelphia.

did.physdesc: AD. 5 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-183-a.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg.
