did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 41-42 (minor variations); B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Solicits Cabell's aid for claim of Capt. Joseph Miller, formerly of England, who prays confirmation of the will of his half-brother, Thomas Reed. Asks also the aid of Thomas W. Maury and Mr. Baker. Disapproves seizure of Miller's funds by the Literary Fund. [1385]

did.unittitle: MARTIN DAWSON, Milton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Account with Dawson, mentions Edmund Bacon and John Bacon. Payment by draft on Richmond or cash. Partnership with John Watson. [2897]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON AN ACT FOR THE ESTABLISHING OF a College in the county of Albemarle . . . to be called CENTRAL COLLEGE . . .
did.physdesc: AD. 3 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 391-393 (variant). RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: College to be governed by a Board of Visitors who will appoint a treasurer and proctor, establish professorships, lay down rules of government and discipline, fix fees, and in general do what they deem necessary and proper. (Act was adopted February 1816). [1386]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ACCOUNT.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by James Monroe Museum and Memorial Library, Fredericksburg. #3159.

scopecontent.p: Household costs. [2898]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN ADLUM, near Georgetown.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #6033. Printed: Betts, Garden Book, 554-55, extract.

scopecontent.p: Wine sent while in Washington. Mr. Penn's fox grape cuttings to be sent care of William F. Gray, Fredericksburg, to Milton. [2899]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 43-45.

scopecontent.p: Expects no opposition to Mr. Miller's petition. Some resistance to the bill for establishing Central College. Questioning of powers given the professors to imprison students. Possibility of a school for the deaf and dumb, taught by a Mr. Braidwood, to be attached to the college. Recommends enlisting the cooperation of Chapman Johnson, William G. Poindexter, Edward Watts and John W. Green of the Senate. References to [Peter] Carr, [Thomas W.] Maury, and [Charles] Yancey. [1387]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Remittance to General Kosciuszko, possibly through Baring Brothers. [1388]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 45-47.

scopecontent.p: Objections to the Central College bill. Papers in Captain Miller's case with respect to the Reed estate. Copy of the bill to prevent obstructions in the navigable watercourses of Virginia. Appropriations for Literary Fund and for endowment of a professorship for teaching the deaf and dumb. Dr. Smith asks recommendation of a textbook on the principles of government for use at William and Mary. References to Chapman Johnson, John Locke, Jean Jacques Rousseau, Jean Baptiste Say, and Charles Yancey. [1389]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 50-51; B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC); Adams II 66-67.

scopecontent.p: Requests permission to publish T. J.'s letter to Peter Carr regarding the establishment of Central College. Possible locations: Charlottesville, Staunton, or Lexington. Move to shift seat of government to Staunton. References to [Charles F.] Mercer. [1390]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 4749; B of R. VI 58 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Matters concerning Central College; duties of its Proctor; public school system; disapproves of connection of Mr. Braidwood's school for the deaf and dumb with the college; refuses to write about Central College to gentlemen named, because his correspondence too burdensome. [1391]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat, #1633. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney.

scopecontent.p: Draft on Gibson in favor of T. J. Randolph, to be paid for by the sale of flour. [1392]

did.unittitle: DABNEY CARR, Winchester, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: If Louis Girardin's continuation of John Burk's history does not contain T. J.'s account of Dabney Carr, Sr., (writer's father), will turn it over for William Wirt's book. Proposed inscription for Carr's tombstone left in Philip Mazzei's book. [1393]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL., Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 51.

scopecontent.p: Encloses conveyances for which Joseph Miller's bill is hung up. [1394]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HENRY JACKSON, CHARGÉ DES AFFAIRS OF U.S., PARIS.

scopecontent.p: Thanks Jackson for kind words in letter to George Ticknor. T. J. sending Jackson letters to Ticknor, and Mr. Appleton, Consul at Leghorn. Dabney Terrell of Kentucky will deliver T. J.'s letters to Jackson on his way to Geneva. [2900]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 5 pp. Endorsed by T. J. (Also an extract by N. P. Trist, 4 pp.). #201. Printed: Cabell 52-56; L & B XIV 417-423; B of R VI 58 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Encloses list of acts and journals, copies of which are in his library purchased by Congress. Comments on the bill on the obstruction in navigable waters. Hopes he can retain his canal. Recommends Destutt de Tracy's Review of Montesquieu, to John A. Smith as best elementary book on government. Central College Bill. Public school system for Virginia. Division of powers between federal, state, and local governments. Stresses dividing counties into wards, where every man may take active part in his government. [1395]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Remittance to General Kosciuszko. Copy of letter from Kosciuszko to Barnes mentioning bills of exchange sent to Baring Brothers & Co. [1396]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 56.

scopecontent.p: Passage of bill for Central College, Mr. Miller's bill, and the bill respecting navigable waters. Reference to [John W.] Green. [1397]

did.unittitle: DABNEY C. TERRELL, Baltimore, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Sailing for France delayed by freezing of basin. [Thomas] Mann Randolph has promise of midshipman's warrant. Albert Gallatin's letters expected. Governor of Pennsylvania does not intend demanding him. Mentions Mr. Stevenson and Martha T. Randolph. [1398]

did.unittitle: JAMES LILBURNE JEFFERSON, Scott's Ferry, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. 2 enclosures. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Attempts to get money from father's estate so far unsuccessful. Has rented ferry; wishes to rent part of Snowden. Plans to travel west. Step-mother, Mitchie B. Jefferson, has removed to mother's house. Enclosures: two bills for cloth and stockings from James Leitch and Bramham & Jones, one endorsed by T. J.: "J Lilburne Jefferson." [1399]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 57-60.

scopecontent.p: Passage of Captain Miller's bill and of bill respecting navigable water; rejection of lottery bill to purchase Triplett Estis' property. Possible appropriation of U. S. surplus to Literary Fund. Modifications in Central College Bill respecting powers of college proctor, glebe lands, and the Literary Fund. Translation of Jean Baptiste Say's Traité d'economie politique. Mentions William Cabell, John W. Green, Chapman Johnson, Thomas W. Maury, and Wilson C. Nicholas. [1400]

did.unittitle: JOHN G. ROBERT for PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Teneriffe wine from Dr. Fernandes, through Fox and Richardson, by Mr. Gilmer's boat. [2901]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: High rates of exchange prevent a remittance to Kosciuszko. [1401]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 60-61.

scopecontent.p: Publication of T. J.'s letter to Peter Carr. Appropriation of Virginia's U. S. Government stock to education. Presbyterians in Lexington and Scotch-Irish in Staunton will object to Albemarle as site for university since they hope to move seat of government to Staunton. Washington College at Lexington the bantling of the Federalists. Trouble with Colonel Monroe about caucus for an electoral ticket. References to Wilson C. Nicholas and [Charles F.] Mercer. [1402]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON vs. SAMUEL SCOTT.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Statement to balance due T. J. (from Scott?) after payment of land tax in Campbell County. [1403]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 62.

scopecontent.p: Recommending that he translate Jean Baptiste Say's Traité d'economie politique. Mentions Destutt de Tracy's Review of Montesquieu and William Duane. [1404]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588. Printed: B of R X 7 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Documents he worked out regarding Louisiana boundaries from the Perdido to the Rio Bravo is now in his library, recently purchased by Congress. A copy is in the State Department files; and the Virginia Argus printed a statement similar to this. A manuscript history of the settlement of the country by Bernard de la Harpe, proving the French claims to the Bravo as opposed to the Spanish, is in the State Department files. Manuscript found in possession of the family of the late Governor Messier. Mentions [Thomas?] Cooper, St. Denys Crosat. [1405]

did.unittitle: FRANK CARR to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson's man, Moses, at Farley's with broken leg. Cannot be moved. [1406]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Flour prices. Tobacco sales. [2902]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Tobacco prices. Flour prices Sales to P. F. Smith, John M. Warwick and William Gilliat. [2903]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Presentation of money to Ellen Randolph. Purchase of stock in the Farmer's and Mechanic's Bank from its cashier, C. Smith, for General Kosciuszko. Remittance to the General. Reference to Joseph Nourse. [1407]

did.unittitle: ACCOUNT OF TADUESZ KOSCIUSZKO WITH JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Originally enclosed with Barnes letter to T. J. of the same date. [1070]

did.unittitle: ACCOUNT against THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Bill for bacon, corn, and carrying tobacco. [1408]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILSON C. NICHOLAS.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. #38-414-a. Printed: L & B XIV 446-456; B of R VI 354 (MS. in DLC); Md. Hist. Mag. VII 419 (extract).

scopecontent.p: Advantages of dividing counties into wards for administrative and educational purposes. Mentions letters to Joseph C. Cabell and John Adams. [1409]

did.unittitle: JAMES LILBURNE JEFFERSON, Warren, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Judge ill. Mr. Booker reported him unable to hold court to try Randolph Jefferson's will. All essential witnesses ready. [1410]

did.unittitle: POPLAR FOREST ACCOUNT.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Joel Yancey, overseer, statement of amount due Charles Clay, 27 April 1816. [1210]

did.unittitle: JAMES LIGON for PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Flour sales to William H. Hubbard and to Smith and Riddle. Mr. Warwick brought flour at Col. Randolph's instructions. [2904]

did.unittitle: TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AL. Draft in French. 4 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Muzeum Narodowe w Krakowie, Poland. #9013-a.

scopecontent.p: American victory over English. T. J.'s and Addison's [sic] reputation high in Europe. Discusses state of Poland and Alexander I's failure to recreate old boundaries. At Soleure, Switzerland. Personal finances in U.S. England respects U.S., not Europe, whose ministers corrupt. English and French commerce. [2904-a]

did.unittitle: JOHN STEELE, Collector's Office, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Wine and macaroni from Stephen Cathalan at Marseilles. [2905]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat, #1623. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney.

scopecontent.p: Sale of T. J.'s flour. Payment to Mr. Robertson and for taxes in Albemarle. [1411]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PETER MINOR.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Frank J. McHugh, Jr. #8134.

scopecontent.p: Invitation for peas and punch. [2905-a]

did.unittitle: FRANK CARR, Charlottesville, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Bill for medical services to slaves 1813-1816, totaling $151. [1412]

did.unittitle: JOHN STEELE to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Partly printed. Moyer-Jefferson Papers, #9828.

scopecontent.p: Bill of lading for wine and macaroni.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sale of Kosciuszko's treasury notes and purchase of bank stock. Remittance to Kosciuszko delayed by high exchange rates. Banking services offered to Ellen Randolph. President Madison's visit to Annapolis and naval review. Mentions Dolly P. Madison. [1413]

did.unittitle: JOHN STEELE, Collector's Office, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Goods from Stephen Cathalan on ship Five Sisters. Encloses bill of lading. [2906]

did.unittitle: DABNEY C. TERRELL, Geneva, Switzerland, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Describes trip through low countries and France. Education in Geneva with Marc Auguste Pictet. Report in Moniteur that Mexicans and South Americans losing. Desire to go to Spain. Regards to Martha Randolph. [1414]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 62-65.

scopecontent.p: Maine's method of preparing hawthorne hedges is best. References to James Henderson, Isaac Newton, Dobson's Encyclopedia, and Lord Karmes' translation of Say's Traité d'economie politique. Implementation of General Assembly act requiring an accurate map of each county. [1415]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster, Va.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 65-66.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for Maine's recipe for preparing hawthorn. Discussion of relative merits of hedgethorn, hawthorn, holly, pyracanthus, cedar for hedges. Translation of Say's Traité d'economie politique. Recommends son of W. D. Meriwether for surveying (preparatory to Böÿe's A Map of the State of Virginia ). [1416]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 67.

scopecontent.p: Encloses letter on his political ramblings. [1417]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Remittance to General Kosciuszko. Mentions James Monroe. [1418]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES to BARING BROTHERS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Copy for T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Re Tadeusz Kosciuszko's account. Originally enclosed with [1420]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES to [TADEUSZ] KOSCIUSZKO c/o BARING BROTHERS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Copy for T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Originally enclosed with [1420]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DAVID GELSTON

scopecontent.p: Jefferson asks Gelston, collector of the Port of New York, to ship a case of Barsac wine from Bordeaux to Richmond in care of Gibson & Jefferson. The wine was originally sent to New York by Consul John Martin Baker via the brig General Ward.

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Edgewood, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Partly printed: Cabell 6769.

scopecontent.p: Superiority of thorn hedges. Surveying for the map authorized by the Assembly (Herman Böÿe's A Map of the State of Virginia ). Advisability of a convention to amend the Virginia Constitution, favored by westerners desiring to place the pecuniary burdens of government on the easterners and by Federalist bank stockholders wishing to charter fifteen banks. Books by Montesquieu, Destutt de Tracy, and Say as textbooks at William and Mary. References to Philip Doddridge, Mr. Meriwether, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and John Augustine Smith. [1419]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Account of General Kosciuszko's resources. Bill of exchange for the General sent to Baring Brothers & Co., London. Transferal of government stock into bank stock. Exchange bought from Smith & Riddle, Richmond, drawn by A. P. Heinrich, Baltimore, on John Rapp, London. [1420]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Transfer of General Kosciuszko's government stock into bank stock. [1421]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PETER MINOR.
did.physdesc: ALS. File draft. 1 pp. With enclosed AD, n.d., 1 pp. T. J. STATEMENT to PETER MINOR. #5984.

scopecontent.p: Directors of Rivanna Company to discuss Shadwell Mills and lock. Mr. Meriwether's basin. To Bedford. Rivanna Company was authorized by Acts of Legislature, 1794, 1805, and 1806, to open Rivanna River to Milton, later to Moore's Ford opposite Charlottesville. T. J.'s dam blocks navigation; lock needed. [2907]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PETER MINOR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. #5385-af.

scopecontent.p: Directors of Rivanna Company to discuss Shadwell Mills and lock. Mr. Meriwether's basin.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Another MS. in MHi. Printed: Cabell 70.

scopecontent.p: Returns Cabell's papers. Requests his letter be kept out of public papers. [1422]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM WIRT.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. McGregor Library, #5622.

scopecontent.p: Wirt's Sketches of the life and character of Patrick Henry. Henry did not read Livy annually. May have read some Greek and Roman history. Perhaps read Stith's History of the First Discovery and Settlement of Virginia. Professor at William and Mary College Richard Graham, not Greene. Henry counselor for Nathaniel West Dandridge, not James Littlepage. John Blair more important than Bolling Starke. To Bedford. [2908]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to DAVID GELSTON.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson writes concerning an invoice requested by Gelston, the collector of the port of New York. He sends some letters and papers, asks that some books be forwarded to Richmond, and promises to remit the cost of the books and some wine as soon as Gelston informs him of the amount.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to WILLIAM WIRT.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #5622.

scopecontent.p: Revisions for Wirt's Sketches of the life and character of Patrick Henry. To Albemarle. [2909]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON REVISIONS TO WILLIAM WIRT'S [ SKETCHES OF THE LIFE AND CHARACTER OF PATRICK HENRY ].
did.physdesc: AD. 4 pp. McGregor Library, #5622.

scopecontent.p: Questions concerning William Livingstone, U.S. House of Representatives, John Jay, Richard Henry Lee. Edward Foy was Lord Dunmore's secretary. Thomas Nelson President of Assembly at William Nelson's death in Hanover. William Henry and John Syme cowards. John Page, member of committee, thought Patrick Henry a coward. Committee of Safety refused commands to William Byrd and Henry. Distrust between Patrick Henry and Edmund Pendleton. Compares Demosthenes and Henry. Henry glad to leave Congress at Philadelphia. George Washington's military law. [2910]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM WIRT, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #5622.

scopecontent.p: Have Sketches of the life and character of Patrick Henry miscarried? [2911]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Difficulties in transferring Kosciuszko's stock into his own name. Request for powers of attorney from Kosciuszko and T. J. Collection of dividends from the Bank of Columbia. [1423]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM WIRT.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. McGregor Library, #5622.

scopecontent.p: Manuscript received at Poplar Forest relates to time of T. J.'s service in Europe. Josiah Philips, Edmund Randolph, and Patrick Henry. St. George Tucker's Blackstone's Commentaries. [2912]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN BANKHEAD.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Concerning Charles Bankhead's alcoholism and consequent insanity. His plantation going to ruin. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [1424]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of T. J.'s and Kosciuszko's powers of attorney. Remittance to Kosciuszko. Note forwarded to [Joseph] Milligan. [1425]

did.unittitle: JAMES LIGON for PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Account. [2913]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JOHN STEELE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #11411. Owned by Thomas Jefferson's Poplar Forest.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson writes concerning a cask of wine.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to WILLIAM WIRT, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. McGregor Library, #5622.

scopecontent.p: Old Virginia aristocracy preserved by entail. Wirt's Sketches of the life and character of Patrick Henry should not be retrenched. Quarterly reviews will attack it, but those in Edinburgh may defend. Critics will compare it with Plutarch and Nepos. Proper canons of criticism. [2914]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown. to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Difficulties in replacing a protested bill of exchange sent to Kosciuszko. Transfer to Kosciuszko's name of his Bank of Columbia stock and government stock. Reference to Baring Brothers of London, Smith & Riddle of Richmond, and Buckley & Abbott of New York. [1426]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Form for transfer of government stock and Bank of Columbia stock from T. J.'s name to Kosciuszko's. Bill of exchange, received from Smith & Biddle to replace one protested, on its way to Baring Brothers. [1427]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mill Brook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Martin (slave) to stay at Monticello until skilled in turning wood. Health improving. Greetings from Martha Eppes. [1428]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Monteagle, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Will send deed. [2915]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, POWER OF ATTORNEY to JOHN BARNES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. #2283. Original owned by Polish Roman Catholic Union of America.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson authorizes Barnes to transfer to Tadeusz Kosciuszko "all the stock of the United States standing to my credit on the books of the Treasury as well as all my shares in the Bank of Columbia."

did.unittitle: [WILSON CARY NICHOLAS] to THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Monticello].
did.physdesc: AL. 2 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Concerning T. J.'s effort to renew cordiality between James Monroe and Nicholas broken when Nicholas supported Madison for the presidency. [1429]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: AN. In unidentified hand. 1 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Orders needles. [2916]

did.unittitle: "PAVILION NO. VII W. DORIC PALLADIO." ELEVATION AND THREE PLANS.

scopecontent.p: Cornerstone laid October 6, 1817. [N-311, K-19]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Partly printed: Cabell 70-71; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Requests his attention to the petition of the Viscount Barziza, grandchild of Lucy Ludwell Paradise, for his share in her estate. Requests him to oppose Capt. [W. D.?] Meriwether's petition for turnpike from Rockfish Gap to Moore's Ford. [1430]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: DS. 7 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Enclosing Barnes' account with Kosciuszko for the years 1815 and 1816, with his notes to Kosciuszko relative to the account. [1431]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 71-73.

scopecontent.p: Cabell to oppose the petition to which T. J. is opposed, and attend to Count Barziza's petition. Translation of Say's Traité d'economie politique. Copy of a banking bill enclosed. Failure to increase the Literary Fund as recommended by the governor. Col. [Samuel?] Taylor author of petition from Port Royal. Appointment of Cabell as a Visitor of Central College. Difficulty in obtaining money for colleges. Possible site for the University in Staunton. References to Thomas W. Maury. [1432]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Difficulty in changing government stock and Bank of Columbia stock to Kosciuszko's name. Encloses powers of attorney for this purpose. [1433]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mill Brook.

scopecontent.p: Education of Francis Eppes. Martin (slave) learning to turn posts tolerably. Pleased that Eppes is returning to the U. S. Senate. References to Anne Bankhead, Martha Randolph, and Martha Eppes. [1434]

did.unittitle: VERDICT IN THE CASE OF T. J. vs. MINOR HEIRS OF BENNETT HENDERSON.
did.physdesc: DS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Award by Dabney and Peter Minor, arbiters in controversy between T. J. and Frances, Lucy, and Nancy C. Henderson, minor heirs of Bennett Henderson, regarding rent on lands belonging to said minor heirs and held illegally by T. J. T. J. to pay $766.80 for rent. Receipt for amount from W. D. Meriwether, attorney for heirs. Mentions Craven Peyton, James L. Henderson, and John Henderson. [1435]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Kosciuszko's account. Transfer of government and Bank of Columbia stock to his name completed. [1436]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 73-74.

scopecontent.p: Rejection of Count Barziza's petition. Is attending to Turnpike Bill. Hewing down of mammoth bank bill. References to Thomas W. Maury, [Joseph] Milligan (bookseller), William C. Rives, Tracy's Political Economy, and Archibald Thweatt. [1437]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Partly printed: Cabell 74.

scopecontent.p: Report on Turnpike Bill, bill to call a convention, bill to equalize senatorial districts (modeled after bill reported by T. J., Pendleton, and Wythe in 1779), and the University Bill. Mentions Archibald Thweatt and Charles Yancey. [1438]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: AD. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Covering copy of a form required to receive interest on Kosciuszko's public stock. [1439]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS MANN RANDOLPH, JR., Varina.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Request from Judge Peters for a model of Thomas Mann Randolph's hillside plow. Anne Bankhead's health. References to John Bankhead, Joseph C. Cabell, Captain Clarke, Thomas W. Maury, Dabney Minor, and Charles Yancey. [1440]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES MADISON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #3360. Clifton Waller Barrett Library.

scopecontent.p: Letter and seeds by Bessy. University of Virginia Board of Visitors. Madison to join John Hartwell Cocke, David Watson, Joseph Carrington Cabell, and James Monroe, at Monticello. [2917]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Monteagle, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Has sold corn promised to T. J. [2918]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Inclosing a copy of the National Messenger which contains two letters from President Adams to Judge [William] Cushing. Mentions T. Dalton. [1441]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.

scopecontent.p: Scuppernong wine. Marseilles fig, paper mulberry, and cuttings of Lombardy poplar from France. Prickly locust (Robinia hispida) and snowberry bush brought from Pacific by Capt. Lewis. Mentions gooseberry bush. [2918-a]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Edgewood, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 75.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [NICOLAS GOUIN] DUFIEF.

did.unittitle: ALBEMARLE COUNTY COURT ORDER ESTABLISHING COMMITTEE TO EVALUATE T. J. AND T. J. RANDOLPH PROPOSAL TO BUILD ROADS.

Bankhead's lands from near Charlottesville to Secretary's Ford, thence to mouth of Chapel Branch. Road from Moore's Creek to area of Colle. Committee: Joseph Coleman, Benjamin Childress, Andrew Hart, Robert McCullock, Jr., John Slaughter, Brightberry Brown, and Horsley Goodman. [2919]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON, Montpelier, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #3942.

scopecontent.p: Business in Washington prevents attending Central College. Board of Visitors. Mentions Bizet. To Monticello when Board meets next. [2920]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES DINSMORE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Asking him to superintend the building of Central College. Board of Visitors: James Madison, James Monroe, John Hartwell Cocke, Joseph C. Cabell, David Watson, and T. J. Mentions John Neilson. [1443]

did.unittitle: JAMES DINSMORE, Petersburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Accepts job superintending construction of Central College, with John Neilson. Plan for house for James Monroe. Gift of two books from Capt. Robert Simington, Baker's Chronicle and the History of the Holy Wars, 1684. [1444]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Bremo, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 75-76.

scopecontent.p: Inability to attend meeting of the Board of Visitors of Central College. References to Bedford and Goochland counties, Enniscorthy, John Hartwell Cocke, James Madison, and David Watson. [1445]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARCHIBALD ROBERTSON, Lynchburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Plans for reducing his debts have failed in past due to Embargo, war, and drought. Wheat and tobacco crops promising. Draft on Gibson & Jefferson will pay for drafts on Robertson in favor of Nimrod Darnell, William Miller, and Robert Miller. [1446]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mill Brook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Poplar Forest].
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Grape slips from North Carolina for T. J. Plans to locate Francis Eppes at Richmond as superior to Lynchburg. Letter to Colonel Burton from Gen. Calvin Jones regarding the scuppernong grape. Shipment of wine by Colonel Burton through Mr. Gibson of Richmond. John Randolph's chance in the election. News of Martha Randolph and Thomas J. Randolph. Eppes obliged to give up wine and spirits. [1447]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ACCOUNT AGAINST WILLIAM MITCHELL.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Account balancing wheat sent to Mitchell for flour and bacon received. [1448]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Cocke Papers, #3184. Printed: B of R VI 89 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Meeting of the Board of Visitors. Mentions Enniscorthy, Joseph Cabell, James Madison, James Monroe, and David Watson. [1449]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Typescript copy. Another MS. at CsmH. #38-755.

scopecontent.p: Payment to Mr. Burton for Scuppernong wine. Revolution in England unavoidable. Meeting of the visitors of Central College: Joseph C. Cabell, John Hartwell Cocke, T. J., James Madison, James Monroe, and David Watson. Hopes to start work in languages at Central College next spring. [1450]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #6595. Another MS. at CsmH.

scopecontent.p: Payment to Mr. Burton for Scuppernong wine. Revolution in England unavoidable. Meeting of the visitors of Central College: Joseph C. Cabell, John Hartwell Cocke, T. J., James Madison, James Monroe, and David Watson. Hopes to start work in languages at Central College next spring. [2921]

did.unittitle: RESOLUTION OF UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA BOARD OF VISITORS.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Photostat. In hand of James Madison; signed by T. J. #3430.

scopecontent.p: T. J. and John Hartwell Cocke jointly to be interim Central College Proctor. Also signed by John Hartwell Cocke, James Monroe, and James Madison. [2922]

did.unittitle: FRANK CARR, Bentivar, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Requesting his aid in forwarding letters to [Richard?] Terrell in Europe. [1451]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM THORNTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #38-174. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: Cast of Ceracchi's bust of T. J. Plans for Central College buildings. Contains rough sketch of T. J.'s early idea for the ground plans, showing seven pavilions around an open space with grass and trees. [1452, N-300]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Encloses letters from Kosciuszko, Baring Brothers & Co., and Buckley & Abbott. Plans for visit to Monticello delayed by arrival of his grandchildren, J. A. Duryee, a Yale graduate, and Maria Duryee. References to Timothy Dwight, Joseph Milligan, and his nephew, Samuel Milligan. [1453]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, to MR. [LOUIS] LESCHOT .

scopecontent.p: T. J. writes to Leschot, a Swiss watchmaker in Charlottesville, requesting repair of a watch belonging to his friend Louis H. Giradin and extending an invitation to dine at Monticello.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Visit to Monticello. Books from Joseph Milligan. [1454]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Milton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Awaits a horse or carriage to climb Monticello mountain. [1455]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Wood's school. Francis to study arithmetic using Bezout, Latin, and Greek. Greetings from Mrs. Randolph to Mrs. Eppes. [2923]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to BARON F. H. A. VON HUMBOLDT.

scopecontent.p: Necessity of majority rule must be learned in Spanish America. [1456]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCOIS DE BARBE: MARBOIS.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Extract by N. P. Trist ca. 1830. #38-414-a. Printed: L & B XV 129-131; B of R VI 314 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Belief in the strength of republican structure of the U. S. as its size grows, contrary to Montesquieu. [1457]

did.unittitle: JOHN M. and FRANCES T. PERRY, Albemarle County. DEED to ALEXANDER GARRETT, Proctor of CENTRAL COLLEGE.
did.physdesc: DS. (T. J. AD). 4 pp. Seals. #38-174. Recorded by William Wertenbaker, Clerk.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES DINSMORE, Petersburg.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [JAMES] DINSMORE
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #7254-b. Photostat.

scopecontent.p: Discusses site for Central College.

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Monteagle, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Asks legal opinion on deed from Lewis to Lewis. Sends copy of Wickham's and William Wirt's opinions. Note by T. J.: Peyton is bona fide purchaser and C. L. Lewis guilty of fraud by his silence. [1460]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest to PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat, #1633. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney.

scopecontent.p: Enclosing notes he has signed. [1461]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sale of watches for Louis Leschute, mentioning watchmakers and repairmen, Mr. Eckles and Morris Tobias of London. [1462]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill Randolph Papers, #1397.

did.unittitle: CHRISTOPHER L. BLACK, WILLIAM SINGLETON, HOUGHTON SMITH, SAMUEL BURGESS, AND THOMAS D. CANDY, Charleston, South Carolina, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Remittance enclosed for Louis Leschute. Books from Joseph Milligan forwarded to Mr. Gray, Fredericksburg. [1464]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-163. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: B of R VI 89 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Board of Visitors' meeting. Beginning of construction work at Central College. Mentions James Madison. [1465]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES OLDHAM, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #3177. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of mahogany. Order for locks, handles, and bolts, to be paid for by Patrick Gibson. [1466]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown. ACCOUNT with THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Account for the years 1814-1817. Mentions [John] Armstrong, Gales & Seaton, Gibson & Jefferson, Tadeusz Kosciuszko, and Dolly Madison. [1467]

did.physdesc: 3 copies. 2 pp. #1097. Printed: Va. Mag. Hist. XXIX 445-447. The copy sent to Newton is in the McGregor Library, #1097; the copy sent to Giles and the master draft are in the general collection.

scopecontent.p: Soliciting funds for Central College. Advantages of location; general plans; personnel of Board of Visitors. [1468]

did.unittitle: JAMES LIGON for PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Fisher not paid by Mr. Dufief. Flour sales. Mentions V. W. Southall. [2926]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to SAMUEL HARRISON, Lynchburg.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Typescript copy. #1774. Original owned by Francis Burton Harrison.

scopecontent.p: Introducing M. and Mme. A. F. de Laage, lately removed to Lynchburg from Charlottesville. [1469]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Edgewood, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 76-78.

scopecontent.p: Catalog of English books sold by Barrois at Paris. Subscriptions to Central College from Albemarle, Amherst, Campbell, Lancaster, Northumberland, Richmond, and Westmoreland counties. Death of Cabell's mother. Comments of T. J.'s manuscript on meteorological subjects. References to William Brent, George Cabell, John Camm, Hill Carter, Sterling Claiborne, Ellyson Currie, Thomas Eubanks, David S. Garland, Spottswood Garland, William J. Lewis, James Madison, Roderick McCullock, William Pope, Robert Rives, Mr. Ritchie, Henry St. George Tucker, Robert Walker, and Edmund Winston. [1470]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to HUGH CHISHOLM.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-174. File draft. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: Progress of construction at Central College. Superiority of stone-and brickworkers near Lynchburg. [1471]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest near Lynchburg, to THOMAS COOPER.
did.physdesc: ALS. Draft copy. 4 pp. #7254-a.

scopecontent.p: Plans advancing for college of general science, supported by public subscription and perhaps by Virginia legislature, which granted constitution and made Governor its patron. Visitors James Monroe, James Madison, Joseph C. Cabell, John Hartwell Cocke, David Watson, and T. J. Construction underway near Charlottesville on pavilion for professor of languages. To teach Greek and Latin, history and rhetoric, perhaps French, Spanish, Italian, and German. Asks Cooper to recommend person. Not common school of Yankee Latin. Classical scholars among Irish immigrants and at Dublin College. Will plan other pavilions in the future. Mathematical and physiological sciences. Offers Cooper zoology, botany, mineralogy, chemistry, anatomy, and law. Mathematician from Europe. 200-300 students expected initially. William and Marv to deteriorate to grammar school because of poor climate. Charlottesville climate ideal. Free moral and political climate compensates for brawling Presbyterian and Baptist ministers. Invites visit. Fredericksburg and Charlottesville stage to bring Cooper to Monticello, to meet Mr. Correa. [2927]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Edgewood.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 79-80; L & B XVII 417-418; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC). Enclosure: AD. 14 pp.#38-111. Partly printed: Cabell App. 413417. Two other drafts of enclosure in Cabell Papers. Enclosure: AD. 4 pp. #38-111.

scopecontent.p: Encloses bill for establishing a system of public education (14 pp.) and an act for establishing elementary schools (4 pp.). Remarks on legal phraseology. Lawyers' double talk compared to simple English of the ancient statutes which T. J. tried to use in 1776. Bill provides for primary schools for all at common expense, colleges spaced at convenient distances throughout the state, and as a capstone a University in the central part of the state. List of white inhabitants of the state divided into the nine collegiate districts. [1472], [1486]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Edgewood.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed (minor variation): Cabell 80-81; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Returns Barrois' catalog. Requests he not be known as author of the bill for elementary schools. Has written to Christopher Clarke and Charles Johnston regarding subscriptions to Central College. Mentions [Thomas] Cooper. [1473]

did.unittitle: [TADEUSZ] KOSCIUSZKO to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AL. Draft. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Muzeum Narodowe w Krakowie, Poland. #9013-a.

scopecontent.p: Asks T. J. to appoint someone to replace John Barnes upon his death to manage financial affairs in U.S. Mentions James Madison. Comments on oppression of Poland, and government of U.S. Urges military college. [2927-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Present position at the University of Pennsylvania precarious because students in medicine forced to hear Dr. John R. Coxe's lectures in preference to his. Has been offered post at William and Mary which he will accept if they meet his conditions concerning his library and mineral collection. Would like to see medical school set up in Virginia, perhaps in Richmond. Mentions Burwell Bassett and John Augustine Smith. [1474]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Will write as soon as he can give decision about offer of professorship at Central College. Discusses Destutt de Tracy' Eléments d'idéologie, which Maclure imported for [Joseph C.?] Cabell. [1475]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to SAMUEL J. HARRISON.

scopecontent.p: Recommending European wines. Offers letters to Cathalan, Consul at Marseilles, and Appleton, Consul at Leghorn. Mentions Capt. Bernard Peyton as importer. Describes Roussillon, Hermitage, Florence, and Claret of Marseilles wines. [2927-b]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: No reply from Varro in Frankfort, Ky. Discusses possibility of accepting professorship at Central College. Filling of other faculty posts at the college. Has refused position at William and Mary. Possibility of medical college at Richmond. Mentions Correa da Serra and Burwell Bassett. [1476]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Hopes he will accept offer at Central College. Correa da Serra and Robert Walsh will be in Charlottesville. [1477]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD THWEATT, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Subscriptions for Central College not encouraging in Petersburg. Recommends a lottery. War taxes, prematurely ended, might have been applied to the Literary Fund. [1478]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Unable to visit T. J. because of work on lectures and correcting press for William Wirt's Life of Patrick Henry. Refusal of position at William and Mary. Classical tutor for Central College. Mentions Mr. Sanders [Robert Saunders?] of Williamsburg. [1479]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mill Brook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Visits by relatives, Mr. Burton, Mr. Lane, and families, illness among slaves, and pressure of the tobacco crop prevent his visiting T. J. Will subscribe to Central College. Plans for Francis to attend in the spring. His own illness. References to Ellen. Cornelia. and Martha Randolph. [1480]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Monteagle, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Corn sales. [2928]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to SAMUEL J. HARRISON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-174. File draft. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: Cornerstone being laid at Central College. Urges that David Knight leave at once for his work. [1481]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON "LOWER STORY OF DORICK PAVILION," UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: Ink. "Scale: 3 I. to the lin." Paper BD. 25 x 6 in. #171.

scopecontent.p: Front and side elevations. [N-307, K-3]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Charlottesville, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 81.

scopecontent.p: Delay in arriving at Board of Visitors meeting due to the meeting of the Association for an Agricultural Society. References to John Hartwell Cocke, James Madison, James Monroe, Judge [Archibald?] Stewart, and David Watson. [1482]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, David Watson, and John Hartwell Cocke, Charlottesville, Va.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-163. Endorsed by T. J. Circular. Printed: Cabell 81.

scopecontent.p: Calls meeting of Board of Visitors to consider letter from Thomas Cooper. Mentions James Madison and James Monroe. Note from Cabell and Cocke to Watson on same sheet suggesting change in time of Agricultural Society Meeting. [1483]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to THOMAS COOPER
JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Edgewood, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 82-83.

scopecontent.p: Plan for schools and colleges throughout the state of Virginia. Copy of membership list of Cincinnati left at Monticello. John Wayles Eppes endeavoring to secure subscribers at Buckingham Court House. Advises delay on the report to the Agricultural Society. Mentions John Hartwell Cocke, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and Arthur Young's Annals. [1484]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [FRANCIS WALKER] GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #38-588. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Dupont de Nemours' treatise worth publishing; suggests Robert Walsh publish it in his American Register. Discusses translation of French passage. Correa da Serra to live in Washington with Walsh. Thomas Cooper and George Ticknor possible professors at Central College. Hopes legislature will select Central College as site of University. [1485]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 83-85; L & B XIX 250-252; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Plan for a system of education "within the compass of our funds." Refuses to sacrifice public good for local interest by including petty academies and colleges throughout the state in his plans. Progress of construction at Central College slow. Mentions [William Cabell] Rives. [1486]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Withholds his decision regarding Central College position. If lectures can be arranged with Dr. John R. Coxe, may stay at University of Pennsylvania. Asks about classical tutor, Stack, formerly of Carlisle College, known by William Duane. Recommends an Irishman formerly employed by Robert Patterson, as best mathematician in United States. James Semple, Rector of William and Mary College, has sent notice of election to professorship of chemistry, despite his declining. [1487]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #1633. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s draft in favor of Mr. Southall and drafts for taxes in Albemarle and in Bedford will be paid by flour sent to Richmond by Mr. Colclaser, one of T. J.'s mill tenants. [1488]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mill Brook, Va.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-576. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Has watch from Leschot for Martha Eppes. Recommends all repair be done by Leschot. Recommends Monroe's plan for militia. Wisdom of economy and clearing of debts in time of peace. [1489]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Flour. No cotton. [2929]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat, #1633. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney.

scopecontent.p: Renewal of his note by the Bank of Virginia. Flour being shipped for T. J. by Mr. Colclaser in the hands of [Bernard] Peyton. [1490]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSHUA MEIGS, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #2560.

scopecontent.p: Recommending Thomas Eston Randolph for the office of Postmaster, Richmond, replacing Dr. [William] Foushee. [1491]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Will accept William and Mary offer renewed by Mr. Brown unless Central College can offer salary the following spring. [1492]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Flour sales to E. Williams and Joseph A. Weed. Reports from England of rise in flour prices stir local market. Note renewed in U.S. Bank. [2931]

did.unittitle: JOHN WOOD, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Enquires about classics position offered him at Central College. Would prefer mathematics chair. Sends notice of Greek-English lexicon by Gilbert Wakefield. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [1493]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to NELSON BARKSDALE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Agreement with David Knight for work at Central College to be paid for by draft on Alexander Garrett. Mentions Samuel J. Harrison. [1494]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat, #1633. Original owned by Mrs. Virginius Dabney. Another MS. at Vhi.

scopecontent.p: Johnson's delay in shipment of T. J.'s flour.[ 1495]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Unless salary assured from Central College from April next, must accept William and Mary offer. [1496]

did.unittitle: JOHN ORGAN to JOEL YANCEY, Bedford.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Will make survey. [2932]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Hopes Philadelphia students can have option to attend his lectures so he can remain at University of Pennsylvania until Central College ready. Might arrange for professorship of physical sciences to start sooner than planned to accommodate him. No one near Lynchburg remembers Stack. Plans to have distinguished professors from Edinburgh for Central College. [1497]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JOHN WOOD, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Letter to Wood was from self and not from Visitors of Central College. Understood his answer as refusal of classics professorship. Plans to procure professors from Europe. Thanks for information on Gilbert Wakefield's Greek-English Lexicon. [1498]

did.unittitle: JOHN ORGAN. Poplar Forest Survey.
did.physdesc: ADS. 2 items. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Notes on the land lines of Poplar Forest. Survey of roads from Campbell Court House to Poplar Forest. [1499, N-267]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Partly printed: Cabell 85-87.

scopecontent.p: Subscriptions to Central College from [Henry St. George?] Tucker and John Coalter. Plan for primary schools throughout the state. Opposition to Central College from Federalists, bigots, members of the Society of Cincinnati, and from friends of Washington College at Lexington. William and Mary people are liberal. References to Judge Brooke, John W. Green, Armistead Holmes, Chapman Johnson, and Edward Watts. [1500]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Accepts professorship of chemistry, mineralogy, philosophy, and law beginning following summer. Trustees of University of Pennsylvania rejected proposals to share John R. Coxe's students. William and Mary has elected Hare to post offered to Cooper. Adam Seybert, Mr. Cloud, or Zaccaheus Collins will value his mineral collection before shipment. Relative merits of Edinburgh, Oxford, Cambridge, Eton, Westminster, Harrow, and Winchester as sources of faculty. Lauds advice of Sir William Jones on translating foreign languages. Mr. Stack now at Centerville, Md. [1501]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Accepts post at Central College. Confirms his letter of yesterday sent to Poplar Forest. [1502]

did.unittitle: SAMUEL J. HARRISON, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. #7254-b. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: University business

did.unittitle: SAMUEL J. HARRISON, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. RG-1/3/3.811. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: University business

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: John leaves in morning. Purchases, including corn, from Mr. Higginbotham, Mr. Bankhead, and John Flagg. Turkeys, coopers, carpenter. Payment received from Gibson & Jefferson. Apologizes for questioning T. J.'s judgment on interest due. Canal work. [2933]

did.unittitle: MATTHEW BROWN, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Estimate for making and laying bricks at Central College. Mentions Samuel J . Harrison. [1503]

did.unittitle: PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Flour sold to Robert K. Jones. [2935]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to ROBERT G. SCOTT, Chairman of the Committee of Schools and Colleges.
did.physdesc: ALS. Draft. 5 pp. Endorsed by T. J. [Copy sent to T. J.]. #2791-a. Enclosed in [1511]. Printed: Cabell 94-96.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson's ideas regarding the bill providing for the establishment of primary schools, academies, colleges, and a university. Discussion of whether education should be compulsory. [1504]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JAMES MONROE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Forwards for his approval copy of report of Visitors of Central College to Governor of Virginia. Plan for a general scheme of education, ward schools, colleges, one university. Urges conciliation of Charles Fenton Mercer, author of rival plan. [1505]

did.unittitle: JAMES LIGON for PATRICK GIBSON, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Goods from Norfolk by Mr. Gilmore. [2936]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH ANTRIM. PLASTERER'S BID.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Proposal for plastering at Central College. [1506]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 87-88; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Subscriptions and donations to Central College. Report of the Visitors to the Governor. General education bill for Virginia. Thomas Cooper has accepted position at Central College. [1507]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 88-89; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: High wages of bricklayers in Lynchburg. Asks Richmond prices. Reply must be immediate so he can answer Matthew Brown of Lynchburg. [1508]

did.unittitle: MATTHEW BROWN, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Brickwork at Central College. Mentions David Knight. [1509]

did.unittitle: FRANK CARR to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Returns letters of Messrs. [James C.?] Picket[t] and Albert Gallatin. Reference to [Richard?] Terrell. [1510]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Brothers urge move to Missouri. Asks salary increase. Compares own to overseers of James Monroe, Tufton, Mr. Higginbotham, Mr. Burnley. [2937]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL. Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 6 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791-a. Printed: Cabell 89-94.

scopecontent.p: Opposition by members of the Society of Cincinnati to Central College, preferring to give funds to Washington College. Presbyterians oppose because T. J. is an infidel. Opposition in the Assembly to setting up a system of public education in Virginia. Encloses copy of letter sent to Robert Scott, Chairman of Committee for Schools and Colleges [1504]. Site for the University. Report on the Literary Fund. References to Francis T. Brooke, William Cabell, John Coalter, Thomas Cooper, Mr. Garrett, Chapman Johnson, Wilson C. Nicholas, [Alfred H.?] Powell, Spencer Roane, Henry Tucker, and Edward Watts. [1511]

did.unittitle: JOHN BARNES, Georgetown, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Death of General Kosciuszko. [1512]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [JAMES MADISON].
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #201. Printed: B of R VI 310 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Report of the Visitors of Central College to the Governor. Subscriptions. Delays writing to Edinburgh until the legislature acts. Recommends Dr. Cooper's appointment to the chairs of physiology and law, but suspension of those functions at first and allowing him to teach languages. [1513]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 98-99; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Requests information regarding lands of Mr. Poinsot des Essarts. Report [regarding Central College] sent to Mr. Madison. [1514]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to DAVID HIGGINBOTHAM.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Short's reconveyance of Indian Camp lands to Higginbotham. [2938]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS ON CENTRAL COLLEGE.

scopecontent.p: Contracts for brickwork. Mentions Matthew Brown, Clifton Harris. [1515]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON EARLY STUDY FOR PAVILION VII, UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: Ink. Paper BD 21 x 13 1/2 in. Scale: 10' = 1". #171.

scopecontent.p: This is an early study for Pavilion VII, the first building erected. It shows an elevation of the pavilion with adjacent dormitories and Chinese railings, and plans of the first and second floors. On back is an early study of the Lawn showing nine identical paviliions; the specifications begin: "The walls of the Pavilion are 116 feet running measure." See N-23. [N-309, K-5, verso is Kb]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON STUDIES FOR PAVILIONS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: Pencil and wash. Wove paper, no watermark. 7 1/2 x 9 1/2 in. #171.

scopecontent.p: Drawn by Dr. William Thornton. [N-303, N-352; K-212, K-Pl. 16]

scopecontent.p: Drawn by Dr. William Thornton. Edmund S. Campbell thought this might be the source of the design for Old Sweet Springs, Berkeley, West Virginia. [N-310, K-6]

did.physdesc: Paper CX. 6 x 9 3/4 in. #5533.
