did.unittitle: MINUTES of the TRUSTEES OF ALBEMARLE ACADEMY 1814-1817, the BOARD OF VISITORS of CENTRAL COLLEGE 1817-1819, and the BOARD OF VISITORS of the UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA 1819-1825, OCTOBER 7.
did.physdesc: AD. MS. Vol. 68 pp. #38-163-a.

scopecontent.p: Copies of the minutes belonging to James Breckinridge. Some of the notes date from 1814, with the minutes of the Trustees of Albemarle Academy. (See "Bibliography of Unprinted Official Records" in sixth Annual Report of the Archivist, Univ. of Va., 1935-36). [1517-c]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, MINUTES of the BOARD OF VISITORS of CENTRAL COLLEGE and the UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: ADS. MS. Vol. 208 pp. (105 pp. in T. J.'s hand (including 11 pp. in other hands signed by T. J.)). Printed: L & B XIX 361-499. RG-1/1/1.381.

scopecontent.p: Official minutes of the University of Virginia Board of Visitors, kept by T. J. as Rector from 1817-1826. The earlier notes are signed by T. J. and other members of the Board, Joseph C. Cabell, John Hartwell Cocke, James Madison, James Monroe, and David Watson. Members of the Board in later years who did not sign: James Breckenridge, Chapman Johnson, George Loyall, and Robert B. Taylor. The University of Virginia also owns preliminary notes made by T. J. for later copying (35 pp.), as well as the copies of the minutes belonging to Joseph C. Cabell, John Hartwell Cocke, James Monroe, and James Breckenridge. Some of the notes date from 1814, with the minutes of the Trustees of Albemarle Academy. The minutes after the spring meeting of 1826 (pp. 107-185) in this volume are in the hand of the Secretary of the Board, Nicholas P. Trist. (See Bibliography of Unprinted Official Records in sixth Annual Report of the Archivist, University of Virginia, 1935-36). [1517]

did.unittitle: MINUTES of the TRUSTEES OF ALBEMARLE ACADEMY 1814-1817, the BOARD OF VISITORS of CENTRAL COLLEGE 1817-1819, and the BOARD OF VISITORS of the UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA 1819-1826.
did.physdesc: AD. MS. Vol. 65 pp., 6 pp., 2 pp. #2791-a.

scopecontent.p: Copies of the minutes belonging to Joseph Carrington Cabell. Some of the notes date from 1814, with the minutes of the Trustees of Albemarle Academy. The notes for 1826 March 4 and 5 (2 pp.) have interlineations in T. J.'s hand. (See "Bibliography of Unprinted Official Records" in sixth Annual Report of the Archivist, Univ. of Va., 1935-36). [1517-a]

did.unittitle: MINUTES of the TRUSTEES OF ALBEMARLE ACADEMY 1814-1817, the BOARD OF VISITORS of CENTRAL COLLEGE 1817-1819, and the BOARD OF VISITORS of the UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA 1819-1826.

scopecontent.p: Copies of the minutes belonging to John Hartwell Cocke. Some of the notes date from 1814, with the minutes of the Trustees of Albemarle Academy. (See "Bibliography of Unprinted Official Records" in sixth Annual Report of the Archivist, Univ. of Va., 1935-36). [1517-b]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, NOTES AND SPECIFICATIONS.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 vol. #38-163. Partly printed: Lambeth plates VI, VII, XIII.

scopecontent.p: Pocket memorandum book containing specifications, ink drawings, and other data used and compiled by T. J. while directing the construction of the University of Virginia (Central College until 1819). Description of proposed buildings, style of architecture, measurements, materials to be used, and the amount of brick or stone required. Specification book dated on cover July 18, 1819. [1518, N-317, N-318]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, SURVEY OF UNIVERSITY SITE SHOWING ROTUNDA, "EAST STREET," AND "WEST STREET".
did.physdesc: Ink. Scale: 20 poles = 1". Paper CW. AD. 1 pp. 8" x 6 1/4"." See Nichols, N-327. #171.

scopecontent.p: In folder with other fragments: financial figures (N-327.1), one 3" x 5 3/4", giving dimensions for "Perry's Houses" (N-327.2), cost per acres (N-327.3), forms (N-327.4), the Rotunda in relation to the road (N-327.5), and a plat of land with area (N-327.6). [1516, 2938-a, N-327]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES MADISON, DAVID WATSON, and JOHN HARTWELL COCKE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Enclosure: AD. 2 pp. Cocke Papers, #3184.

scopecontent.p: Encloses copy of report of the Board of Visitors to the governor. Requests their approval of Thomas Cooper's appointment to physiological professorship, with an ad interim appointment to the classical school. Bricklayers' terms. Subscriptions. Enclosure: estimate of the objects of application of Central College funds. [1519]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to BOARD OF VISITORS of CENTRAL COLLEGE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. #7254-b.

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Enclosure: C. Tompkins, ALS. 2 pp. Partly printed: Cabell 99-101.

scopecontent.p: Encloses letter from Major Christopher Tompkins regarding the price of bricklaying for Central College. Essay in the Enquirer by Mr. Giles. Prospects not good for the general education bill. Receipt of the papers of Poinsot des Essarts. Information regarding subscriptions to Central College from William Brent, Mr. Currie, and Creed Taylor. References to Wilson C. Nicholas, James P. Preston, Mr. Brown (bricklayer), and Mr. Night (bricklayer). [1520]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [JAMES P. PRESTON].
did.physdesc: AD. 7 pp. Endorsed: "James Monroe." RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Report to the governor of Virginia, concerning the progress and prospects of Central College. Financial report. Copy sent to James Monroe for his approval. [1521]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Pleased by Cooper's acceptance of physiological professorship. Cooper to open classical school in July. Plan to establish additional professorships when funds permit. [1522]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ROBERT WALSH, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #201. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Enjoyed John Playfair's presentation of mathematical history; asks him to print unedited Destutt de Tracy manuscript, Principes logiques, in the American Register.Dr. Cooper's acceptance of Central College post. Invitation to visit Monticello with Correa da Serra. [1523]

did.unittitle: J. HORWITZ, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: printed leaflet. 4 pp. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Application for professorship of oriental literature, German, and Hebrew. Enclosure: prospectus for the first American edition of Van der Hooght's Hebrew Bible. [1524]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 5 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Partly printed: Ford IX 98-101; Cabell 102-106. #38-755.

scopecontent.p: Financing a general education system for Virginia. [1525]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to MATTHEW BROWN.
THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 107.

scopecontent.p: Financial aid for Central College from the legislature. [1526]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, Winchester, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Central College subscriptions. [1527]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Enclosure: Creed Taylor ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by Cabell. Partly printed: Cabell 108-110.

scopecontent.p: Search regarding land will be carried out for T. J. in the Register's Office. Copy of the Report of the Visitors circulated in the Assembly. Copy of T. J.'s letters regarding primary schools given to Robert Scott, Chairman of the Committee on Schools and Colleges. Motion to move the capital. Opposition to Central College by the Washington College people. Recommends that William Brent, John T. Brooke, John Hartwell Cocke, and George Poindexter run for the Assembly. Bank loan being negotiated. Recommends annuity from the Literary Fund as best income for Central College. Encloses note from Chancellor Creed Taylor regarding T. J.'s proposed system of public education. References to Jesse W. Garth, James Madison, Robert Mallory, Dabney Minor, and James Monroe. [1528]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 111.

scopecontent.p: Disappointment in the bill reported by the Committee of Schools and Colleges. Visitors will be personally responsible for a bank loan to Central College. Movement of seat of government from Richmond to the West postponed. [1529]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Death of Caspar Wistar may change situation at University of Pennsylvania, since Dr. John R. Coxe wishes to take materia medica chair. [1530]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to JOHN BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. [Copy sent by Cabell to T. J.] Printed: Cabell 114-115.

scopecontent.p: To the President of the Bank of Virginia, covering reports by the Visitors of Central College, given to enable the bank to judge the merits of a loan sought in anticipation of subscriptions. [1531]

did.unittitle: JOHN BROCKENBROUGH, Richmond, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #2791. Printed: Cabell 115-116.

scopecontent.p: Agreeing to lend money to Central College for 60 days with renewal of notes possible. [1532] Originally enclosed in [1534]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 112-113.

scopecontent.p: Fears failure of general education bill for Virginia. Requests T. J. to draw bill for annuity from Literary Fund for endowment of professorships. Inquires with regard to Des Essarts' land patents. References to Robert Scott, Samuel Taylor, and [George J.] Davison. [1533]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 113-114.

scopecontent.p: Loan offered by John Brockenbrough, President of the Bank of Virginia, better than can be obtained from Benjamin Hatcher of the Farmer's Bank. Necessity for the Visitors to sign the notes as individuals. References to Wilson C. Nicholas and David Watson. [1534]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 1 16-1 18.

scopecontent.p: Inquiries regarding Poinsot des Essarts' land patents. Back-country opposition to T. J.'s general education bill. Opposition to Central College from friends of Lexington and Staunton. Recommends selection of men such as General [John George] Jackson in the Northwest of Virginia and William Burwell from the Southwest. References to Mr. Johnson, General Kosciuszko, and Peter Carr. [1535]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Laments death of Dr. Caspar Wistar. Engagement with Central College will not prevent Cooper's accepting better position at Pennsylvania caused by vacancy. [1536]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 119-121.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s letter published in the Enquirer to help the general education bill, omitting T. J.'s estimate of the large amount of money necessary. Reference to William Cabell, Wilson C. Nicholas, and Lewis Somers (i.e., Summers). [1537]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD THWEATT, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Interest of the Wayles estate in Byrd's Lottery. [1538]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 121-122.

scopecontent.p: Introducing Lewis Summers of Kanawha County. [1539]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 122123.

scopecontent.p: Enquiries regarding Poinsot des Essarts' land. Failure of T. J.'s general education bill, with only a small appropriation for education of the poor, due to interests from Lexington and Staunton and to the Presbyterians, aided by a junto from the middle country delegation (Charles Yancey, Thomas Miller, Robert Mallory, and Charles Everett). Possibility of an appropriation for Central College. References to Francis T. Brooke, Dabney Carr, John W. Green, Thomas Hill, and Chapman Johnson. [1540]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 124-125; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Regrets his "intermedling" in the education bill. Subscriptions for Central College. Requests all of Board of Visitors to visit him whenever near Monticello to help make decisions between formal meetings. [1541]

did.unittitle: RANDOLPH HARRISON, Clifton, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Central College subscriptions. Mentions Mr. Baker, Thomas Jefferson Randolph, and George Skipwith. [1542]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD THWEATT, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Inability to collect any subscriptions or to subscribe himself to the Central College fund. [1543]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 125-126.

scopecontent.p: Bill providing for education of poor, an appropriation for the University, and the setting up of the Rockfish Gap Commission passed the Senate. [1544]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Expects an opening at University of Pennsylvania. Appreciative of Central College's liberal conduct. Medical faculty has recommended Augustine Smith of Williamsburg for Wistar's post. Plans to come to Virginia with Correa da Serra. [1545]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 127.

scopecontent.p: Passage of the Rockfish Gap Bill. Asks T. J. to serve as a commissioner. Appointments in the hands of the president and directors of the Literary Fund, three fifths of whom are from beyond the mountains. Urges immediate work on buildings of Central College because of opposition from Federalists, Presbyterian clergy, and the entire back country. Mentions James Madison. [1546]

did.unittitle: JAMES PLEASANTS, JR., Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Subscriptions to Central College. [1547]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 128-129; B of R VI 59 (MS in DLC).

scopecontent.p: James Madison will serve on Rockfish Gap Commission. Thinks it better for Cabell to serve rather than himself. [1548]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Fluvanna County, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 129.

scopecontent.p: Selection of members of the Rockfish Gap Commission. Visit to Monticello. [1550]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.

scopecontent.p: Recommends Francis Eppes II be sent to Mr. Dasheel (Dashiell?) in New London, Va., until Central College opens. Birth of a sixth grandson. Patsy doing well. Plans for meeting Francis. [1551]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 130-132.

scopecontent.p: Rivalry between Washington College, Rockbridge College, and Central College as to the site for the University. Offer by a Mr. Robinson of Lexington to leave his estate to the University if located there. Requests T. J. to urge Wilson J. Cary, John Hartwell Cocke, Randolph Harrison, and Washington Trueheart to serve in House of Delegates as friends of Central College. References to John Wayles Eppes. [1552]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN ARMSTRONG.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. #726. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in Polish Roman Catholic University (Kosciuszko Papers).

scopecontent.p: Requests information for a biography of Tadeusz Kosciuszko to be written by Mr. Gullien. Administration of General Kosciuszko's estate. [1553]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN ARMSTRONG.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat, #2283. Original owned by Polish Roman Catholic Union of America.

scopecontent.p: Requests information for a biography of Tadeusz Kosciuszko to be written by Mr. Gullien. Administration of General Kosciuszko's estate.

did.unittitle: ANNE CARY BANKHEAD to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Covers Mr. Lightfoot's letter requesting a favor of T. J. [1554]

did.unittitle: FRANK CARR, Bentivar, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Returning a letter to T. J. Mentions a letter to [Richard?] Terrell. [1555]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, at Mrs. Tinsley's, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 132.

scopecontent.p: Lending Jefferson a copy of the Oxford and Cambridge guide. [1556]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON BILL TO JOHN BROWN, JUDGE OF CHANCERY AT STAUNTON, AGAINST RIVANNA COMPANY.
did.physdesc: D. 65 pp. In clerk's hand. #4899.

scopecontent.p: Previous inquests established that T. J.'s dam above Shadwell mill not harmful, or infringement of public rights. An aid to navigation, already did most of Rivanna Company's work by getting through South West mountains. Company built locks above mill, interfering with its water supply, and placed toll house near mill. Directors profiting at T. J.'s expense. Mentions Albemarle Co., Milton, Moore's ford, Secretary's ford, Sandy Falls, Potomac River, James River, Rappahannock River, Peter Jefferson, Thomas Mann Randolph, Peter Minor, John Brown, and directors George Divers, William D. Meriwether, Nimrod Bramham, Dabney Minor, and John Kelly. Appended letter, copy 1817 July 23, George Divers, Farmington, to T. J. claiming overriding rights of canal company. Appended document, copy, 1817 August 7, T. J. approves insertion of above letter. Appended document, copy, 1818 April 7, Rivanna Company claims precedence. T. J. cannot include Rivanna River as his property. Mentions Ray's ford, Stuart & Coalter, Richard Sampson, Richard Farrar and Mr. Henderson. Copies certified by N. H. Lewis and William S. Eskridge. [2939]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-588. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Davis, Francis Walker Gilmer 125; B of R X 7 (MS. in DLC) .

scopecontent.p: Urges him to try for the legislature rather than the cul-de-sac, William and Mary College. Visit of Correa da Serra and Thomas Cooper. [1557]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to SUBSCRIBERS TO CENTRAL COLLEGE.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. File draft, #7254-b.On verso, Indenture, Subscribers to Central College to the Literary Fund Director. 1 pp. File draft, #7254-b.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to JOHN WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Francis E. Shine. #3509.

scopecontent.p: Letter at Flood's. To Monticello. Mr. Dashiell will board Francis. Greek of Xenophon's Cyropaedia preferable to Lucian. Mr. Yancey can get books at Cotton's in Lynchburg. Bezout and Euclid. Francis to sleep alone to avoid itch common at Dr. Carr's school. Subscription papers for Central College. Literary Fund and University. [2940]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Photostat. #10130.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson orders "2 canteens of best spirits."

did.unittitle: BENNETT H. HENDERSON, Glasgow, Barren County, Ky., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #564. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library.

scopecontent.p: Requests private settlement of his share of Bennett Henderson estate, which his brother James L. Henderson deeded to Craven Peyton while Bennett H. Henderson was a minor. William D. Meriwether has full power of attorney. [1557a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to BERNARD PEYTON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft, #38-174.. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: Requests procuring of a workman, Mr. Jones, to examine slate quarries and to work at Central College. [1558]

did.unittitle: FRANK CARR, Bentivar, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Covering a letter for [Richard?] Terrell. [1559]

did.unittitle: JOHN M. PERRY, Central College, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Requesting instructions for bricklayers. [1560]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Choice for chemistry chair to he made soon at University of Pennsylvania. Sends syllabus of lectures. [1561]

did.unittitle: JOSHUA M. STOKES, Petersburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Applies for work as painter, glazier at University. [1562]

did.unittitle: D. HICKEY. BID for PLASTERING and STONEWORK.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Rates to be charged on Mr. A. S. Brockenbrough's "new houses" (Central College buildings). [1563]

did.unittitle: SAMUEL J. HARRISON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. On verso: letter to Dr. J. Wharton, Jr., 1819 July 29, [1722]. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Excuses for not being able to dine with T. J. [1564]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Land in West. Mentions Mr. Randolph. [2941]

did.unittitle: FRANK CARR, [Bentivar], to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Enclosing a letter to [Richard?] Terrell. [1565]

did.unittitle: NELSON BARKSDALE, PROCTOR OF CENTRAL COLLEGE, DEED TO PRESIDENT AND DIRECTORS OF LITERARY FUND.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. File draft, RG-1/3/3.821. In hand of T. J.

scopecontent.p: Transfers Central College lands and properties in Albemarle County to Literary Fund for benefit of University of Virginia as permitted by act of Legislature.

did.unittitle: NELSON BARKSDALE, PROCTOR OF CENTRAL COLLEGE, DEED TO PRESIDENT AND DIRECTORS OF LITERARY FUND.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. In hand of T. J. Signed by Barksdale. #6269.

scopecontent.p: Transfers Central College lands and properties in Albemarle County to Literary Fund for benefit of University of Virginia as permitted by act of Legislature. Witnessed by Frank Carr, James Leitch, James Brown, and Alexander Garrett, Clerk of Albemarle County Court. [2942]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Plows. No payment from Mr. Randolph. Payment from Mr. Dawson. [2943]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 132-133.

scopecontent.p: Sends by his brother William the signatures of Central College subscribers in Nelson County, agreeing to the conveyance of the property of Central College to the Commonwealth of Virginia, if the University of Virginia is located on the site of the college. [1566]

did.unittitle: ROCKFISH GAP COMMISSION, REPORT ON OFFER OF WASHINGTON COLLEGE LANDS FO UNIVERSITY.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. #7254-b. With notes in T. J.'s hand.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON REPORT of the ROCKFISH GAP COMMISSION.
did.physdesc: AD. 51 pp. on 32 l., including interleavings. RG-1/3/3.761. Printed with variations: Cabell 432-447; Report of the Commissioners for the University of Virginia, assembled at Rock-Fish Gap . . . 1818.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s preliminary draft of the Rockfish Gap Report. Importance of education to the general welfare. Curriculum for the University. Calculation of center of population to prove that Central College is the proper site for the University. [1567]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [ROCKFISH GAP COMMISSION?].

scopecontent.p: Undated formal expression of leave-taking, thanking them for acknowledging his feeble services and for the spirit of order and harmony of the board. [1568]

did.unittitle: JOHN STEELE, Customs House, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Wine sent to Richmond. Sends bill of lading. [2944]

did.unittitle: N. TURNER, C. TOMPKINS, B. TATE, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Recommendations for William Phillips, bricklayer. [1569]

did.unittitle: J. HORWITZ, Philadelphia, to THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Requests him to remind Mr. Jefferson that if college at Charlottesville is to have same standing as Harvard, Yale, Princeton, it will need professor of oriental literature. [1570]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Observations regarding Central College post. Assuming he is to hold chairs of experimental philosophy, chemistry, mineralogy, and law, asks questions regarding: apparatus, defraying expense of experiments, private tutoring, living quarters for family, vacation, salary, cost of moving. [1571]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Answers Cooper's questions of 3 October, under the assumption that Central College is chosen as the University of Virginia. [1572]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Fredericksburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Salary offered at Central College unsatisfactory. Injustice done T. J. by George Ord in his life of Alexander Wilson in Wilson's Ornithology. Mentions Correa da Serra. [1573]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mill Brook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Pleasure at T. J.'s return to health. Plans for Francis Eppes' education. Payment of his subscription to the Central College fund. References to Mr. Dashiell, a teacher, and to Mr. Baker. [1574]

did.unittitle: MARTIN DAWSON, Milton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: T. J. note to Edmund Bacon. [2945]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Edgewood, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 133-134.

scopecontent.p: Invitation to Warminster; urges him not to tax his health. [1575]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HENRY DEARBORN, Boston.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat, #2873. Original owned by Harold J. Coolidge.

scopecontent.p: Libelous statements in Ord's preface to Wilson's Ornithology, regarding T. J.'s refusal to send Wilson on Pike's expedition. Requests inquiry by Dearborn as to why Stuart has detained T. J.'s portrait. Mentions explorations by Lewis and Clark, William Dunbar, and Thomas Freeman. Mentions James Wilkinson. [1576]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. Fragment. #10347.

scopecontent.p: Madison reports he is glad to learn from James Monroe that Jefferson is recovering from an attack "your health suffered beyond the mountains" and regrets that he is unable to attend meetings of the Board of Visitors or the Albemarle Agricultural Society.

did.unittitle: JOHN M. PERRY. DEED to NELSON BARKSDALE, PROCTOR of CENTRAL COLLEGE.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. #2737-a. Endorsed by T. J. Witnessed by Alexander Garrett.

scopecontent.p: Deed for land in Albemarle County, near Charlottesville, for Central College. Approved by T. J. [1577]

did.unittitle: JAMES DINSMORE to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Report on the qualities of tin roofing at Central College. [1578]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Enniscorthy, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 134-135.

scopecontent.p: Illness prevents visit to Monticello. Rockfish Gap Report. Reason why he cannot make the trip to Europe for the college. Possibility he may run for the House of Representatives. Information regarding the hill for locating the University. Mentions [Samuel] Carr, Isaac Coles, William F. Gordon, Spencer Roane, Francis T. Brooke. [1579]

did.unittitle: JAMES DINSMORE to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: Cost of pine shingling calculated by Dinsmore and John M. Perry. [1580]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #201. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Cabell 136; B of R VI 59 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Letter to the Speaker of the Senate containing Rockfish Gap Report. Necessity for special agent to secure in Europe professors for Central College. [1581]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to the MARQUIS DE LAFAYETTE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat, #2285. Original owned by Mrs. Laird U. Park. Printed: L & B XIX 268-270; Ford-Bixby 243-244; B of R VI 255 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s ill health. Approval of the present French Constitution. Discounts reports of aggression in Florida. Prospects for Mr. Poirey's claims for compensation for services during the Revolution. Copy of translation of Destutt de Tracy's work on political economy. [1582]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 137-138.

scopecontent.p: Progress of the Rockfish Gap Report in the General Assembly. Attitudes of the William and Mary and Lexington interests. Cabell's health. References to Samuel Carr, William F. Gordon, Samuel Taylor, and Philip R. Thompson. [1583]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 138-139.

scopecontent.p: Progress of the bill to decide the site of the University. Prospects of Central College. Report of T. J.'s authorship of the bill gives appearance of dictation. References to Linn Banks, Samuel Taylor, and Robert T. Thompson. [1584]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 139-140.

scopecontent.p: Central College fixed as the site of the University in the bill reported to the House of Delegates. Combination of western delegates opposed to Central College. Publication of T. J.'s calculation of the center of population based on census of 1810. References to Wilson C. Nicholas and William Cabell. [1585]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 141.

scopecontent.p: Senator Davidson [Davison?] of Clarksburg in favor of Central College. [1586]

did.unittitle: DABNEY COSBY, Staunton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Offers services as bricklayer, brickmaker to college. [1587]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 141-144.

scopecontent.p: Delay of the University bill. Opposition from friends of William and Marv, who demand $5000 per annum for William and Mary as price of their concurrence, from those who wish education left to individual enterprise, and from those who wish Literary Fund devoted to the poor. Various methods of calculating the center of population. References to the Edinburgh Review, William S. Archer, James Hunter, Chapman Johnson, Francis Preston, Adam Smith, Dugald Stewart, and Colonel Tatham. [1588]

did.unittitle: BEDFORD COUNTY SHERIFF. Bill for POPLAR FOREST TAXES.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-755.

scopecontent.p: Bill for taxes on 4000 acres of land, 53 slaves, and 16 horses. Paid by Joel Yancey, T. J.'s overseer; receipted by Joseph D. Stratton, Deputy to Joel Leftwich, Sheriff. [1589]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON "PAVILION NO. III W. CORINTHIAN PALLADIO."
did.physdesc: Scale: 10' = 1". Paper BD. 12 x 11 1/2 in. #171.

scopecontent.p: Elevation and three plans, one with alternate flap. Specifications on back. On September 30, 1821, Jefferson wrote to John Hartwell Cocke that "Pavilions Number 3 and 7 undertaken in 1817 and 1818, Numbers 2,4,5,9 finished. 17 marble caps from Italy No. 2,3,5,8. No. 1,6,8,10 not finished." [N-316, K-15]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. "PLAN OF A CLOCK FOR THE ROTUNDA."
did.physdesc: Ink. Wove paper, watermarked FELLOWS. 10 x 8 in. #171.

scopecontent.p: The University of Virginia Library also has a copy made by N. P. Trist, September 27, 1827 (Ink. Paper CW. 7 3/4 x 10 in.). [N-371]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON NOTES ON MADISON'S MAP.
did.physdesc: AD. Fragment. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #3620.

scopecontent.p: Mentions Monticello, Potomac River, Willis's Mountain, and Blue Ridge Mountains. [2946]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON A BILL FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN UNIVERSITY.
did.physdesc: AD. 4 pp. Printed (with additions): Cabell 447-450; Enactments relating to . . . the University of Virginia, 1831. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Bill to make Central College the University of Virginia. Board of Visitors to erect, preserve, and repair buildings, appoint faculty and staff, prescribe the course of education, and establish rules of government and discipline. [1590]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON TO THOMAS JEFFERSON.

scopecontent.p: Madison has postponed returning two documents because he knew T. J. would not return from Bedford "till about a week before the day of assembling at Rockfish." Presumably in reference to the Commission to Fix the Site of the University of Virginia, a.k.a. the Rockfish Gap Commission.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, ESTIMATE OF EXPENSES FOR UNIVERSITY.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to [THOMAS] COOPER.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RICHARD DUKE, near Lindsay's Store.

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed by Cabell 155-159, misdated as of 4 December.

scopecontent.p: Advises against moving now for the derelict portion of the School Fund. Copy of reports on the navigation of the James and on connection of eastern and western waters. Sketch of services rendered by the following friends of the University: William Brockenbrough, William H. Brodnax, Francis T. Brooke, Samuel Carr, John Coalter, [Francis W.?] Gilmer (author of essays signed "a Virginian"), John W. Green, George Hay, Armistead Holmes, Garrett Minor, Wilson C. Nicholas, George Nicholson, Mr. Pannel, the Rev. Mr. Rice (author of essay signed "Crito"), Mr. Ritchie, Judge Spencer Roane, James Robertson, JF., Mr. Scott, Captain Slaughter, Mr. Stannard, John Taliaferro, Chancellor [Creed] Taylor, Philip Thompson. Mentions also William S. Archer, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and James Madison. (Thirteen lines made illegible, probably prior to publication of N. F. Cabell's book). [1610]

did.unittitle: JOHN BROWN, Spring Farm, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: Terms for carpentry work. Objects to scale set in Matthew Carey's price book. [1662]

did.unittitle: THOMAS SMITH, Charlottesville, to NELSON BARKSDALE, University of Virginia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Proposals for painting, glazing. Returning to Fredericksburg until news of proposal announced. [1663]

did.unittitle: ABRAHAM WOGLOME, Philadelphia, to NELSON BARKSDALE, University of Virginia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: In response to advertisement in Philadelphia Democratic Press, submits proposals for brickwork. [1664]

did.unittitle: DANIEL R. CALVERLY, [Richmond], to [THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Submits proposal for painting, glazing. [1665]

did.unittitle: JAMES DINSMORE and JOHN M. PERRY, University of Virginia, to NELSON BARKSDALE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Withdrawing earlier proposals. Will work for terms in Matthew Carey's price book. [1666]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Decision of Visitors to open classical school under usher to be named by Cooper, perhaps Mr. Stack. Will serve as nursery for the University. Need for tinsmith and silversmith in Charlottesville. Plan for the University seal. [1667]

did.unittitle: JOHN NEILSON, Upper Bremo, to BOARD OF VISITORS, University of Virginia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Regrets that he must decline further carpenter's work at present. [1668]

did.unittitle: JAMES OLDHAM, Charlottesville, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Changes terms submitted for work at the University. Possibility that workers may erect cabins on the grounds. Mentions James Dinsmore and John M. Perry. [1669]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ROBERT S. GARNETT.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for recommendations of Don Marcus Escopinachi, Dr. Speed, and of Mr. Bonfils. Except for Dr. Cooper, the University will hire no professors until construction is complete. [1670]

did.unittitle: RICHARD M. BURKE, Richmond, to NELSON BARKSDALE, University of Virginia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Seeking work as carpenter and joiner at the University of Virginia. [1671]

did.unittitle: DANIEL FLOURNOY, Chesterfield County, to [THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Submits proposals for brickwork at University. [1672]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to MR. BOLINGER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Accepts offer to pipe water to University. [1673]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CURTIS CARTER and W. B. PHILIPS, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. 2 copies. One endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Terms for brickwork at the University. [1674]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Stoves for the University. Important letter for Richard Ware, carpenter. Mentions Mr. Leschot of Charlottesville and Bernard Peyton. [1675]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to RICHARD WARE, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Accepts his proposal for carpentry work. Information regarding wages, working conditions, and living quarters for the workers. Matthew Carey's price book. [1676]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Corn buying, some from Mr. Higginbotham. Draft on Richmond for debt. Powder from Mr. Osmond of Milton. T. J. On verso: trigonometric calculations for arcs of two domes or globes. [2951, N-553]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Advertisement for stoves placed in Democratic Press and in Poulson's American Daily Advertiser. Recent illness. Stack will undertake grammar school in Charlottesville. Urges confining choice to Oxford if professors to be sought in Europe. Will try to accept terms of the University. Offers received to edit selection of English common law reporters and an agricultural dictionary. [1677]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to RANDOLPH HARRISON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Acknowledges his zeal in obtaining subscriptions for the University. More funds needed. Requests deposit of subscriptions in the University account in the Bank of Virginia. [1678]

did.unittitle: G. E. STACK to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. RG-1/3/3.811. Endorsed by T. J.

did.unittitle: DAVID COBBS to [T. J. Monticello].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Proposal for piping water. [1679]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of money for stoves from Mr. Leschot. Mr. Stack leaving for Charlottesville. Information about Minerva for the University of Virginia seal. [1680]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 174-176.

scopecontent.p: Recommends A. S. Brockenbrough as Proctor. Despite admiration for T. J.'s plans for the pavilions and lawn, recommends different style for hotels and ranges. Provision for lecture rooms in separate buildings from pavilions. Fire at Monticello. Reference to John Hartwell Cocke. [1681]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Richard Ware will accept Jefferson's terms. Difficulty in procuring brickmakers. Brickmaker Cribbs recommends burning bricks in kilns to improve the quality. Mentions Mr. James, Quaker of Philadelphia. [1682]

did.unittitle: RICHARD WARE, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Letter received through Thomas Cooper. Difficulties in finding brickmaker; brick prices. [1683]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Still unwell. John Vaughan to buy stoves to ship to Bernard Peyton, Richmond. Wing of Monticello destroyed by fire. [1684]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, bill from "WALKER."
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #8937-b.

scopecontent.p: T. J. notes on verso "sent 2. D. by Gill Apr. 22 19."

did.unittitle: CHARLES CLAY, Petty Grove, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Comments on T. J.'s ale. Gift of vegetables. Thanks for directions on "the assignments" (of lands?). [1685]

did.unittitle: CHARLES CLAY, Petty Grove, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Recommends that the deeds be witnessed. (Possibly a reference to deed of trust to Poplar Forest, 15 September 1819). [1686]

did.unittitle: GEORGE BLAETTERMANN, London, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. French. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for professorship of modern languages at the University of Virginia. Mentions Mr. Bevan, James Ogilvie, Mr. Preston, and George Ticknor. [1687]

did.unittitle: CHARLES CLAY, [Petty Grove], to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Asks how the revocation is to be executed and published. [1688]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Cocke Papers. Printed: B of R VI 89 (MS. in DLC). #3184.

scopecontent.p: Requests aid a second time in stocking his fish pond. Suggests Cocke's son attend Mr. Stack's classical school in Charlottesville with Mr. Laporte as boarding housekeeper. Arrival of Arthur Spicer Brockenbrough. Tadeusz Kosciuszko's will to be proven. [1689]

did.unittitle: JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Detailed recommendations for changes in University construction plans Suggests diverting money from Tadeusz Kosciuszko's will into American Colonization Society. Mentions information collected by Miles and Burgess on the coast of Africa. [1690]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILSON J. CARY.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Stack, who is recommended by Thomas Cooper, to open classical school at Charlottesville; advises that Wilson Miles Cary be placed there. [1691]

did.unittitle: WILSON J. CARY, Carysbrook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 p. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Requests enrollment of Wilson Miles Cary in Mr. Stack's classical school. Wishes him to board with [P.] Laporte to learn French. Mentions John Hartwell Cocke. [1692]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ACTION REGARDING TADEUSZ KOSCIUSZKO'S WILL.
did.physdesc: ADS. 2 pp. In the hand of William Wertenbaker. #5145.

scopecontent.p: Wertenbaker's later reminiscence of T. J.'s refusal to execute Kosciuszko's will (q.v. 1798 May 5.) [1693]

did.unittitle: WILSON CARY NICHOLAS PROMISSORY NOTE to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2343.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILSON CARY NICHOLAS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #770.

scopecontent.p: T. J. thanks Nicholas for his "kind aid in my little money embarrassments and avails himself of Nicholas' offer of endorsement of note to the Farmer's Bank. Thomas Jefferson Randolph moving to Tufton. [1694]

did.unittitle: JOHN WAYLES EPPES, Mill Brook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Sending whin seed. Routes from Bedford to Monticello via Canton, Va., and Scot's Ferry. Pleasure at renewed intercourse with T. J. [1695]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Printed: B of R VI 51 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Recommends substitution of Curtis Carter as a brick worker for Richard Ware, who has been jailed for debt in Philadelphia. Dr. Cooper to send housejoiners from Philadelphia. Pavilions and dormitories on East Lawn to be substituted for work on West Lawn. [1696]

did.unittitle: WILSON J. CARY, Carysbrook, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Sends Wilson Miles Cary to grammar school in Charlottesville. Payment of Board delayed until tobacco sold in Richmond. [1697]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to VICTOR ADOLPHUS SASSERNO, U.S. CONSUL, Nice, France.

scopecontent.p: Bellet wine. Nice wines. Mentions M. Spreafico. English terms for wines: Frontignan and Lunel of France, Pacharetti doux of Spain, Calcavalla of Portugal, Vin du Cap, Vin de Grave, Vin du Rhin, Vin de Hockheim, Madere sec, Pacharetti sec, vin d'Oporto, silky Madeira, and malmsey. Recent Marseilles wine acid. Desires former kinds shipped immediately care of Mr. Cathalan before December winds drive ship off course to West Indies. [2952]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to VICTOR ADOLPHUS SASSERNO, U.S. CONSUL, Nice, France.
did.physdesc: L. 3 pp. 19th century French translation in unidentified hand. #6157.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Arrival of Richard Ware. Superior bricklayers available at Philadelphia. [1698]

did.unittitle: MARTIN DAWSON, Milton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s suit against Rivanna Company. Mentions Daniel Colclaser, Ambrose Flannagan, William Bacon, Thomas D. Boyd, Joseph Gilmore, William F. Cardin, William D. Fitch, Thomas E. Randolph, William Johnson, and Edmund Bacon. [2954]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Trip to the West. [2955]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to NICHOLAS H. LEWIS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat, #5385-af.

scopecontent.p: Notice of taking of depositions in a suit between T. J. and the Directors of the Rivanna Company.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: T. J.'s plans for pavilions. Contract for laborers. Trip to Bedford. Advantages of Philadelphia laborers. [1699]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Financial transactions with Mr. Pollock, Mr. Craven, Mr. Maupin, and Bishop. [2956]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CHARLES F. KUPFER, Boston.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #38-174.

scopecontent.p: Window glass for the University. Mentions Smith and Riddle, agents in Richmond, and Bernard Peyton. [1700]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARCHIBALD S. BULLOCH, Savannah, Ga.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #1143. Printed: B of R VI 55 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Pleased that Bulloch has named his son for him. [1701]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-174.

scopecontent.p: John Vaughan to ship stoves for University. Seal for University drawn by Thomas Sully, but Mr. Rasch's price for engraving too high. Bass Otis' portrait of T. J. excellent. Mineral collection and botanical garden for the University. Correa da Serra recommends Thomas Nuttal as botanist. Three editorial offers no longer available: edition of English reporters given to [Charles Jared] Ingersoll; agricultural dictionary and edition of Virginia law reporters given up. Opinion on effect of paper swindling. Two papers in next Analectic Magazine, on the present movement among the manufacturers and on lithography. [1702]

did.unittitle: JAMES OLDHAM to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-174.

scopecontent.p: Sends draft of window frames. Asks instructions on cornice, ceiling of portico, and columns of pavilion. Asks to borrow Jefferson's Palladio. [1703]

did.unittitle: JOHN ADAMS, Quincey, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. 19th century copy. #2723-m. Printed: Adams, Charles Francis, Works of John Adams X, 380-81.

scopecontent.p: Mecklenburg Declaration of Independence cited from Essex Register and Raleigh Register. If had known about this at the time, would have spread in, Whig newspapers and halls of Congress until T. J.'s Declaration of Independence. Better than Thomas Paine's Common Sense. Richard Caswell, William Hooper, and Joseph Hewes, Congressmen from North Carolina. [2957]

did.unittitle: DABNEY S. CARR, Baltimore, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Carr-Cary Papers, #1231.

scopecontent.p: Arrival of Italian sculptors, Michael and Giacomo Raggi; plan for their trip to the University. Mentions John Hollins, Thomas Appleton, Robert Patton, and Garrett Minor. [1704]

did.unittitle: THOMAS ESTON RANDOLPH, Ashton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Delay in payment of rent due for the mill. [1705]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Disagreement with workmen, John M. Perry, Whateley, Curtis Carter, and William Phillips. Advises use of Philadelphia workmen who will work for less. Construction details. [1706]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS W. GILMER.
did.physdesc: AL[S clipped]. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Cannot give information on the 1776 revision of Virginia laws. Visit of Correa da Serra. Proposed trip to Bedford County. Mentions George Wythe. [1707]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Dormitories and cellars for the workmen at the University promised by Perry. [1708]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Account with T. J. [2958]

did.unittitle: JOHN HOLLINS. BILL to B. WILLIAMSON.

scopecontent.p: Account for expenses incurred by the Raggi brothers. [1709]

did.unittitle: JAMES DINSMORE to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-174. Endorsed by T.

scopecontent.p: Instructions regarding the columns for the University. Mentions Arthur Spicer Brockenbrough. [1710]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Reimbursement to John Hollins of Baltimore for money advanced to cover expenses of the Raggi brothers. Preparations needed for sculptors and brick makers. Mentions Thomas Appleton, Captain Concklin, Alexander Garrett, and Wilson Cary Nicholas. [1711]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM DAVENPORT, Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: Richmond bank note, not U.S. bank note, to pay bill sent through Mr. Patterson. Telescope. [2959]

did.unittitle: J. WHARTON, JR., Stevensburgh, Culpeper County, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for chair of medicine at the University of Virginia. Studied at Edinburgh; is well recommended. [1712]

did.unittitle: JOHN M. PERRY, University of Virginia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Order for balance due for brickwork, including that on Mrs. Garner's house. [1713]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. #38-163. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: B of R VI 89 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Catalog of the best editions of the Greek and Latin classics. Expenses incurred for the Raggi brothers. Work planned for the Raggi brothers. Plans to visit Bedford County. Boys in the grammar school receive excellent instruction from Mr. Stack and Mr. Laporte. Mentions Robert Taylor and Mr. Cardelli. [1714]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Trip to the West. [2960]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES BRECKENRIDGE.

scopecontent.p: Report on progress at the University of Virginia. Professors' gardens in rear of pavilions. Construction of the hotels and pavilions. Classical school run by Mr. Stack, with Mr. Laporte boarding the students. George Blaettermann, Nathaniel Bowditch, Thomas Cooper, Thomas Nuttal, and George Ticknor considered for faculty. Arrival of Raggi brothers to do sculpture. The marble in the quarry not the right quality for Ionic or Corinthian capitals. Work proceeds miserably. Paying the printed prices as the fair living prices. [1715]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN ADAMS.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Extract. 19th century copy. #2723-m. Printed: L and B XV, 204-7.

scopecontent.p: Questions authenticity of Mecklenburg Declaration. Not reported by Thomas Ritchie or National Intelligencer. William Alexander, Richard Caswell, William Hooper, and Joseph Hewes all dead. Peter Horry's history of Francis Marion, Williamson, Ramsay, Marshall, Jones, Girardin, and Wirt do not mention it. Patrick Henry's similar resolutions greatly publicized. Dickinson a doubter, Hooper a Tory, and Hewes indecisive; Caswell strong Whig, but left early. Penn fixed Hewes. Doubts McKnitt a genuine name. [2961]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft, RG-1/3/3.761. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: One of T. J.'s granddaughters (Cornelia Randolph?) has drawn sketch uniting two of Bass Otis' designs for the University seal to he engraved by cheaper workman. Interested in Thomas Nuttal for University faculty if a native. Philadelphia workmen expected. Opinion on paper money. [1716]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Further payments for Michael Raggi to be remitted to Thomas Perkins at the request of Thomas Appleton. Progress of the carving. [1717]

did.unittitle: ROWLAND REYNOLDS, Hampton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for classical professorship at the University of Virginia. Education at Trinity College, Dublin, Ireland and experience at the Rev. Gilbert Austin's academy in Dublin, at the Hampton Academy, and with private pupils. List of Greek and Latin classics he has read. Copy of his diploma, signed by John. Barrett, Thomas Elsington, Fra. Hodgkinson, Robert Phipps, and Thomas Prior. Mentions letter from [Thomas A.] Emmet to Bishop [Benjamin] Moore. [1718]

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON, Monticello, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Canal cleaned. No help from Mr. Randolph or Mr. Colclaser. Mill business. Barrels and corn. Money from Mr. Randolph and Mr. Pollock. Mentions Richmond, Mr. Meeks, Lego. Ailing horse. Jimmy and Shepherd sick. Flour shipment. [2962]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to [ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. RG-5/3. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Information from John Hollins of Baltimore, regarding arrival of marble from Leghorn, Italy, on hoard the Brig Strong belonging to Michael and Giacomo Raggi. Duties to be paid. [1719]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Binns has sent copy of Declaration of Independence. Mr. Cloud and Mr. W. Humbell on mineral committee (to appraise Cooper's collection?); Mr. Collins unable to serve. Seal in engraver's hands. Correa da Serra will report on Thomas Nuttal, who is English by birth. Will advertise for tinsmith. [1720]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to [ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH].
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. RG-5/3. Endorsed by T. J. On verso of

scopecontent.p: Forwards a letter from a Mr. Stokes. Information from John Gorman, stonecutter, relative to prices and time required for stonecutting and sculpturing. [1721]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to J. WHARTON, JR.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. On verso of [1564]. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: University of Virginia not yet ready to appoint professors. [1722]

did.unittitle: D. MARIANO, Lexington, Ky., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Application for professorship of modern languages and music at the University of Virginia. Teaches now at Transylvania University. Opinion on music teaching in the U. S. Offers to help T. J. in his translation of Carlo Botta's History of the War of the Independence of the United States of America. [1723]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ROWLAND REYNOLDS, Hampton.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, [Poplar Forest], to CHARLES CLAY.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Typescript copy (apparently from a catalog notice) in Edward L. Stone MSS, #2117.

scopecontent.p: Approves the judgment in the case of the slaves (case of illness or death caused by medicine). Attack of rheumatism. [1725]

did.unittitle: JEREMIAH SULLIVAN and THOMAS PETTIGRUE, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS by Sullivan 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Applying for position as carver. Mentions Mr. Cardelli and Giovanni Andrei. [1726]

did.unittitle: GIOVANNI ANDREI, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Italian. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Recommendation of Jeremiah Sullivan, stonecutter. [1727]

did.unittitle: G. E. STACK to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.811.

scopecontent.p: Offers to resign as classics teacher should approval be found wanting

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, Charlottesville.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. RG-5/3. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: Forwarding two letters, one from [Giovanni] Andrei. Recommends the stone work of John Gorman. [1728]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Another MS. in NNP.

scopecontent.p: Plans for his return to Monticello. Rheumatism better. Instructions for sending a siesta chair. Corn crop. References to Johnny Hemings, Henry (slave), James Leitch, Mrs. Trist, and Wormley (slave). [1729]

did.unittitle: SAMUEL J. HARRISON, Lynchburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. RG-5/3. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosed by T. J. in 1819 August 29 [1731].

scopecontent.p: Recommends James Wade for piping water to University of Virginia. [1730]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. RG-5/3. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Recommending James Wade of Lynchburg for conducting water to the University. [1731]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ROWLAND REYNOLDS, Hampton.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Asks if he would be interested in teaching in classical school now in Charlottesville in the event present teacher, Stack, leaves. [1732]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to G. E. STACK.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.811 .

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Poplar Forest, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: AL. 2 pp. RG-5/3. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Engagements for brickwork and woodwork at the University with Curtis Carter, James Dinsmore, James Oldham, John M. Perry, William Phillips, and the Philadelphia workmen. Remission of money to the wives of the Raggi brothers. Corinthian capitals. Construction work at Poplar Forest. References to John Vaughan. [1733]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to D. MARIANO.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Nomination of professors being deferred until building completed. [1734]

did.unittitle: ROWLAND REYNOLDS, Hampton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: by T. J. Declines offer to head classical school in Charlottesville. [1735]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Stoves and University seal to be forwarded. Accepting ad interim offer to lecture at Lexington, Kentucky. Articles signed "Indagator" in Analectic Magazine opposes tariff. Correa da Serra well. Mentions John Vaughan. [1736]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON DEED of TRUST on POPLAR FOREST.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397. Original owned by C. S. Hutter, Jr.

scopecontent.p: Poplar Forest deeded to Bernard Peyton and Andrew Stevenson, Directors of Bank of the United States, Richmond, as security for a loan to Wilson Cary Nicholas, endorsed by T. J. and T. J. Randolph. [1737]

did.unittitle: CONSTANTINE S. RAFINESQUE, Lexington, Ky., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Application for professorship at the University of Virginia in French, Italian, materia medica, natural philosophy, geometry, map drawing, natural history drawing, political economy, etc. Lists qualifications; tells life history. Offers Dewitt Clinton, Zaccheus Collins, and Samuel L. Mitchell as references. Appends application to the Board of Visitors. [1738]

did.unittitle: MICHELE and GIACOMO RAGGI to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. Italian. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Suggest savings possible by their making the marble columns for the University in Leghorn, Italy. [1739]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON, Montpelier to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #2598-b. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of T. J.s letter which enclosed a report from the Board of Visitors of the University of Virginia. Mentions Dolley Madison.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH.

scopecontent.p: Order for spices.

did.unittitle: CHAPMAN JOHNSON to [THOMAS JEFFERSON].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Situation seems to require postponement or cancellation of Thomas Cooper's appointment, to save salary until institution opens. Suggests sending him copy of Visitors' resolution. [1740]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Cocke Papers, #3184.

scopecontent.p: Covering letter to Thomas Cooper for his approval. Suffering from colic and rheumatism. [1741]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Stove casting and seal sent to T. J. Uncertain of going to Lexington, Kentucky. Medical school would succeed in Virginia with summer lectures at Charlottesville, winter lectures at Norfolk. Offers to defer coming to Charlottesville. Hopes to be Commissioner if Bankruptcy Law passes. Mentions John Vaughan. [1742]

did.unittitle: ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Portion of address leaf torn away. Cocke Papers, #640.

scopecontent.p: Brockenbrough writes to ask T. J. if "Mr. Nelson" [i.e. Neilson] is to start work on Pavilion V. Brockenbrough has promised some of the work to Mr. Spooner. Closes by wishing T. J. a "speedy recovery." The letter is re-addressed to John Hartwell Cocke, with the following note on the address leaf: "T. Jefferson being unable to write begs the favor of General Cocke to decide upon the business of this letter him self."

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON and JOHN HARTWELL COCKE to THOMAS COOPER.
did.physdesc: LS. 3 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Communication, by instructions of Board of Visitors, to explain delay in opening of the University of Virginia. Additional buildings, not hitherto planned, prevent hiring of professors. Richard Ware mentioned. [1743]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat, #2753. Original owned by Mrs. J. Sharshall Grasty.

scopecontent.p: Order to deliver cotton yarn fit for slave cloth to bearer, Burwell (a slave). [1744]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Visitors' inability to fulfill contract leaves him without support, since position of bankruptcy commissioner failed to materialize. Dr. Robert Patterson giving his chemistry course. May have to accept permanent position elsewhere. Pleased at T. J.'s recovery from severe illness. Regards to John Hartwell Cocke and the Board of Visitors. [1745]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. Draft. 2 pp. #8722.

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Position at Lexington, Ky., filled by Dr. Blythe. Therefore, proposes salary advance and permission to live in University of Virginia buildings immediately. [1746]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [MATTHEW] CAREY.

scopecontent.p: Epictetus of Elizabeth Carter and Sophocles of Robert Potter. Charles Thompson's translation of Old and New Testaments. [2962-b]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Bremo, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 177.

scopecontent.p: Returns copy of plan of Poplar Forest. Financial requirements prevent his moving to the neighborhood of the University at the present time. T. J.'s illness. [1747]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON MEMORANDUM on the RAGGI BROTHERS.

scopecontent.p: Terms of employment, expenses, sums advanced to their wives. Mentions Thomas Appleton. [1748]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CONSTANTINE S. RAFINESQUE, Lexington, Ky.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #38-749.

scopecontent.p: Long illness deferred reply. Visitors of University of Virginia plan to use all funds for building, and are deferring appointment of faculty. [1749]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #2573. File draft. Endorsed by T. J.

scopecontent.p: Letter formally engaging Dr. Cooper to teach at the University of Virginia. Quarters provided for him. [1750]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Plans for removing -to the University of Virginia. Details regarding the advance of his salary. Law suit won but lands unsalable. Regards Quaker petition to Congress on the Missouri question, drawn by Mr. Walsh, as mischievous interference. [1751]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES MADISON.

scopecontent.p: Letters from Thomas Cooper. Mentions Mrs. Madison. [2963]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #38-588. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in MHi.

scopecontent.p: Requests any payment due to John Wayles estate he paid to Archibald Thweatt, son-in-law of Francis Eppes, who brought the original suit when T. J. was in France. Inquiries about getting preference in payment of Wilson Cary Nicholas' debt. [1752]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON vs. RIVANNA COMPANY.
did.physdesc: D. 18 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Copy attested by William L. Eskridge, Clerk of Court of Chancery. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Record in Virginia Supreme Court of Chancery at Staunton. Decision that proof before court not sufficient, and therefore a commission set up to determine whether any damage might be done to T. J.'s canal and mills by the use of his canal by the Rivanna Company. George Divers, William D. Meriwether, Nimrod Bramham, Dabney Minor, and John Welles, directors of the company. [1753]

did.unittitle: F. R. HASSLER, Newark, N. J., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Application for chair of mathematics or natural philosophy at University of Virginia. Lists experience at West Point, Union College (Schenectady, N. Y.), work on boundary line at 45° parallel and on coast survey. Judge Yates of N. Y. will give him reference. Possesses library and apparatus. Mentions Robert Patterson and Mr. Troughton of London. [1754]

did.unittitle: CRAVEN PEYTON, Monteagle, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Slave sale. [2964]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARCHIBALD STUART, Staunton.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Mrs. Peyton Cochran. #3762.

scopecontent.p: Mr. Fuller, met in Charlottesville, had poor proof of supposed discovery of the longitude. T. J. unwilling to make effort to check mathematical project at his age. Mentions Mrs. Stuart. [2965]

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Has seal for University. Sets out for Columbia, S. C., to be professor of chemistry at Columbia College for one year. [1755]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON TO [JAMES] BRECKINRIDGE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #9823. Separate letter cover.

scopecontent.p: Discusses financial difficulties in building the University of Virginia and proposes alternate plans and sources of funds.

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Sends copy of Democratic Press on the Missouri Question. University of Virginia seal sent by Mr. Stack. Arrangements for advance on his salary at the University of Virginia. Mentions John Vaughan and J. Conolly. [1756]

did.unittitle: JAMES CUTBUSH, Washington, D. C., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for professorship of chemistry or natural sciences. Lists publications. Character of a university set by its professors; cites University of Pennsylvania's flourishing under William Shippen, Caspar Wistar, and Benjamin Rush. Thomas Cooper treated unfairly. [1757]

did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-553.

did.unittitle: EDMUND BACON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Payment due John H. Craven, Maupin (the President's agent), Campbell, and Meeks. William D. Fitz of Milton holds notes. Land as financial security. T. J. endorsement mentions Jerry. [2968]

did.unittitle: [ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH]. MEMORANDUM on plastering prices.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Prices quoted by Hugh Chisholm for work at the University. [1759]

did.unittitle: 1819. ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH]. CONSTRUCTION ESTIMATE.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

did.physdesc: Ink. On same sheet with N-328 to its left. Scale: 10' = 1". #171.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, PLAT OF UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA LANDS.

Perry, Mr. Percival, William Phillips, Mr. Smith, Richard Ware, and Mr. White. Also listed are Northern prices and Washington prices. [1762]

Contains sections on Anglo-Saxon alphabet, orthography, grammar, numbers, pronunciation, and a specimen (the book of Genesis) of the form in which Anglo-Saxon writings might be published. [1963]

did.unittitle: SKETCH FOR A HOUSE WITH A PORTICO AND DEPENDENCIES.
did.physdesc: Paper DC. #6225.

did.unittitle: JOHN W. WEBSTER, Boston, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: Offering to sell his mineral collection, highly recommended by George Gibbs and Parker Cleaveland. Incorrectly dated 1819. [1764]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to ALEXANDER GARRETT, Charlottesville.

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 180-181.

scopecontent.p: Funds for the University from Literary Fund and elsewhere. Health of his wife, Mary. Reference to Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [1767]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HENRY DEARBORN.

did.unittitle: FRANCIS BLOODGOOD, Albany, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: ALEXANDER GARRETT. ESTIMATE of UNIVERSITY COSTS.

did.unittitle: LIST OF SCHOOL COMMISSIONERS OF ALBEMARLE COUNTY, VIRGINIA.

did.unittitle: THOMAS COOPER, Columbia, S. C., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: Requests information as to when Mrs. Cooper and he are to come to Charlottesville. South Carolina and Virginia suffer from lack of good preparatory schools. [1770]

did.unittitle: JOHN NEILSON, University of Virginia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Request that T. J. arbitrate a disagreement with John Hartwell Cocke on Neilson's contract. Progress on Pavilion V. [1771]

did.unittitle: MARTIN DAWSON, Milton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Note due Mr. Laporte at Richmond. [2970]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 181-182

scopecontent.p: Attempts to obtain money for the University from the Assembly. References to William and Mary, Burwell Bassett, James Breckenridge, James Dickinson, George Hay, and Chapman Johnson. [1772]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS BLOODGOOD, Albany.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: University of Virginia not sufficiently advanced to purchase mineral collection. [1773]

did.unittitle: JOHN STEELE, Custom House, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: Wine by schooner Industry under Corson, care of Mr. Gibson, Richmond. Mr. Dodge's letter about ship Emma Matilda . [2971]
