scopecontent.p: Fountain pen like Mr. Cowan's. Richmond watchmaker, for Mr. Dyer. [3040]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES MADISON.

scopecontent.p: T. J. encloses a letter [not present] from Joseph Carrington Cabell regarding a proposal to move the College of William and Mary to Richmond and a University of Virginia Board of Visitors decision to hire a medical professor.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: LS. 5 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 308-313 (with omissions); L & B XVI 35-42; B of R VI 60 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Discussion of the removal of the College of William and Mary from its present site to Richmond or a possible consolidation with the University. Would welcome the library and funds of William and Mary but not their faculty in case of consolidation. Suitability of Richmond and Norfolk as site of medical school. Mentions James Madison. [2080]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to Thomas Appleton, Leghorn, Italy.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #38-174.

scopecontent.p: Orders polished marble squares for Rotunda floor. Requests supervision of Giacomo Raggi's contract for bases of columns. Raggi left New York on ship Cyane for Gibraltar. [2081]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON, Montpellier, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Copy by J. C. Cabell. #2791. Printed: Cabell 313; B of R IV 53 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Urging that the friends of the University of Virginia be passive in regard to the removal of William and Mary from Williamsburg to Richmond, Petersburg, or the western part of the state. [2082]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [CLEMENT P.] McKENNIE, Charlottesville.

scopecontent.p: Material about the University of Virginia for use in McKennie's newspaper, the Central Gazette : date of opening, dormitory facilities, courses offered, and fees. [2083]

did.unittitle: SAMUEL WHITCOMB. NOTES on an INTERVIEW with THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: AD. 6 pp. Photostat. #2816. Original owned by Frederick W. Wead.

scopecontent.p: Interview included right of Georgia to the Cherokee lands, character of Indians and African Americans, tariff, disposition of Great Britain toward Spain and the United States, religion, and theology. Brief account of interviews with Colonel James, P. P. Barbour, and James Madison. [2084]

did.unittitle: ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: 2 items. Each: ALS. 3 pp. File draft (RG-5/3) and recipient's copy. Endorsed by Brockenbrough and T. J. respectively.

scopecontent.p: Recommends a reservoir be placed on the Rotunda for fire-protection. Plans for the University's water supply. References to Mr. Chamberlain, John Perry, and A. B. Thorn. [2085]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, [Cambridge, England].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Sends report on the plan of the University for Dr. [Dugald] Stewart and others. Failure of legislature to appropriate money for books and apparatus. Possibility that William and Mary may consolidate with the University. Sends acknowledgment to Major [John] Cartwright for a volume on the English Constitution that he sent. Suggests presenting copy of report on the University to Cartwright. [2086]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Warminster, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 314-315.

scopecontent.p: Illness of Mrs. [St. George] Tucker prevents his visiting T. J. at Monticello and the Madisons at Montpellier. Removal of William and Mary to Richmond. [2087]

did.unittitle: GEORGE BLAETTERMANN. CONTRACT with FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, attorney for the UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: DS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Contract to teach French, Italian, German, English, Anglo-Saxon, modern history, and geography. Salary, prequisites, and conditions of the professorships. [2088]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to F. R. HASSLER, Jamaica, New York.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Barrett Collection. #3635.

scopecontent.p: Visitors to open University 1 February 1825. European scholars because American not suitably prominent. [3041]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to STEPHEN T. MITCHELL, Lynchburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat. #2604. Deposited by C. S. Hutter, Jr.

scopecontent.p: Agreeing to subscribe to Mitchell's newspaper. [2089]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [?].

scopecontent.p: Recommends Col. Bernard Peyton for office in Richmond. Mentions Bedford. [3041-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HENRY A. S. DEARBORN, Boston.

scopecontent.p: Introduces Col. Bernard Peyton of Richmond, a commission merchant who travels to expand his business in North. [3041-b]

did.unittitle: ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-174.

scopecontent.p: Requests instructions for John Gorman, who is working on the Rotunda. James Dinsmore and John Neilson need funds. [2090]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to LYDIA H. SIGOURNEY, Hartford.
did.physdesc: LS 2. pp. Endorsed by T. J. Photostat. #2212. Original owned by St. Paul's School. Another MS. in NNP. Printed: Mag. Amer. Hist. XXI 431.

scopecontent.p: Belief in human progress and perfectibility. Advocates Indian rights. [2091]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS J. O'FLAHERTY, Richmond.

scopecontent.p: Busy at University. O'Flaherty's competence in Greek, Latin, French, and English. [3042]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Request for copies of the Rockfish Gap Report and [Maverick's] plan of the University. [2092]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Original owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Orders material for saddlecloth. [3043]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to PETER MINOR.

scopecontent.p: Grain samples from Mr. Gelston, New York, for Albemarle Agricultural Society. [3044]

did.unittitle: P. F. B. CONSTANT, Mount Airy College, Germantown, Pa., to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University of Virginia.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: Broadside. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Application for professorship of modern languages, geography, and history. Lists qualifications and education. Gives Robert Walsh, Jr., as reference. Enclosure: prospects of Mount Airy College, P. F. B. Constant, Principal. Label in T. J.'s hand "Candidates for Professorships." [2093]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH ANTRIM, University of Virginia.

scopecontent.p: Recommendation for Joseph Antrim as plasterer on basis of work at University of Virginia. [3044-a]

did.unittitle: ROBLEY DUNGLISON. CONTRACT with FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, attorney for the UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Scals. Witnessed by George Long and Thomas H. Key. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Contract to teach anatomy, surgery, history and theory of medicine, physiology, materia medica, and pharmacy. Salary, perquisites, and conditions. [2094]

did.unittitle: THOMAS HEWETT KEY. CONTRACT with FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, attorney for the UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Seals. Witnessed by George Long and Robley Dunglison. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Contract to teach mathematics, navigation, architecture, astronomy. Salary, perquisites, and conditions. [2095]

did.unittitle: GEORGE LONG. CONTRACT with FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, attorney for the UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Seals. Endorsed by T. J. Witnessed by Thomas H. Key and Robley Dunglison. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Contract to teach Latin, Greek, Hebrew, rhetoric, belles lettres, ancient history, ancient geography. Salary, perquisites, and conditions. [2096]

did.unittitle: CHARLES BONNYCASTLE. CONTRACT with FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, attorney for UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: DS. 2 pp. Seals. Endorsed by T. J. Witnesses: William Barksdale and B. M. Carter. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Contract to teach natural philosophy, mechanics, statics, hydrostatics, hydraulics, pneumatics, acoustics, optics, and astronomy. Salary, perquisites, and conditions. [2097]

did.unittitle: HORACE WELLFORD, Charlottesville, to [Board of Visitors, UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA].
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Application for professorship of anatomy and physics. [2098]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, to JAMES LEITCH.

scopecontent.p: T. J. asks that the bearer of the note, named Joe, choose some iron.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RESOLUTIONS of the BOARD of VISITORS of the University.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Resolutions concerning the leasing of hotels and the rent to be paid. Copy sent to Brockenbrough. [2099]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON, Montpellier to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp.; docketed by T.J. #12181.

scopecontent.p: Madison discusses Thomas Walker Gilmer's recruitment of English professors for the newly-established University of Virginia, the merits of domestic vs. foreign professors, and candidates for hotel keepers.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, [London].
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Endorsed with note of presentation from W. C. N. Randolph to Micajah Woods, 17 May 1899. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Advice on selection of professors. Prefers English, Irish, or Scotch to German professors. George Blaettermann's books to be passed duty-free. Funds from legislature for books. Lafayette's visit to Charlottesville and the University. Hopes Gilmer will accept position at University. Requests copy of Michael Russell's book on Scottish universities. Presidential election between William H. Crawford and John Q. Adams. Mentions James Ivory and Sir John Leslie. [2100]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Owned by E. R. W. McCabe. #4647.

scopecontent.p: Board of Visitors has no money. Scottish, English, Irish, German professors. Second-rate Europeans better than second-rate Americans. Ivory and Leslie acceptable. No duty on George Blaettermann's books. U.S. debt to Virginia. LaFayette to visit Monticello, Montpelier, and University. Russel's Views of the System of Education in the Universities of Scotland, with appendix on England, published at Edinburgh. Endorsed by T. J. as never received by Gilmer, and returned to T. J. [3045]

did.unittitle: MARTHA JEFFERSON RANDOLPH, Monticello, for THOMAS JEFFERSON, to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Orders sewing supplies. [3046]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON, Montpelier, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ANS. McGregor Library, #2716.

scopecontent.p: Returns Francis Walker Gilmer's letter which he has copied. Gilmer must not fail to bring professor of natural philosophy for the University. Originally calendared as 1824 October 19. [3046-a]

did.unittitle: CORNELIA RANDOLPH, Monticello, for THOMAS JEFFERSON, to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Orders screws and copperas. [3047]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH COOLIDGE, JR., Boston.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. #2873. Original owned by Harold J. Coolidge. Another MS. in MHi. Printed: Ford X 323-324.

scopecontent.p: Abscessed jaw improved. Approval of Coolidge's marriage to Ellen Randolph. Inability to provide a dowry. Plan to use Milizia's book on architecture as a text at the University. General Lafayette's approaching visit. Reference to James Madison. [2101]

did.unittitle: ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Returns papers and a copy of the Proctor's account for T. J.'s files. Recommends higher boarding rates to attract good hotel keepers. [2102]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES MADISON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Photostat. #722. Original owned by John Skelton Williams. Printed: B of R VI 312 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Inviting Mr. and Mrs. Madison to meet Lafayette at Charlottesville. Lafayette to go to Montpellier and Fredericksburg. No news from Francis Walker Gilmer. [2103]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Distressed by news of Gilmer's ill health. Exemption of George Blaettermann's books from duties. Details on board and lodging prepared for the professors. Mentions Bernard Peyton, agent for the University in Richmond. [2105]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, New York.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588. Another MS. in DLC. Printed: Davis, Francis Walker Gilmer, 240.

scopecontent.p: Urges him to accept faculty post at University of Virginia. [2106]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, Bremo.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-163. Printed: B of R VI 90 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Returns donation for purchase of Polyglot Bible through Alexander Garrett since Cummings & Hillard have sold it. Francis Walker Gilmer has engaged five professors. Visitors must meet to appoint others. [2107]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JAMES PLEASANTS, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: University will open on 1 February 1825 since Gilmer has hired George Blaettermann, Charles Bonnycastle, Robley Dunglison, Thomas Key, and George Long, expected from Europe in a few days. [2108]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Wishes to know port professors will enter, so as to secure remission of duty on books. Requests information on John Torrey's attitude toward chair of natural history. Urges Gilmer to accept chair of law. [2109]

did.unittitle: ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-174.

scopecontent.p: Measurements of Rotunda dome. Sends Hotel contracts for his inspection. [2110]

did.unittitle: ARCHIBALD THWEATT, Eppington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #1397.

scopecontent.p: Introducing Richard Kidder Meade, whose father wishes to manage boarding houses for the University of Virginia. [2111]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588.

scopecontent.p: Wrote [Joseph] Anderson, state comptroller, to instruct collector to exempt professors' books from duty. Problems of immediate accommodations for professors. [2112]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Sends suggested form for articles of agreement for leases of Hotels, covering all details of operation. Copy form is a lease with John Gray, Jr. [2113]

did.unittitle: A. MacDONALD, Philadelphia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for post of librarian at University of Virginia. William Tilghman a reference. [2114]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH ANDERSON.

scopecontent.p: T. J. writes that the University of Virginia professors from England are expected "hourly" at Richmond or Norfolk, and requests that their books be exempt from duties.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON LETTER of APPOINTMENT for UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA FACULTY.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Endorsed with the names of Professors George Blaettermann, Charles Bonnycastle, Robley Dunglison, John Patton Emmet, Thomas H. Key, and George Long. [2115]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 316-318.

scopecontent.p: Cabell's business at Corotoman. Assembly politics with respect to the bill to move the College of William and Mary to Richmond and funds for the University. References to George Blaettermann, Francis T. Brooke, John Bowyer, William Brockenbrough, John Coalter, James M. Garnett, George Hay, Chapman Johnson, Mr. Leigh, Judge Marshall, James Madison, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and Robert B. Taylor. [2116]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 318-320.

scopecontent.p: Decision to vote against the bill to remove William and Mary to Richmond. Medical education at the University. References to Chapman Johnson and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [2117]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 5 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 320-323; L & B XVI 84-89; B of R VI 60 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Recommendations regarding the removal of William and Mary and division of her funds among ten collegiate districts. University should get $50,000 from Congress. Meeting of Visitors to appoint remaining faculty members. George Long's arrival. [2118]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to GEN. JAMES BRECKINRIDGE.

scopecontent.p: T. J. asks Breckinridge to keep the contents of this letter secret. T. J. believes that Francis Walker Gilmer will decline the professorship of law at the University and asks Breckinridge if William Campbell Preston would be a suitable candidate.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 324.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson and Madison prefer George Tucker for chair of ethics. Bill for district colleges. Mentions Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., and William F. Gordon. [2119]

did.unittitle: BENJAMIN WATERHOUSE, Cambridge, Mass., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: Broadside. 1 pp. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Recommends the Rev. Joseph P. Bertrum, who wishes to teach at the University of Virginia. Failure of John Adams "animal economy" but not his intellectual powers. Foresees trouble about inscription on Bunker Hill Monument. Republic ungrateful in not providing one for Samuel Adams. Enclosure: "Heads of a Course of Lectures on Natural History given annually (since 1788) in the University of Cambridge, by B. Waterhouse, M. D." [2120]

did.unittitle: SAMUEL MARTIN, Campbell Station, Tenn., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Printed: Ford-Bixby 290-291. McGregor Library, #123.

scopecontent.p: Urges Jefferson to throw influence to Andrew Jackson. Clay should content himself with Mexican ministry. [2121]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 324-327.

scopecontent.p: Differences of opinion between Jefferson and Madison regarding the removal of the College of William and Mary to Richmond. Funds for the University. References to John Bowyer, Judge Dabney Carr, Francis W. Gilmer, William F. Gordon, George Loyall, Mr. Nicholas, James Pleasants, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., James Semple, John A. Smith, George Tucker, and John Tyler. [2122]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. "ADDITIONAL NOTES FOR THE LIBRARY."
did.physdesc: Ink. Wove paper, watermarked S & C Wise. 7 3/4 x 9 3/4 in. #171.

scopecontent.p: On verso: small framing diagram for library dome. [N-332, K-12]

did.unittitle: LIST OF APPLICANTS FOR CHEMISTRY PROFESSORSHIP AT WEST POINT.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J.: "Torrey John to be professor of chemistry". RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applicants for situation vacated by death of James Cuthush include Franklin Bache, James F. Dana, J. Everett, Jacob Green, John Manners, James G. Percival, Arthur L. Porter, John Torrey, and G. Troost. [2123]

did.unittitle: LIST OF PERIODICALS.
did.physdesc: D. 2 pp. In unidentified hand. Endorsed by T. J. #12047.

scopecontent.p: A list of periodical titles, some with annual cost and place of publication, possibly to be ordered for the University of Virginia Library.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to HIS FELLOW CITIZENS
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. File draft. Moyer-Jefferson Papers, #9828.

scopecontent.p: A circular letter in which T. J. pleads "the decayed energies of body & mind" and asks "permission to withdraw from all epistolary correspondence beyond what is required by the ordinary business and duties of life."

did.unittitle: BANK DEBTS.
did.physdesc: D. 1 pp. In unidentified hand. Endorsed by T. J. Owned by Mrs. Edwin Page Kirk. #5291.

scopecontent.p: Sums owed to Farmers Bank, United States Bank, and Virginia Bank. [3049]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM C. SOMERVILLE, Stratford, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Seal. Enclosure: ADS. 16 pp. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Offers to sell his library of 3000 to 4000 volumes to the University of Virginia. Collection includes portrait of Washington by Gilbert Stuart and other portraits of Lafayette and Peyton Randolph. Enclosure: catalog of books. [2124]

did.unittitle: JOHN L. THOMAS, Charlottesville, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for position as librarian. Alexander Garrett given as a reference. [2126]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to H. P. VAN BIBBER, Northend, Va.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Paul Mellon Bequest, #11622. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Details on opening of the of Virginia. Professors of mathematics and natural philosophy expected shortly. Advertisement of University's opening in newspapers. Textbook sales. Qualifications to enter schools of Latin, Greek, mathematics, and natural philosophy. [2125], [3050].

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 328-329.

scopecontent.p: Letter from George Tucker regarding a teaching position at the University. Application from Mr. Kidd for the position of professor of ethics. Bill for removal of William and Mary to Richmond to be rejected. Funds for the University. References to James Barbour, William F. Gordon, Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., James Madison, and Judge James Semple. [2127]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to BENJAMIN WATERHOUSE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Copy in unidentified hand. #10794.

scopecontent.p: T. J. writes to Waterhouse concerning the selection of faculty members at the University of Virginia, his views on religion, the health of John Adams, and his own fears of old age and infirmity.

did.unittitle: WILLIAM LEE, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Offers University cabinet of conchology, mineralogy purchased by friend, Edward Wyer, in Spain. Dr. Wallace of Virginia offers to examine and report on it. [2128]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Enclose papers from [William] Coffee and text of an advertisement to be inserted in the Richmond Enquirer, the Constitutional Whig, and the principal paper of Fredericksburg concerning the opening of the University. [2129]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN I. THOMAS, Charlottesville.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: One of professors to act as librarian. [2130]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 330-332; L & B XVI 97-100; TJR IV 411-412; B of R VI 60 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Non-arrival of professors may delay opening of University. James Barbour hopeful of obtaining $50,000 from Congress for the University. Additional funds needed to complete Rotunda and anatomical theatre. Jefferson's actions to further the University have roused much personal antagonism. [2131]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH COOLIDGE:, JR., Boston.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Photostat. #2873. Original owned by Harold J. Coolidge. Another MS. in MHi. Printed: L 8; B XVIII 334-337; MHS Coll I 340-342.

scopecontent.p: Thanks for gift of books by Michael Russell and Joseph Bosworth. Agrees that William Hilliard be made the University's agent to purchase books in Europe. Recommends plates for a new edition of Wilson's Ornithology. Reported discovery in Athens of 2000 rolls of papyri of Greek authors. Expected arrival of new professors at the University. [2132]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Orders brandy. [3050-a]

scopecontent.p: Recommends setting up port near Norfolk to be named after Jefferson to rival New York. Begs Jefferson to use his influence for Jackson in presidential election. [2133]

did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 332-333.

scopecontent.p: Request that T. J. prepare a bill to prevent removal of William and Mary College to Richmond. Clergy, Richmond, and the Federalists all united in favor of removal. [2134]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN GRISCOM, New York.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #2845. Clifton Waller Barrett Library. Printed: B of R Vi 194 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Returning a copy of Michael Russell's View of Education in Scotland. Expected arrival of professors from England. [2135]

did.unittitle: A. DE LETAMENDI, St. Augustine, [Fla.], to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for professorship of foreign languages at University of Virginia. [2136]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM C. SOMERVILLE, Stratford, Va.
did.physdesc: AL. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Somerville's book catalog given to University's purchasing agent (Cummings and Hilliard). Funds dependent on Virginia's claim against Congress. [2137]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM LEE, Washington.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Will hold offer of Edward Wyer's mineral collection under consideration; funds dependent on claim of state of Virginia on Congress. [2138]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Another MS. in DLC. Printed: Cabell 334.

scopecontent.p: Calls meeting of Board of Visitors of University to approve loan required for work on Rotunda, loan to be backed by subscriptions due. Mentions Arthur Brockenbrough, John Hartwell Cocke, Alexander Garrett, and James Madison. [2139]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Another MS. in DLC. Printed (with omissions): Cabell 335. Enclosure: AD. 6 pp. Printed: Cabell Appendix 499-501.

scopecontent.p: Sends draft of bill for the discontinuance of the College of William and Mary and the establishment of colleges at Williamsburg, Hampden-Sydney, Lynchburg, Richmond, Fredericksburg, Winchester, Staunton, Fincastle, Louisburg, and Clarksburg. Distribution of the College of William and Mary's funds. Enclosure: draft of bill. [2140]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM LEE, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Concerning possible sale of Edward Wyer's mineral collection to University of Virginia. Mentions Dr. Wallace. [2141]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS WALKER GILMER, Richmond, to the RECTOR and VISITORS of the UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: ADS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Financial report on his mission to Europe. Funds paid by bankers Gowan and Marx to George Blaettermann, Charles Bonnycastle, Mr. Bohn (bookseller), Mr. Cary (optician), Robley Dunglison, Thomas H. Key, and John Tuther. Encloses letters and catalogs of books and instruments from Dr. Parr, Mr. Harris, and the Rev. John Tynes. [2142]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ANDREW KEAN, Charlottesville.

scopecontent.p: Urges Kean to remain at Charlottesville. [3051]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J.#2791. Printed: Cabell 336.

scopecontent.p: Removal of William and Mary to Richmond. Articles in the Whig on the funds of William and Mary and the decision of the Court of Appeals in the case of Bracken and the College. References to Alexander Garrett and John A. Smith. [2143]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 336-337.

scopecontent.p: News of Ship Competitor. Requests authorities to support the division of William and Mary's money. Mentions Dartmouth College case. [2144]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #201. Printed: Cabell 339-341. Enclosures: AD. 2 pp. Cabell Papers, #38-111. AD. 2 pp. In the hand of Cornelia Jefferson Randolph[?]. Cabell Papers, #38-111.

scopecontent.p: Faculty should prescribe textbooks for most courses, but that of government should be set by Board of Visitors to prevent dissemination of Federalist principles. Necessity for investigating the sum of education rendered in each county in primary schools. Financing the medical theatre. Enclosure: resolution requiring annual statement of schooling rendered in each county, together with a sample form for the report. Enclosure: Resolutions as to the principles of government for the University of Virginia. [2145]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 337-338.

scopecontent.p: Publication of a letter from T. J. to help prevent removal of the College of William and Mary to Richmond. Consideration of Francis W. Gilmer and Chancellor [St. George] Tucker for the law chair at the University. Suggests the professor of law be also given a small chancery district. References to Servant Jones and Richard Morris. [2146]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM H. CRAWFORD, Washington, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Recommends Dr. Henry Jackson, youngest brother of Gen. James Jackson, for professorship of natural history and philosophy. Sends seed from Italy and sample of Cremona flax received from Thomas Appleton. [2147]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 341-342.

scopecontent.p: Defeat of plan to remove William and Mary to Richmond. Plan for a general education system. [2148]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 343-345.

scopecontent.p: Defeat of the bill to remove William and Mary to Richmond. Delay in arrival of the University faculty. T. J.'s resolutions relative to primary schools. Expresses disapproval of a constitutional convention for Virginia. Opposition to Cabell in his senatorial district. References to John Bowyer, Judge Francis T. Brooke, Col. Benjamin Cabell, John Hartwell Cocke, David S. Garland, William F. Gordon, George Loyall, and Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr. [2149]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 346.

scopecontent.p: Funds for the University from interest claim of the Commonwealth of Virginia. References to George Loyall and Littleton W. Tazewell. [2150]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON ADVERTISEMENT OF THE OPENING OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.

scopecontent.p: Information regarding fees, courses, and provisions for housing and board. (The advertisement appeared in the Enquirer over the name of the Proctor, Arthur Spicer Brockenbrough). [2151]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WAYLES EPPES.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Draft copy. Edgehill-Randolph Papers, #5533.

scopecontent.p: News of fire damage at Poplar Forest from Ashton. J. Hemings to repair. Wood from Captain Martin. English professors at Hampton. University opens in March. [3053]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 346-347.

scopecontent.p: Arrival of the University faculty. Meeting of the Board of Visitors. References to Chapman Johnson, Francis Gilmer, George Loyall, and John Hartwell Cocke. [2152]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to MR. HILLIARD of CUMMINGS AND HILLIARD, Boston.

scopecontent.p: No book agent in Charlottesville. Suggests Meredith Jones. Foulis and Leipsic classics. Paris stereotype editions the best. Dufief's French and English dictionary. Boiste's French dictionary equal to that of Academy. Many French students, some Spanish students, few German and Italian. Cubi's Spanish Dictionary, Baltimore edition adequate. Professors from England in Hampton Roads. University opens 7 March. Langard's History of England. George Brodie's History of the English Empire from the Accession of Charles I. Turner's History of the Anglo-Saxons. Hume's History of England. Thomas' edition of Edward Coke's First Institute on Littleton. [3054]

did.unittitle: ANDREW KEAN, Charlottesville, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for position of librarian for son, John V. Kean, lists his qualifications. Lancelot Minor, Horatio G. Winston, and George W. Trueheart of Louisa recommend him. [2153]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 347.

scopecontent.p: Faculty positions offered to [Henry St. George?] Tucker and to George Tucker. References to Judge John Coalter and [St. George] Tucker. [2154]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to CAPTAIN WORMELEY.

scopecontent.p: Letter from England. [3055]

scopecontent.p: Proctor's statement of the funds of the University as of 31 December 1824. [2155]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, Lo ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Notice to students of opening of University to be published in Central Gazette,Enquirer,National Intelligencer.[2156]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ALEXANDER GARRETT.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Garrett Papers, #860.

scopecontent.p: Enclose Visitors' ratification of loan of $5000 from Farmer's Bank. Directs remittance to Thomas Appleton through Bernard Peyton of Richmond and Samuel Williams of London for columns. [2157]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Another MS. in DLC. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Letter to Alexander Garrett contains instructions for payment to Thomas Appleton (for Giacomo Raggi's work on columns) through Bernard Peyton. Second letter of this date. [2158]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Resolutions of the Visitors concerning the $50,000 to be received from Congress. Accounting procedures. Part of fund to he used for preparation of a room to receive books. Number of bricks necessary for medical theatre. [2159]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to GEORGE TUCKER, Lynchburg.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2245.

scopecontent.p: Appointment of Tucker as Professor of the School of Moral Philosophy. Arrival of five professors from England. Opening of the University. [2160]

did.unittitle: ALEXANDER GARRETT to [BERNARD PEYTON]
did.physdesc: L. 1 pp. Copy. Endorsed by T. J. Garrett Papers, #860.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Framed with print of T. J. and Monticello. #8410.

scopecontent.p: Financial situation of University of Virginia. Difficulty in riding. [3055-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Original owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Orders "wool cards" and mustard. [3056]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON FINANCIAL STATEMENT on the UNIVERSITY.

scopecontent.p: Funds as of 1 January 1825, and estimate for 1826. [2162]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Recommends macadam roads for the University. [2163]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JOHN V. KEAN.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Appointment as librarian at salary of $150 per year. Statement of his duties. [2164]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Original owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Shirting for Burwell (slave). [3057]

scopecontent.p: Note for $5000, negotiable at Farmer's Bank of Virginia. Receipted by Alexander Garrett, Bursar, and William Nekervis, Cashier of Farmer's Bank. [2165]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Request for printed copies of the rules enacted by the Board of Visitors. [2166]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN PATTERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. #5354. Clifton Waller Barrett Library.

scopecontent.p: Central Gazette and Rules for Governing the University. Philadelphia papers favor Philadelphia medical school and suppress University advertisements. Boston and New York papers better. Commends Patterson. T. J. Randolph's wife improves; Robley Dunglison treating her. [3058]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to THOMAS COOPER, Columbia, South Carolina.

scopecontent.p: Health. University of Virginia. Professors found by Francis Walker Gilmer. Professors Bonnycastle, Dunglison, Emmet, and Tucker. Courses in mathematics, natural philosophy, medicine, classics, French, Spanish, Italian, German, Swedish, Danish, Anglo-Saxon, chemistry, botany, zoology, ethics, and law. Library. Mentions Cambridge and Edinburgh Universities. University of South Carolina. [3058-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to HORACE HOLLY, Lexington, Ky.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #1671. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Rules for discipline at the University of Virginia. Opening of the University. Express hope for the success of the University of Transylvania. [2167]

did.unittitle: A. BROADHEAD, PLAT OF UNIVERSITY LANDS FOR WILLIAM WOODS.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Original owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Orders bedticking. [3059]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH COOLIDGE, JR.
did.physdesc: ALS. File draft. 2 pp. #2873. Includes ALS. File draft, 1 pp., [1825 April 12], T. J. NOTES ON A CLOCK FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. #5262. Printed: L and B XVIII, 337-40.

scopecontent.p: Professors arrived; University opened March 7. English professors. Professors of chemistry and moral philosophy are Americans; professor of law not selected. Boston bell makers. Mr. Hilliard, University agent for library purchases. Board of Visitors appreciates gift of books. Coolidge's parents to visit. Mentions Mr. Ticknor. Enclosure describes clock for Rotunda and asks cost. [3060]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH COOLIDGE, JR.

scopecontent.p: Opening of the University. The faculty. Bell for the University. William Hilliard engaged to buy a library for the University to the value of $15,000. Receipt of books sent by Coolidge for the University. Coolidge's visit to Monticello. [2168]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOHN SPEAR SMITH, Baltimore.
did.physdesc: AL[S clipped]. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #1762.

scopecontent.p: Jefferson's gift to Smith's son. Numbers enrolled at the University of Virginia. Disciplinary problems. Accepts the Bayle [dictionary?] and Edinburgh Atlas for the University Library. [2169]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON LIST of BOOKS donated to the UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA by JOSEPH COOLIDGE, JR., of Boston.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Necessity of purchasing from John Perry the strip of land that divides the two parcels of University property in order to secure the water supply. All faculty except George Tucker and law professor have arrived. Necessity for disciplining students. Enclosure: estimate of University income and expenditures, 1824-1827. [2171]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to BOARD of VISITORS, UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.

scopecontent.p: Necessity of purchasing from John Perry the strip of land that divides the two parcels of University property in order to secure the water supply. scopecontent.p: See [2171] and [2171-a] for other copies.

did.unittitle: JOHN ADAMS, Quincy, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Opposing the holding of religious services in University buildings. [2173]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to TREASURER OF VIRGINIA.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON to JAMES LEITCH.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Original owned by Thomas Jefferson Memorial Foundation. #5196.

scopecontent.p: Orders coffee. [3062]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University.

scopecontent.p: Draft of advertisement requesting book donations for the University Library to be inserted in the Central Gazette and Richmond Enquirer. Advertisement mentions donations from [John?] Hansford of King George County, Bernard Moore Carter of London, and Joseph Coolidge, Jr., of Boston. [2174]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. File draft. 1 pp. Fragment. #6539.

scopecontent.p: Recommends Henry St. George Tucker for professor of law at University. Rockfish Gap conference. Mentions Joseph C. Cabell. [3063]

did.unittitle: THOMAS APPLETON, Leghorn. ACCOUNT rendered to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ADS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Stamped and signed by Jonathan Thompson, Collector of New York. #2737-a.

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Norfolk, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 351.

scopecontent.p: Approves purchase of John M. Perry's land for the University. [2176]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University.

scopecontent.p: Encloses draft of handbill to answer routine questions on the courses and expenses of the University. [Clement P.?] McKennie to print handbill. [2177]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON PLAT OF UNIVERSITY LANDS.
did.physdesc: Paper CO. 10 x 15 1/2 in. Bursar's Records. #5262. See Nichols, N-327a.

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON, Montpellier, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2598.

scopecontent.p: Law chair to be offered to William A. G. Dade. [2180]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University.

did.physdesc: AD. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.801.

scopecontent.p: The petition requests the Board to divide the term and extend vacation, considering the "inclement season at which the vacation occurs."

did.unittitle: ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, University, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.

scopecontent.p: Covers letter from William J. Coffee, agreeing to reduce prices on cornices. Letter from Coffee to Brockenbrough, 25 September, on verso. [2240]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.

did.unittitle: ROBLEY DUNGLISON to BOARD OF VISITORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.

scopecontent.p: Dunglison encloses a copy of the Faculty resolution requesting a "vigilant and efficient police" force to guard against disturbances such as the recent student riots.

did.unittitle: FACULTY to STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: DS. 2 pp. by George Tucker, Chairman and ADS 1 pp. by Robley Dunglison, Secretary. Both endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.801.

scopecontent.p: Resolutions on the "disgraceful and ungentlemanly riot of last night."

did.unittitle: STUDENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: DS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.801.

scopecontent.p: Resolution not to disclose names of student rioters to the Faculty.

did.unittitle: JONATHAN THOMPSON, New York, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Duties on the marble received on the Ship Caroline for the University of Virginia. Reference to Bernard Peyton. [2242]

did.unittitle: BOARD OF VISITORS, REGULATIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: ADS. 4 pp. In T. J.'s hand. #10300, 10300-a.

scopecontent.p: Regulations detail required conduct of students and rights and powers of the Board and the Faculty.

did.unittitle: THOMAS H. KEY and GEORGE LONG to RECTOR and VISITORS, UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: LS (ALS by Key). 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Offering resignations, having lost confidence after student riot. (See Bruce, History of the University of Virginia II 298 ff.). [2243]

did.unittitle: THE FACULTY to THE BOARD OF VISITORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: 4 items. Each: D. 1 pp. 3 signed by Robley Dunglison and George Tucker. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.801.

scopecontent.p: Three documents are copies made for T. J. confirming the expulsion of William L. Eyre, Robert A. Thompson and Wilson Miles Carey for their parts in the student riot. The fourth is a list of fourteen students and the penalties each received.

did.unittitle: THOMAS H. KEY and GEORGE LONG to THE BOARD OF VISITORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.801.

scopecontent.p: Key and Long submit their resignations from the faculty.

did.unittitle: THOMAS H. KEY and GEORGE LONG to THE BOARD OF VISITORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.801.

scopecontent.p: Key and Long request clarification of the terms of their resignations.

did.unittitle: WILLIAM HILLIARD, Boston, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Enclosure: D. 2 pp. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Sends case of books for University, the invoice for which is enclosed. Problems involved in securing various editions of certain works. Hilliard unable to go abroad personally because commission lowered. Books enclosed for [M. W. D.] Jones and [Valentine] Southall. [2244]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON RESOLUTION of the BOARD OF VISITORS, UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Endorsed by A. S. Brockenbrough. #2737-a.

scopecontent.p: Duties of the Proctor. Attorney-in-fact for the University responsible for property, breaches of the peace, trespasses by students or others on University grounds. Copy sent to Brockenbrough. [2245]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Reimbursement of Henry A. S. Dearborn for the money advanced for the University of Virginia marble. [2246]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: AL[S clipped]. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588.

scopecontent.p: Offers him the chair of law. [2247]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to the BOARD OF VISITORS, UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: ADS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Remittances to Henry A. S. Dearborn, Boston, and Jonathan Thompson, New York, for duties and freight on the University marble. Request for copies of the printed enactments of the Board of Visitors, and for all the land deeds of the University. Instructions regarding construction. [2248]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, JAMES MADISON, CHAPMAN JOHNSON, JAMES BRECKENRIDGE, GEORGE LOYALL, and JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL. BOND to UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
did.physdesc: DS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Witnessed by Arthur Spicer Brockenbrough. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Guaranteeing payment to Collector of Boston for capitals imported on Brig Farnsworth, J. Harmor Master. [2249]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH COOLIDGE, JR., Boston.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Photostat. #2873. Original owned by H. J. Coolidge. Another MS. in MHi. Printed: L & B XVIII 342-346: M H S Coll I 356-359.

scopecontent.p: Price for the University clock and bell. Student riot at the University. T. J.'s health. Greetings to Ellen. [2250]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Money advanced by Thomas Appleton to one of the Raggi brothers. [2252]

did.unittitle: HENRY A. S. DEARBORN, Boston, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Endorsed by T. J. 2 enclosures. Payment received for the marble capitals. Enclosures: bills from Henry Hovey & Co. and the Franklin Insurance Co. [2253]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [FRANCIS WALKER GILMER].

scopecontent.p: Dissensions at University of Virginia. Fears schism among professors. Poor health. Regards to Mr. and Mrs. Divers. [3078-b]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to GEORGE W. LEWIS.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #3086. Printed: L & B XVI 124-129; B of R VI 268 (MS. in DLC).

scopecontent.p: Recommendation for a course of study in ancient and modern history. David Hume's bias in his History of England. Recommends Coke's Littleton as the best elementary work in law. Mentions Francis Walker Gilmer. [2254]

did.unittitle: TO THE EUROPEAN MEMBERS OF THE FACULTY OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: ADS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.801.

scopecontent.p: From the students, denying "feelings of hostility and malevolence."

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM HILLIARD, Boston.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #564.

scopecontent.p: Instructions regarding editions of various books for the library. Complaints by students and by George Blaettermann at lack of texts. [2255]

did.unittitle: MARTIN DAWSON, Milton, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Explains state of University funds. Mentions Joseph C. Cabell and John Hartwell Cocke. [2256]

did.unittitle: PETER BARLOW, Woolwich, England, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Apparatus for University of Virginia. Prices exceed some of Charles Bonnycastle's estimates. Mentions Rufus King. [2257]

did.unittitle: THOMAS HEWITT KEY, University of Virginia, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #10300-b.

scopecontent.p: Key thanks t. J. for his kindness and attention to Key's friends during their visit to Monticello.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, MEMORANDUM to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Instructions relative to smoke houses and wood yards for the faculty, firewood for class rooms, student regulations, student accounts, and money remitted by Samuel Williams to Thomas Appleton. [2258]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ELLEN WAYLES COOLIDGE.
did.physdesc: ALS. 4 pp. Printed: L & B XVIII 346-352; M H S Coll I 359-363. #12141.

scopecontent.p: Discipline restored at the University after student riot. News of the loss of Ellen's baggage received from John Hemings. Offers to give to Joseph Coolidge, Jr., the writing desk on which the Declaration of Independence was written. Clock for the University to be made by Mr. Willard when funds permit. Request that the Coolidge buy codfish, tongue, and cognac for him. References to Benjamin Waterhouse and George Ticknor. [2259]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Accounts with [Martin] Dawson and Jonathan Thompson. Instructions regarding the building of smoke houses. [2260]

did.unittitle: MARQUIS DE LAFAYETTE to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #8885.

scopecontent.p: Books to T. J. from Destutt de Tracy care of Mr. Connel. Brochure of French gentleman. [3078-c]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ROBLEY DUNGLISON.
did.physdesc: AL. File draft. 1 pp. McGregor Library, #4000. Printed: Dorsey, 41-43.

scopecontent.p: Condition of his health. Payment to Dunglison. The plan of a new medical school he encloses [not present] will show "a specimen of our proficiency in the art of puffery." Mentions Hippocratus. [3079]

did.unittitle: November 17. JONATHAN THOMPSON, New York, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Receipt of money for expenses incurred for the University of Virginia. (Attached is ALS 12 November from W. Dandridge, Bank of Virginia, to Arthur Spicer Brockenbrough regarding University of Virginia funds). [2261]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH COOLIDGE, JR., Boston.
did.physdesc: ADS and DS. 1 pp. 2 copies. Photostat. #2873. Originals owned by H. J. Coolidge. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Card sent with writing desk, made by Ben Randall of Philadelphia, on which T. J. wrote the Declaration of Independence. [2262]

did.unittitle: Misdated 1824. ROBLEY DUNGLISON, University, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #4000. Printed: Dorsey, 43.

scopecontent.p: Will accept no money. T. J.'s health. [3079-a]

did.unittitle: RUFUS KING, London, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #4106.

scopecontent.p: Negotiations with Foreign Office re Charles Bonnycastle's bond successful. [3080]

did.unittitle: RUFUS KING, London, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Contemporary copy. Endorsed by T. J. #1235.

scopecontent.p: Virginia will not be called upon for the forfeiture of Charles Bonnycastle's bond. Instruments ordered from Mr. Barlow. Reference to George Canning. [2263]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ROBLEY DUNGLISON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. McGregor Library. #4000. Printed: Dorsey, 44-45.

scopecontent.p: Draft on Mr. Raphael. [3081]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to REMBRANDT PEALE.

scopecontent.p: Asks Peale's opinion of Cornelius DeBreet of Baltimore as a possible teacher of landscape painting for University of Virginia. [3081-a]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 357-358.

scopecontent.p: Death of his brother-in-law, Dr. Carter, prevents his attendance at Board of Visitors' meeting. New regulations at the University. References to John Hartwell Cocke, Thomas Cooper, Chapman Johnson, George Loyall, and [George] Tucker. [2264]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM G. WALL, New York, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-745.

scopecontent.p: Requests information on terms of art professorship at University of Virginia, offered to him by Mr. Brown. Offers [Robert?] Greenhow, [David] Hossack, [James] Renwick, and [John] Trumbull as references. [2265]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Instructions regarding professors' salaries, proctor's quarters and salary, store rooms, and a post office at the University. [2266]

did.unittitle: ROBLEY DUNGLISON PRESCRIPTION FOR THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ANS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. McGregor Library, #4000. Printed: Dorsey, 48-49.

scopecontent.p: Rhubarb and magnesia. For severe pain, laudanum. [3082]

did.unittitle: RUFUS KING, London, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: LS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Another contemporary copy. #1235.

scopecontent.p: Sends dispatch from George Canning concerning the Bonnycastle bond, notice of which has been given to Peter Barlow. Mr. Warwick of Virginia to ship the apparatus for the University. [2267]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM B. GILES.

scopecontent.p: Usurpation of States rights by federal government. Federal court. Power over commerce, agriculture, and manufacture. Construction of roads and canals. Mentions John Quincy Adams, Federal party, and Hartford Convention. Progress of the University of Virginia, teaching of Latin, and University professors. [3082-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Request for copies of the last University of Virginia advertisement. [2268]

did.unittitle: WILLIAM H. ELLIOTT, Charlotte Court House, Va., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for position of librarian. Mentions Henry St. George Tucker. [2269]

did.unittitle: ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH to BOARD OF VISITORS, UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.

scopecontent.p: Fragmentary draft of TB-2270; see below.

did.unittitle: ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH, PROCTOR, UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. DEED TO THOMAS JEFFERSON, JAMES MADISON, JAMES BRECKENRIDGE, CHAPMAN JOHNSON, JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, JOHN HARTWELL COCKE, and GEORGE LOYALL, VISITORS.
did.physdesc: AD by T. J. 3 pp. Draft. Barrow. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Conveying title of University lands from the Proctor to Rector and Visitors. Four parcels of land formerly owned by John M. and Francis T. Perry, and by Daniel A. and Mary A. F. Piper. [2270]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON STATEMENT OF CASH ADVANCED TO PROFESSORS OF UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3.

scopecontent.p: Advances to George Blaettermann, Charles Bonnycastle, Robley Dunglison, Thomas Hewett Key, and George Long from October through December 1824. [2271]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON NOTES ON PROFESSORS' HOUSING AT UNIVERSITY.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by Laurence G. Hoes. #3159.

scopecontent.p: Professors Long, Key, Emmet, Tucker, Blaettermann, Bonnycastle, and Dunglison. Tenants Edwin Conway, E. B. Chapman, Warner Minor, George W. Spotswood, John Gray, and John D. Richeson. Builders James Dinsmore, James Oldham, Mr. Nelson, Richard Ware, John M. Perry, and John Neilson. [3084]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON NOTES ON UNIVERSITY CURRICULUM.
did.physdesc: AD. 2 pp. Photostat. Original owned by James Monroe Museum and Memorial Library, Fredericksburg. #3159.

scopecontent.p: Subjects to be taught. [3085]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. "ANATOMICAL THEATRE."

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA. STUDY. PLAN OF CLINICAL AMPHITHEATRE.
did.physdesc: Ink. Paper BD. 12 / 11 3/4 in. #171.

scopecontent.p: Drawn by John Neilson. For the history and various states of this and other prints, see Betts, "Ground Plans and Prints," pp. 81-90. There are seven other copies at the University of Virginia (21 x 18 3/4; 21 3/4 x 19 1/4; and about 21 3/4 x 19 in.) [N-385]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, CLASSIFICATION BY AGE OF STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE FIRST SESSION OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA.

scopecontent.p: For the academic year 1825-1826. List of professors on verso.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM F. GORDON.
did.physdesc: L. 2 pp. Extract by N. P. Trist, ca. 1830. Printed: Ford X 358-359; B of R VI 186 (MS. in DLC). #38-414-a.

scopecontent.p: Is weakened in body and mind by infirmities. States' rights usurped by the Federal Government. References to the South Carolina Resolutions, Van Buren's motion, and Baylies' proposition. [2275]

did.unittitle: PHILIP STURTEVANT, Richmond, to ARTHUR [SPICER] BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.801.

scopecontent.p: Impossible to cut the composite capitals for thirty dollars each.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM G. WALL, New York.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. File draft. Endorsed by T. J. #38-745.

scopecontent.p: John P. Emmet will answer his enquiries concerning art position at University. [2272]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to [WILLIAM SHORT].

scopecontent.p: T. J. writes to Short about contacting Mr. [Herman] Böÿe about the return of his "fine Borda's Circle of Reflection" and his best telescope, since he has given them to the University of Virginia. Böÿe was in Philadelphia "attending the engraver of his map" of Virginia for which Jefferson had lent the instruments.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to ARTHUR SPICER BROCKENBROUGH.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-5/3. Another MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Placement of the temporary bell. Book shelves needed. University advertisements. [2273]

did.unittitle: JAMES MADISON, Montpellier, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #10428-b.

scopecontent.p: Madison writes regarding the qualifications of a Mr. Walls for Drawing Master at the University and the unlikelihood that he would come since his position in New York was more remunerative. He mentions Jefferson's suggestions to John Patten Emmet.

did.unittitle: JEFFERSON NEILSON, Transylvania University, Ky., to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-745.

scopecontent.p: Asks requirements for entering senior class. [2274]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to C[LAIBORNE] W[ATTS] GOOCH, Richmond.
did.physdesc: ALS. 2 pp. #3921-b. Printed: L and B XVI, 151-53.

scopecontent.p: Federal powers better contained by South Carolina resolutions, Van Buren's motions, and Francis Baylies' propositions than by action of state of Virginia. [3085-a]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to EDWARD A. TURPIN.

scopecontent.p: T. J. discusses the students and professors at the University, encloses a copy of the University laws and terms of board and tuition [not present], and closes with his family's remembrances and best wishes.

did.unittitle: JOHN A. TALIAFERRO, Charlottesville, to THOMAS JEFFERSON.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Sends references from Charles Hill and John Wood as candidate for office of librarian. [2276]

did.unittitle: MANN A. PAGE, Fredericksburg, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p: Applies for position of librarian to defray his expenses as student. [2277]

did.unittitle: FRANCIS TOMQUIST, New York, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.

scopecontent.p: Sends catalog of instruments for sale, including telescope made by William Herschel. New York Athenaeum also interested. Enclosure: catalog. [2278]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to the BOARD OF VISITORS, UNIVERSITY of VIRGINIA.
did.physdesc: LS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. Circular. Copy sent to John Hartwell Cocke. Cocke Papers, #3184. MS. in DLC.

scopecontent.p: Qualifications of P. P. Barbour, William A. C. Dade, William Preston, William C. Rives, [John?] Robertson, and Dabney Terrell for the law professorship. [2280]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp.; docketed on verso. #16303.

scopecontent.p: Encloses circular [not present] concerning candidates for the law professorship and asks Cabell to share the letter with other members of the Board to save writing multiple copies. Discusses the petition to the General Assembly for permission to sell his property at auction. Suggests the extension to the University of the Riot Act of 1786 for purposes of maintaining discipline. [2279]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to FRANCIS WALKER GILMER.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #38-588. Printed: Davis 250.

scopecontent.p: Dr. Robley Dunglison forbids his visiting Gilmer. Urges him to take care of himself. [2281]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 3 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Partly printed: Cabell 360361.

scopecontent.p: Conference between George Loyall, Chapman Johnson, and Cabell regarding delay in the appointment of a law professor. Action regarding the William and Mary Bill. Conference regarding T. J.'s debts. References to Judge Francis T. Brooke, Judge Dabney Carr, Judge John Coalter, Judge John W. Green, and John T. Lemare. [2282]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello, to WILLIAM WERTENBAKER, Charlottesville.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Another copy: AL. 1 pp. File draft. #38-755.

scopecontent.p: Offering temporary appointment as librarian, replacing John V. Kean. Outlines duties. [2283]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON PURCHASING LIST.
did.physdesc: AD. 1 pp. Photostat. Original in James Monroe Museum and Memorial Library, Fredericksburg. #3159.

scopecontent.p: Wines: Bergasses, Ledanon, Lienoux, Scuppernong, claret from Richmond, virgin oil of Aix, Muscat de Rivesalte, macaroni, and anchovies. [3086]

did.unittitle: JOSEPH CARRINGTON CABELL, Richmond, to THOMAS JEFFERSON, Monticello.
did.physdesc: ALS. 1 pp. Endorsed by T. J. #2791. Printed: Cabell 362.

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON WILL.
did.physdesc: ADS. 4 pp. Owned by the Albemarle County Court. #5145. Printed in facsimile: L & B XIX x. Recorded 7 August 1826 by Alexander Garrett, Clerk.

scopecontent.p: To his grandson, Francis Eppes, a portion of the Poplar Forest tract. All other property is subject to payment of debts, with the residue after payment going to Thomas J. Randolph, Nicholas P. Trist, and Alexander Garrett for the support of Martha Jefferson Randolph and her heirs. Nothing to Thomas Mann Randolph, Jr., to ensure that the assets will not go for payment of his debts. Thomas Jefferson Randolph is appointed sole executor, Trist and Garrett to act in the event of Thomas Jefferson Randolph's death. Codicil dated 17 March gives a gold watch to each grandchild, freedom to his slaves, Burwell, John Hemings, and Joe Fosset. Madison Hemings and Eston Hemings apprenticed to John Hemings until the age of 21 when they are to receive their freedom. To Thomas Jefferson Randolph a silver watch, and all his business and literary papers; to the University of Virginia his library, with a portion of it going to Nicholas P. Trist and Joseph Coolidge, Jr.; to James Madison a walking stick. Recommends to his daughter the care of her aunt, Anna Scott Marks. [2300], [3089]

scopecontent.p:
Rough drafts, finished plans, and specifications for various buildings.
A. Two-story building. Elevation, first and second floor plans. Pen drawings, ink wash. Marked "Plan C". [2336, N-376]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON DRAWINGS.
did.physdesc: 10 pp. 8 T. J. AD. Section D printed: Fiske Kimball, "Jefferson and the Public Buildings of Virginia", Huntington Library Quarterly XII 3 (May 1949) figures 6-7, pp. 308-309, incorrectly attributed to the Coolidge Collection. RG-1/3/3.761.

scopecontent.p:
Rough drafts, finished plans, and specifications for various buildings.
B. Three-story building. Elevation, three floor plans. Pen drawings, ink wash. [2336, N-374]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON DRAWINGS.
did.physdesc: 10 pp. 8 T. J. AD. Section D printed: Fiske Kimball, "Jefferson and the Public Buildings of Virginia", Huntington Library Quarterly XII 3 (May 1949) figures 6-7, pp. 308-309, incorrectly attributed to the Coolidge Collection. #770.

scopecontent.p:
Rough drafts, finished plans, and specifications for various buildings.
C. Five floor plans; pencil sketches with ink specifications, showing varying arrangements of centrally located circular and elliptical rooms. Perhaps drawings for unidentified residences; or tentative sketches proposed for the Capitol and Governor's House in Richmond (actually constructed from other plans); or more probably sketches for the President's House in Washington, made in preparation for anonymous submission of an entry in the competition announced by the Commissioners of Federal Buildings, 1792. [2336, N-409, N-410]

did.unittitle: THOMAS JEFFERSON DRAWINGS.
did.physdesc: 10 pp. 8 T. J. AD. Section D printed: Fiske Kimball, "Jefferson and the Public Buildings of Virginia", Huntington Library Quarterly XII 3 (May 1949) figures 6-7, pp. 308-309, incorrectly attributed to the Coolidge Collection. #770.

scopecontent.p:
Rough drafts, finished plans, and specifications for various buildings.
D. First and second floor plans for a square residence with north and south porticoes, wings connected to the main building by arcades; ink drawings. Students of Jeffersonian architecture have identified these drawings as (1) tentative studies for the President's House and (2) tentative studies for the Governor's House at Richmond. (See Fiske Kimball's article cited above). It may be noted that the one parlor shown occupies less than one ninth of the first floor, which is largely occupied by bedrooms, a nursery, etc.--a much simpler plan than that of the Governor's House at Williamsburg--suggesting that this plan may be for an unidentified country residence. [2336, N-281, N-282]
